Reviews:
["I must say, it's an absolute gem! The food was incredibly delicious, with every dish bursting with flavor. What really stood out was the value for money. For such high-quality food, the prices are exceptionally reasonable, making it one of the best price-performance ratios I've experienced in Berlin. The portions were generous, and the service was attentive and friendly. I'll definitely be back! ğŸ˜Š", "Located at Nollendorfplatz, a bustling district in Berlin, especially at night, you'll find a fantastic Vietnamese restaurant called Sao Mai.

I ordered the Chicken Katsu Curry Mango for less than â‚¬10, which is affordable compared to other restaurants. The portion is generous, the chicken is cooked perfectly and crispy, and the vegetables are fresh. Overall, the food is excellent.

The service is decent, and the most important aspect is the cozy and awesome atmosphere. Highly recommended if you want to try Vietnamese food in this area.", 'The food is good for the price paid.  Donâ€™t expect global standard 5* and you wonâ€™t be disappointed. Ordered tofu and vegetables with rice and it cost around â‚¬7. Nice enough flavours and large portion for the price paid. The service was pleasant and the food was served quickly. One point less because when sitting inside, the place had a â€˜wet dogâ€™ smell and a day later, I cannot get the smell out of my jacket despite using plenty of Febreeze - next time will sit in the tent outside.']

Name: Cevicheria
Summary: Ceviche & grilled seafood, plus pisco sours, in a pared-back dining room or at outdoor tables.
Opening Hours: Monday: 6:00â€¯PMâ€‰â€“â€‰12:00â€¯AM, Tuesday: 6:00â€¯PMâ€‰â€“â€‰12:00â€¯AM, Wednesday: 6:00â€¯PMâ€‰â€“â€‰12:00â€¯AM, Thursday: 6:00â€¯PMâ€‰â€“â€‰12:00â€¯AM, Friday: 6:00â€¯PMâ€‰â€“â€‰12:00â€¯AM, Saturday: 6:00â€¯PMâ€‰â€“â€‰12:00â€¯AM, Sunday: 6:00â€¯PMâ€‰â€“â€‰12:00â€¯AM
Reviews:
['Great ceviche! Very high quality ingredients and the taste. Lovely staff and atmosphere. Highly recommended!', 'Cevicheria in Berlin is a standout dining destination for anyone craving authentic Peruvian cuisine in a vibrant and welcoming atmosphere. This charming restaurant brings the rich flavors of Peru to the heart of Berlin, offering a delightful culinary experience that is both flavorful and memorable.

The menu at Cevicheria showcases a variety of traditional Peruvian dishes, with a particular focus on ceviche, which is prepared with the freshest ingredients and expertly balanced flavors. Each dish is a testament to the skill and passion that goes into creating Peruvian cuisine. The ceviche, in particular, is a highlight, featuring perfectly marinated fish with a zesty, tangy kick that captures the essence of Peruâ€™s culinary heritage.

In addition to the exceptional food, Cevicheria boasts a fantastic selection of drinks. From refreshing pisco cocktails to expertly crafted mocktails, the beverage menu complements the food perfectly and adds to the overall dining experience.

What truly elevates the visit to Cevicheria is the service. The staff are not only attentive and friendly but also genuinely passionate about the food they serve. A special mention goes to "Valery," a great waiter from Peru who adds a personal touch to the experience. Valeryâ€™s warmth, knowledge, and enthusiasm make every meal at Cevicheria feel special. His recommendations and genuine care enhance the dining experience, making guests feel right at home.

Overall, Cevicheria is a must-visit for anyone in Berlin looking to indulge in delicious Peruvian cuisine. With its great food, excellent drinks, and outstanding service, it promises a dining experience that is both enjoyable and authentic.', 'A friend of mine brought me here and introduced me to a lovely owner. We had a great evening here. Amazing food, amazing atmosphere. We are different plates. All prepared with love.
There is  good selection of wine and cocktails ğŸ¸']

['Healthier than German food. Just donâ€™t order the miso soup. Itâ€™s made in front of you form hot water mixed with some liquid that comes out of a plastic, looks artificial and not so healthy', 'This location is always crazy busy because it is in the main train station of Berlin. having said that it is an easy place to grab food for your train ride or a quick coffee not very comfortable to sit inside', "I love the quality of their food, it is mostly healthy, lots of veggies, salads, nuts and herbs. They could add more spices and/or sauce though, to make it even tastier. Unfortunately they have not too many vegetarian options.

Today I bought a sandwich for breakfast, a wrap, a bowl and a cheesecake, crisps, tea and a chai latte. Now sitting on the train with no cutlery, looks like they just forgot about it.

How will I eat my cheesecake and my bowl? I have no idea. Probably a 30 minute walk to the train's restaurant which I wanted to avoid by buying so much food in the first place.

The service was good, otherwise. Friendly, professional and fast.

P.S.: The oatmilk chai latte had an artificial aftertaste, a bit like sweetener maybe? Cannot recommend it."]

The food was tasty, but not exceptionally delicious considering the price.", 'A classic - the schnitzel was so great. Will definitely be back when in Berlin. Reviews:
["Yesterday, I ordered from Smack Burger at BadstraÃŸe 66, Berlin, BE 13357 via Uber Eats. I got their Single Smash Burger and Homemade Fries. It took the delivery guy a long time to find me, and communication was challenging. When I finally got my food, it was really cold.

The fries portion was shockingly small and tasted cold and disgusting. The Smash Burger was better than the fries but still nothing more than an average street burger. Honestly, I'm surprised that over 5,000 people have given them more than 4.5 stars on Uber Eats.", 'Best burger in Berlin. I have visited them multiple times, the taste is consistent as well.
Dine in area is small. Perfect for takeaways.', "First of all, I can say it was the best hamburger I've ever had in my life. We ordered the patty melt. The bread, the meat and the cheese ratio was perfect. It is definitely one of the dishes I will eat next time I come to Berlin. I am very happy to taste such a burger, I really recommend it! ğŸ” ğŸ’–"]

Name: Panda Meister Berlin Ostbahnhof
Summary: Humble counter-serve snack shack doling out Chinese treats, such as dumplings & bubble tea.
Opening Hours: Monday: 10:30â€¯AMâ€‰â€“â€‰9:00â€¯PM, Tuesday: 10:30â€¯AMâ€‰â€“â€‰9:00â€¯PM, Wednesday: 10:30â€¯AMâ€‰â€“â€‰9:00â€¯PM, Thursday: 10:30â€¯AMâ€‰â€“â€‰9:00â€¯PM, Friday: 10:30â€¯AMâ€‰â€“â€‰9:00â€¯PM, Saturday: 11:00â€¯AMâ€‰â€“â€‰9:00â€¯PM, Sunday: 11:00â€¯AMâ€‰â€“â€‰9:00â€¯PM
Reviews:
['The food, atmosphere and service are extremely authentic! The male cook is businesslike and a little chaotic, but very fast and good! The lady is smiling and charming, throwing in some Chinese words. The prices are great, especially for the dumplings - which are probably their specialty and most ordered dish.', "Panda Meister is a hidden gem (but I guess everyone knows already this place). This food truck serves up the most delicious dumplings I've ever had, with a perfect balance of tender, flavorful fillings and delicate wrappers. The pork and veggie dumplings are a standout, bursting with juicy goodness. The dipping chili sauces are the perfect complement, adding an extra layer of flavor. Service is quick and friendly, making it an ideal spot for a tasty, on-the-go meal. To top it off, the lady is always nice and friendly. If you love dumplings, you need to go here ASAP!!", "Good dumplings for good affordable price. The place may looks a little rough but doesn't reflect the food quality at all. It even makes it more authentic. The service is quick and very friendly. The food overall was delicious and filling. The bubble tea is alright but not my taste. It had too much syrup in it. All in all I can recommend everyone who like street food Chinese style.
Also i recommend the other food stalls there. This won't be my last visit and will definitely try Mapo Tofu next time.

Side note: you can also pay electronically (credit card, apple pay etc.). Very convenient."]

Summary: Cafe with modern artwork, a selection of used books, newspapers & magazines, plus regular events.
Opening Hours: Monday: 10:00â€¯AMâ€‰â€“â€‰7:00â€¯PM, Tuesday: 10:00â€¯AMâ€‰â€“â€‰7:00â€¯PM, Wednesday: 10:00â€¯AMâ€‰â€“â€‰7:00â€¯PM, Thursday: 10:00â€¯AMâ€‰â€“â€‰7:00â€¯PM, Friday: 10:00â€¯AMâ€‰â€“â€‰7:00â€¯PM, Saturday: 10:00â€¯AMâ€‰â€“â€‰7:00â€¯PM, Sunday: Closed
Reviews: ["Highly recommend eating here, they have both light sweet/salty breakfast and more consistent food, plus great selection of cakes, including many vegan ones. I recommend the lentil soup. I also got the vegan breakfast but I didn't like they mix fruits with veggies. Plus the view over the window is great. Unfortunately didn't find any book to like", 'Lovely and cosy cafe near U-Bahn Frankfurter Tor. Beautiful and appealing interior. Currently you can have coffee inside with covid test, but outside, on the terrace you can stay without any tests. Tasty and beautifully decorated breakfast. Especially tasty fresh baked, and still warm croissants. Also friendly service. Beautiful place! Thank you :) Btw, there is also books store and shelfs with cheap, second hand books to buy.', 'A pleasant cafÃ© place along Frankfurter Allee in Berlin- Friedrichshain, with an integrated book store/sale. We stopped for a espresso & cappuccino and enjoyed both. There is some cake (nothing extraordinary) and some breakfast plates. The lady serving us was friendly and smiling. In some side rooms books were offered and a flyer with events was placed at each table. We will definitely check some of these musical events soon.']

Name: Skykitchen
Summary: Innovative global dishes & sweeping city views from a sleek 12th-floor space with edgy decor.
Opening Hours: Monday: Closed, Tuesday: Closed, Wednesday: 6:00â€‰â€“â€‰11:00â€¯PM, Thursday: 6:00â€‰â€“â€‰11:00â€¯PM, Friday: 6:00â€‰â€“â€‰11:00â€¯PM, Saturday: 6:00â€‰â€“â€‰11:00â€¯PM, Sunday: Closed
Reviews:
['We had the perfect sky view of the golden hour while having the dessert. Their serving was perfectly just in time until sundown. Excellent service, knowledgeable and attentive team, and the courses were just amazing. I appreciate that they were willing to customise the courses to adjust to my crustacean-molluscan allergy. It truly was an experience to remember and the greatest place to celebrate my boyfriendâ€™s birthday. â¤ï¸

Thank you, Team Skykitchen ğŸŒ¸', 'Amazing degustation menu from beginning until the end with a perfect service and a wonderful view.', 'Decor and ambience reminds me of Alice in wonderland and or Peter Pan â€œfairy tale like.â€ The seating arrangement for 2 person if you like a view is against the lining of the window facing outwards (like in a cafe) as oppose to traditional two person  table top in the middle of the room. The kitchen was behind us with glass over so it was â€œopen kitchenâ€ concept and I love to observe the team as they were super focused.

The staff does extremely well speaking in German and English. They were very personable and provided their favorite wines and were knowledgeable of their menu. Definitely Michelin worthy service. Each dish was presented with an attentive explanation.

The menu i believe is fusion cuisine featuring molecular gastronomy. The â€œonsen egg.â€ was the star of the evening and also their chocolate at the end for dessert. I want to point out the wine menu is very unique and noteworthy due to the fact it features mainly wines from Germany and eastwards. We selected the Slovenian bottle that is only carried at this restaurant and it paired beautifully with the dishes. Highly recommend this bottle if you get a chance to try it.']

Name: VAPIANO Berlin Europaplatz
Summary: Laid-back restaurant featuring made-to-order fresh pasta dishes, along with pizza & salad.
Opening Hours: Monday: 8:00â€¯AMâ€‰â€“â€‰10:30â€¯PM, Tuesday: 8:00â€¯AMâ€‰â€“â€‰10:30â€¯PM, Wednesday: 8:00â€¯AMâ€‰â€“â€‰10:30â€¯PM, Thursday: 8:00â€¯AMâ€‰â€“â€‰10:30â€¯PM, Friday: 8:00â€¯AMâ€‰â€“â€‰10:30â€¯PM, Saturday: 8:00â€¯AMâ€‰â€“â€‰10:30â€¯PM, Sunday: 8:00â€¯AMâ€‰â€“â€‰10:30â€¯PM
Reviews:
['Good price for the cost benefit of it. Food was prepared quickly. The place is a bit confusing, on where you should order the food, where you take it, and etc. The carbonara was average, and the pizza was good. Super convenient the location.', "Great value for money! Food is prepared at the moment so it's hot and full of taste.
Very nice ambience too.
The only con was a member of staff named Ahmed who was totally unhelpful with no willingness to be proactive regarding customer satisfaction, so somebody else had to come and take our order.
But that was a minor stain in our otherwise flawless mealğŸ˜", 'Debating if or not to do this review. The lady at the order counter was either really trying to be incredibly rude, or she is just not good at her job. I asked for a Funghi Risotto with beef to go (donâ€™t judge my order please) and had to repeat it 5 times, slowly, and she still didnâ€™t write it correctly. The kitchen staff was rude when I pointed out that I had ordered it differently and to go. The risotto in question was very mid, at best. No flavour at all. And then the guy at the door, who if was any snarkier would probably show up on one of MTVâ€™s reality shows. Overall, the service was bad, the food was okay, and if I never have to eat at the Hauptbahnhof again I will never visit this place.']

['1) ğŸ‘It is the best place to have a dinner with your small kid

Name: tulus lotrek
Summary: Inventive, multi-course menus & a huge global wine list in a contemporary space with rustic flair.
Opening Hours: Monday: 6:30â€‰â€“â€‰11:00â€¯PM, Tuesday: Closed, Wednesday: Closed, Thursday: 6:30â€‰â€“â€‰11:00â€¯PM, Friday: 6:30â€‰â€“â€‰11:00â€¯PM, Saturday: 6:30â€‰â€“â€‰11:00â€¯PM, Sunday: 6:30â€‰â€“â€‰11:00â€¯PM
Reviews:
['Honestlyâ€¦ one of the best fine dining experiences we ever had in Germany!
Make sure you put this restaurant onto your list.

We are still dreaming about those mouthwatering, umami sauces! ğŸ¤¤ From some we would have loved to get a bucket full of them.

All in all - amazing food and outstanding wines. We went by bottle and we got some amazing recommendations.

We especially loved the laid back vibe and the warm and welcoming staff.

In our opinion they definitely deserve more michelin stars ğŸ¤©', "Great atmosphere! We were greeted warmly with our names written on the table in chalk. The staff are extremely friendly and attentive. However, when it comes to the food, while it features many fancy ingredientsâ€”caviar, carabinero, truffle, buck meat, top-quality sushi riceâ€”and utilizes special preparation techniques like purÃ©e, tartare, and bouillabaisse, the flavors don't always hit the mark. I was a bit disappointed with the â‚¬225 set menu. For instance, the buck meat had a strong gamey flavor mixed with blood, which was quite challenging for me to enjoy. The addition of fried dough made the dish even heavier. On a positive note, there were some delightful surprises. The chawanmushi had a subtle hint of hazelnut flavor, and the scallops featured a pine nut flavor that paired beautifully with the truffle. Given the price, I would probably not return, but it was an interesting experience overall.", 'just excellent menu curation
great for celebrations
atmo is relaxed, calm, everyone minds their own business
we love the staffâ€™s explanation to each course']

Name: Asude Yemek DÃ¼nyasÄ±
Summary: Generously portioned homestyle Turkish dishes like grilled meat platters in a buzzing eatery.
Opening Hours: Monday: 5:00â€¯AMâ€‰â€“â€‰2:00â€¯AM, Tuesday: 5:00â€¯AMâ€‰â€“â€‰2:00â€¯AM, Wednesday: 5:00â€¯AMâ€‰â€“â€‰2:00â€¯AM, Thursday: 5:00â€¯AMâ€‰â€“â€‰2:00â€¯AM, Friday: 5:00â€¯AMâ€‰â€“â€‰1:00â€¯PM, 2:00â€¯PMâ€‰â€“â€‰2:00â€¯AM, Saturday: 5:00â€¯AMâ€‰â€“â€‰2:00â€¯AM, Sunday: 5:00â€¯AMâ€‰â€“â€‰2:00â€¯AM
Reviews:
["My favourite halal restaurant in Berlin. Went there multiple times , and haslama (not in this photo review) is my favourite

Although speaking in English is sometimes challenging but they've big monitors displaying ffoodphotos & name7s make it easier.

It is one of the most busiest restaurants in the street, so you might have to be in queue if it's peak hour'.

Services and food are too good with tea on the house.
We tried the 59th menu. As for the desert, earlier we tried bakalava and kenefa (which is very demanding).

Transportation is very much accessible with U8 & S-bahn are very close to walking distance and bus halltestelle just one block away.

The only downside to me is that they don't accept the card if the total amount is less than 10 euro.", 'Everything is better than perfect, you do no need to pay too much money as others. Itâ€™s marvellous. Love it â¤ï¸ Also Turkish is at your service â¤ï¸â¤ï¸â¤ï¸', 'This place reminds you a local turkish restaurant. They have food of the day or you can order different type of grill dishes. It never disappoints.

Food portions are quite big and price is good.

We have tried their lahmacun, kuru fasulye, grilled chicken and kofte sandwiches. All are very tasty and fresh. They serve cacik sauce or salad with all dishes. Both are also super yummy.

We come here again and again, so highly recommended.']

I have eaten here in the past and it is tasty, without pomp or pretense, much how I personally like things to be.']

Name: Midtown Grill
Summary: Modern, airy steakhouse restaurant with lounge music & banquettes, also serving seafood & cocktails.
Reviews:
['This Chain Steak House
Is supposed to be the
Equivalent of my Fave
Steak House by Ruthâ€¦.
Well it is definitely NOT.
I got an advertisement via
Instagram for a RIBS and
Beer 4th of July Cookout
BBQ featuring all the RIBS
You can eat along with
Other Grilled favorites.
LIes they told.
Not one of the several
Items served came from
A Hot Grill.
Nor  did the Only Rib
Option which happen
To be some Strange
BBQ sauced Cold
Korean??? Babyback Ribs.
The Sauce was not Korean
nor American and was not
Grilled with the meat because
This meat was never grilled.
The only HOT ITEM was ONE
Of the two French fry Choices.
The wait staff was more interested
In the SINGLE GIRL in the RED DRESS
than they were about serving
Anything HOT.
This was a BAIT and SWITCH.
And HIGHLY disappointing.
The guacamole was from a can.
The melted cheese wasnâ€™t even
Whiz, it was some canned concoction
As well as the salsa which is so easy
to prepare . And why am I even
Eating NACHOS at a RIB BBQ?
Because there were literally NO
RIBS featured. Especially the ones
OFF the  Grill Sticky and
Smoked Tender and Tasty.
The waiter and I mean that
Literally WAIT_er. I had to call
Him over SEVERAL times because
I had WAITED with no attention,
Warned us about the amount
Of Food and said order one burger
It might be too much! Then he
Brings this BURNT turd on an
Oversized bun with sauce I said
Not to be added. I looked and
Laughed and handed the two
Two bite burnt turd burger with
Sauce I did not order to my
Dining partner. Who immediately
Took the bread away and ate the
Tiny Turd burgers. As they over
cooked and under seasoned.
If this was supposed to be a
â€˜Teaseâ€™ for me to come back
and try your full menu you
FAILED miserably.
My Death By Chocolate
was supposed to be a dark
Chocolate ice cream and
a layered chocolate mousse.
Well the ice cream melted and
the plastic cover took 1/3 of
The Mousse away because it
wasnâ€™t delivered by the WAIT_er
On Time.
And then came the FINAL
BLOW. The knockout Punch.
Pride Month is Over and the
Restaurant returned to â€˜Straightâ€™
Wineâ€¦â€¦â€¦.Literally.
Which was actually the BEST
Part of the Entire Meal. A Riesling
FRESH yet Full Bodied Giving
Scents of Spring and early Summer.
So sensual we finished a Bottle.
Lecker. Unlike the Meal.', "An exquisite restaurant where you can come for a special evening with your friends and family. It truly deserves every star with its rich menu, service and taste. I was also lucky enough to have the gluten-free bread option (which tasted delicious). We really wanted cheesecake for dessert, but it wasn't available anymore. We tried chocolate mouse instead, and it was also very successful. The wines were delicious, I would like more Argentinian wine. Rib eye was delicious. Thank you Midtown Grill Berlin!", 'I visited this restaurant based on its high Google review score and ordered a ribeye and a cola for 55â‚¬, which I found overpriced. Despite the restaurant being empty, the waiter rudely asked me to move from a comfortable 4-person table to a cramped 2-person table with a sunshade pole obstructing the middle, making it very inconvenient. Although the food was good, the waiterâ€™s unprofessional behavior and poor service were unacceptable. If you donâ€™t mind the cost, the food is decent, but for a better atmosphere, I recommend looking elsewhere.']

Name: Restaurant Pasternak
Summary: Intimate, parquet-floored dining spot with crystal chandeliers & a piano, serving Russo-Jewish fare.
Opening Hours: Monday: 9:00â€¯AMâ€‰â€“â€‰12:00â€¯AM, Tuesday: 9:00â€¯AMâ€‰â€“â€‰12:00â€¯AM, Wednesday: 9:00â€¯AMâ€‰â€“â€‰12:00â€¯AM, Thursday: 9:00â€¯AMâ€‰â€“â€‰12:00â€¯AM, Friday: 9:00â€¯AMâ€‰â€“â€‰12:00â€¯AM, Saturday: 9:00â€¯AMâ€‰â€“â€‰12:00â€¯AM, Sunday: 9:00â€¯AMâ€‰â€“â€‰12:00â€¯AM
Reviews:
['One of the best restaurants you will find in this area and is worth a visit for some breakfast, brunch or lunch.

A big East European influence throughout the menu. Their breakfast choices, especially No2, is fantastic, as are the pancakes, which I was reliably informed once again by the "experts" in my family, were really really good.

Coffee was excellent as was their home made lemonade.

Service and atmosphere are first rate and deserve a mention. A great choice if the weather looks half decent as well.

There is a lot to choose from in this area, and still, this one sits above the others I have been to. Highly recommended.', "Classic eastern european style place in a nice, relaxing neighborhood with beautiful scenery if you choose to sit outside.

Food was amazing and beautifully presented on the plate. I mainly went because I was craving borscht and I was satisfied. The lunch(?) plates were packed with many components and each of them delicious. Many veggie options to choose from, you don't feel like it's just an afterthought. Vegan options also available.

Price is a bit on the higher end but because the food is good it's worth it for me. Service was friendly and fast.", 'The salmon was incredibly soft and tasty. Staff were friendly except at the end we couldnâ€™t get the attention of the waiter after we paid with a credit card. We returned the credit card machine to the counter.']

Name: Ristorante Masaniello
Summary: Casual Italian restaurant with a patio & rustic surrounds, offering Neapolitan wood-fired pizzas.
Opening Hours: Monday: 5:00â€¯PMâ€‰â€“â€‰12:00â€¯AM, Tuesday: 5:00â€¯PMâ€‰â€“â€‰12:00â€¯AM, Wednesday: Closed, Thursday: 5:00â€¯PMâ€‰â€“â€‰12:00â€¯AM, Friday: 5:00â€¯PMâ€‰â€“â€‰12:00â€¯AM, Saturday: 5:00â€¯PMâ€‰â€“â€‰12:00â€¯AM, Sunday: 12:00â€¯PMâ€‰â€“â€‰12:00â€¯AM
Reviews:
['We took pizza take away, but we waited inside and there was sooo nice atmosphere ğŸ”¥and pizza was awesome!!!

Thank you very much!', 'Pizza....and Pizza...After the restaurant got bigger, it lost a bit of the atmosphere, but the food keeps the quality over many visits and gives some variation in the daily menu, so you can get surprised. Maybe the best pizza in Berlin (Maybe no more since 2019 but still good). Pasta with swordfish was delicious! Great with kids in Summer... Friendly and attentive Staff. P.S. Number 16 is really great!', "Down to earth place serving hearty southern Italian cuisine. Popular for its pizza. Large variety. We ordered both pasta and pizza and it didn't disappoint.
There were a lot of families dining when we were there during dinner. Perhaps a testament to its quality and value for money.
Servings are rather large and it's inexpensive.
Service is attentive too. Highly recommended."]

Name: Domino's Pizza Berlin SchÃ¶neberg-nord
Summary: Delivery/carryout chain offering a wide range of pizzas & a variety of other dishes & sides.
Reviews:
['do not order food there! it can barely be called food anyways. i took one bite of my pizza and just couldnt justify eating on ... i see the money paid as an investment in my health, by not eating what was delivered. if you know and value a fresh good pizza you just cant have it from dominos. very low quality ingredients. the pizza felt plastic-like and my body rejected it immediately. it would have made for a perfect movie-prop though. dominos isnt even a last resort for â€šfoodâ€˜ its non existant if you ask me.', "It all started in Ireland a few years ago... with this HUNGERRRRR for Domino's Pizza, it was exquisite!
Then.... I moved to Germany. So, I had to continue my tradition of 'exquisitenes'. BUT... to my surprise I had to face a lot of UPs and DOWNs regarding Domino's.
Firstly, the closest Domino's to Essen was the one in Velbert (17 km away) and the stretch...YES, it was reaaaally worth it. Just like before, same delicious garlic sauce (from which I bought separately 40 of them just to have at home :D)...the good old pizza!
Next time I went there, to my surprise...the shop was closed (forever!); no note, nothing. Nada. Zilch. Zero.
So,...I sighed and waited patiently the next ocassion to put my hands on a Domino's Pizza.
JACKPOT!!! In a few months a Domino's Franchise was opened...guess where...in Essen. Yahoo!
I was a bit puzzled when I got there. Different menus, different sauce size (and different look), different prices, different Pizza boxes and also the thing I was most afraid of: different recipe. It left me with a bad taste, both ways. But hey, it could have been a bad day for the guys so I ordered again from there; BIIIG mistake; I should have listened to my guts.
Long time, no eat. I / or Domino's Pizza in Germany got a new chance. In Hamburg. We thought...why not build our own usual pizzas so as to compare it with the ones before. If the pizza in Essen was eatable but not preferable anymore I can only say that in Hamburg we each ordered a big pizza, from which we each ate one slice and...the rest of it someone on the street seemed to be grateful for.
Next: DÃ¼sseldorf. First time, last time!
Toulouse (France) seemed to me that maybe will be different than the recipe in Germany. It was the same...'difference'.
It made no difference anymore.
I was already fed up with Domino's.

But here I am...ordering Domino's again. I was thinking: man, since I will anyway be here (Berlin) for a short while, why not just try it 'cause afterwards I will anyway not order anymore.
So, I was kind of 'afraid' but I was expecting it this time. No alarms and no surprises!..

I was like: oh my GOOOOSH, this is good. I ate a big pizza and when I finished it I wanted another one :D.
Today, I was like: I either do the most stupid spending of all times or I get myself not one, not 2, but 3 slices of heaven. I was again afraid because I was thinking that that pizza was good by mistake.

And I ordered (the heaven part)! As you can see in the image, the pizzas were already with me but the delivery has not even started in the live preview. They were hot, gorgeously looking ... pizzas!
You know that feeling when there is something soooo goooood that you cannot stop eating but you know you have to stop, otherwise you will be like a bug with the belly button up... yeah... I had to stop or I would have faced the acidity week :D

Anyway, long story short: I do not like to leave comment and reviews BUT in this case... BRAAAAVOOOOO Domino's Pizza Berlin SchÃ¶neberg-Nord, Potsdamer StraÃŸe 70, 10785 Berlin, YOU have restored my faith in Domino's Pizza AGAIN!

We will see next week what Stuttgart will have on the table for me ;)

Domino's Pizza: consume responsibly!", 'Ordered 2 pizzas and 2 sides online to go. Accidentally overlooked that one pizza had an ingredient that I did not want, called in, and they were super accommodating and fixed it for me. Pizzas were good and the staff was very friendly!']

Name: Borchardt

Reviews:
["A restaurant where you can enjoy German cuisine.
The atmosphere in the back garden was nice and open, but it felt a bit cramped due to the number of tables.
The waiter was very friendly, and I didn't experience any of the negative impressions mentioned in other reviews.
The food was tasty, but not exceptionally delicious considering the price.", 'A classic - the schnitzel was so great. Will definitely be back when in Berlin. We also tried the steak tartar and it was excellent!', 'The best place to try the Wiener Schnitzel. The portions were massive, you can share 1 for 2 people. I liked the veal, potato salad and the cranberry sauce. Passion martini was also good. The restaurant has a nice ambiance but tables are too close to each other and it can get loud sometimes.']

Name: TZOM - Eritrean Restaurant
Summary: Compact restaurant dishing up homestyle Eritrean cooking amid laid-back surroundings.
Opening Hours: Monday: Closed, Tuesday: 5:00â€‰â€“â€‰10:00â€¯PM, Wednesday: 5:00â€‰â€“â€‰10:00â€¯PM, Thursday: 5:00â€‰â€“â€‰10:00â€¯PM, Friday: 5:00â€‰â€“â€‰10:00â€¯PM, Saturday: 12:00â€‰â€“â€‰10:00â€¯PM, Sunday: 12:00â€‰â€“â€‰10:00â€¯PM
Reviews: ["Went here to try something I haven't tried before, I wasn't expecting too much but TZOM FAR exceeded my expectations! Not only were the portion sizes large, everything we tried tasted incredible and the waitress was super attentive and friendly. The mixed platter for 1 was great to try out a few different flavours, the fatta was a huge portion and my personal favourite was the deep fried bread strips with minced meat and yogurt, definitely a must-try here!\n\nI've never had Eritrean food (or anything similar to it even) before, can safely say it's definitely worth checking out! We ended up paying about 51 euros in total, for the amount of food we got I'd say you can't ask for much better value.", 'Everything was beyond excellent. We loved the food from TZOM, super tasty and flavorful. The service was exceptional. Highly recommend to any foodies', 'We ordered platters to share to get a taste of everything. The food was delicious. The sauce with mushroom was on a spicier side. But the taste of everything else together balanced it. So talk to the server before ordering the food regarding the spice level, if you cannot handle the spice. In all, delicious food. Totally recommend it.']

Name: Pizza Hut
Summary: Popular delivery, carry-out & dine-in chain known for pizza, wings & pasta, plus sides & desserts.
Opening Hours: Monday: 11:00â€¯AMâ€‰â€“â€‰10:00â€¯PM, Tuesday: 11:00â€¯AMâ€‰â€“â€‰10:00â€¯PM, Wednesday: 11:00â€¯AMâ€‰â€“â€‰10:00â€¯PM, Thursday: 11:00â€¯AMâ€‰â€“â€‰10:00â€¯PM, Friday: 11:00â€¯AMâ€‰â€“â€‰11:00â€¯PM, Saturday: 11:00â€¯AMâ€‰â€“â€‰11:00â€¯PM, Sunday: 11:00â€¯AMâ€‰â€“â€‰10:00â€¯PM
Reviews: ['Amazing pizzas soft bread and hot n crusty! We were delighted by the service of Ms. Josephine so sweet friendly, offered great suggestions. Overall lovely experience always.', "I just order from there and I think it was the most disgusting pizza I ever ate in my life. We know that this style it's more greasy than a normal pizza. But this was pure fat ğŸ¤¢. You can eat there if you want to have heart attack", 'I went there today with my family. We have ordered 1 large pan pizza with 5 toppings, 1 small pan pizza with 5 toppings, 1 small Pepsi, 1 small Pepsi zero and 1 large Lipton icetea. The food was good as usual. When I asked for the bill I was a bit in hurry because of my parking space. So I didnâ€™t check the bill properly. The bill was 65.40â‚¬ and I gave 72.00â‚¬ and paid with my credit card. At home I resolved that she charged me to much for the food. It should be 45.50â‚¬ total. This is the last time I go to this place. Itâ€™s ridiculous that this place scams their customers.']

Name: Sotto

Opening Hours: Monday: Closed, Tuesday: Closed, Wednesday: 5:00â€‰â€“â€‰10:00â€¯PM, Thursday: 5:00â€‰â€“â€‰10:00â€¯PM, Friday: 5:00â€‰â€“â€‰10:00â€¯PM, Saturday: 5:00â€‰â€“â€‰10:00â€¯PM, Sunday: 5:00â€‰â€“â€‰10:00â€¯PM
Reviews: ['I have been here a couple of times already and always good. Last time I finally tried something else then pizza. I had some truffle gnocchi with legumes. Really delicious. As a starter we shared asparagus carpaccio which was lovely too. If you donâ€™t have a reservation this place is usually a hit of a struggle but totally worth it. Unfortunately not fully vegan but mostly!', 'Lovely place with creative vegan pizzas. I had the vegan capriossa and the vegan diavola. The Diavola was the better one, the smoky carrots and spicy chilli oil made it a good vegan rendition of the original which is usually with spicy salami, I think. Iâ€™m not too sure about the almond cream, itâ€™s kinda nice and creamy but not really the best cheese replacement I think. Minus one star because the crust was too burnt because the restaurant was way too packed. Probably come on a less busy day to get the most out of the kitchen. Service staff were lovely.', 'The first time I tried a vegetarian pizza with ingredients I never thought would taste good, I was blown away by how delicious it was. à¸­à¸£à¹ˆà¸­à¸¢à¹à¸ªà¸‡à¸­à¸­à¸à¸›à¸²à¸ \\\\(*o*)//']

Reviews: ["Enjoyable Rodizio style restaurant on the outskirts of town. They are very happy to please you. I had a tough piece of beef, which was inedible and they couldn't do enough to put it right! Basic but satisfactory salad bar, excellent service. I would happily visit again.", 'What a great experience! A ten course meat feast sounds impossible,  but the way it is done is really good. They bring the skewers of the different meats straight from the spit and carve off washer you want at the table. There is good variety,  and buffet vegetables and salad to go with it. Make sure you are hungry when you go! The service we got from Angelo was excellent. Friendly and helpful. Highly recommend', 'Great food, huge variety at the buffet. Meat has never stopped for a minute. Food was delicious, service was friendly and proficient. We had a great time!']

['Great music, kind staff, nice place to have more than a few beers.

Family Business!
Really good Pasta, and i usually have trouble eating Pasta in Restaurants, because i love to Cook them myself.
Nice staff and good atmosphere', 'We stumbled across this restaurant while walking around Berlin. We didnâ€™t have a reservation but they were able to get us in. We sat at a small high top table behind the host stand and it was perfect (the chairs were very comfy for high top chairs).

The food was great! My husband got a truffle butter pasta that was amazing and I got a red sauce pasta. We had a great time and loved the atmosphere.']

Name: Viale dei Tigli
Summary: Long-standing, relaxed eatery with sidewalk tables serving up typical Italian dishes & aperitifs.
Opening Hours: Monday: 12:00â€¯PMâ€‰â€“â€‰12:00â€¯AM, Tuesday: 12:00â€¯PMâ€‰â€“â€‰12:00â€¯AM, Wednesday: 12:00â€¯PMâ€‰â€“â€‰12:00â€¯AM, Thursday: 12:00â€¯PMâ€‰â€“â€‰12:00â€¯AM, Friday: 12:00â€¯PMâ€‰â€“â€‰12:00â€¯AM, Saturday: 12:00â€¯PMâ€‰â€“â€‰12:00â€¯AM, Sunday: 12:00â€¯PMâ€‰â€“â€‰12:00â€¯AM
Reviews:
['Not to be recommended. Everything is overcooked.
Look at the picture of what used to be carrots, beans and potatoes. I did eat the dorade dish, which was also overcooked.
According to the menu it would be on a bed on spinach, but it ended up on top of some rocket.

Just go elsewhere.', 'Everything was delicious! Very quick service with a very friendly and energetic staff.', 'I had the absolute worst experience at Viale dei Tigli. From the moment we walked in, the staff were incredibly unprofessional and downright rude. It felt like they were only interested in taking our money without providing any form of service. Our waiter seemed annoyed and indifferent to our requests, and the food arrived late and cold.

But the worst part is that it is clearly a tourist trap. They do everything to cheat with the bill. We found extra charges and dishes we never ordered. When we pointed this out, the waiter became defensive and tried to explain it away with poor excuses. In the end, we had to fight to get the bill corrected, which ruined the entire experience.

I strongly advise against anyone visiting Viale dei Tigli. If you donâ€™t want to feel cheated and poorly treated, find somewhere else to eat.']

Name: Ristorante Primavera
Summary: Pizza, pasta & grilled steaks at an enduring, family-run dining room with tables in the backyard.
Reviews: ['Great food. Great service. And not too expensive. We could sit in the back garden away from the busy street which was perfect. But be aware, cash only no CC or EC.', "Very friendly staff and prompt service at once! It was quite crowded in and outside so we gave it a try. In general, food quality didn't meet our expectations but the staff and services were so superb. They offer huge portions", "Food was tasty and inexpensive. Service was very good. It was easy to get a table inside, although outside was quite full.\nIt's nice to be able to add a green salad to an Italian meal for a reasonable price... I'd been missing vegetables here in Berlin."]

Reviews: ['Always a good place for some Austrian specialties like Schnitzel, KnÃ¶del, LeberkÃ¤s or Kaiserschmarren. The team is very quick and friendly. Annoyingly, the side wasnâ€™t included in this 20+ euro dish and cost another 4+ euros. I also had the Germ KnÃ¶del for dessert, which was very small but still cost â‚¬9.5. Overall, I found the price to be way too high for the quality of the food. The waiter who served us however was very friendly and attentive, so that was great.', 'The restaurant has a nice atmosphere and the food is good. The spinach dumplings "SpinatknÃ¶del" are amazing as well as the desserts. Staff is friendly and always around.']

Name: Vapiano
Summary: Laid-back restaurant featuring made-to-order fresh pasta dishes, along with pizza & salad.
Opening Hours: Monday: 11:00â€¯AMâ€‰â€“â€‰11:00â€¯PM, Tuesday: 11:00â€¯AMâ€‰â€“â€‰11:00â€¯PM, Wednesday: 11:00â€¯AMâ€‰â€“â€‰11:00â€¯PM, Thursday: 11:00â€¯AMâ€‰â€“â€‰11:00â€¯PM, Friday: 11:00â€¯AMâ€‰â€“â€‰12:30â€¯AM, Saturday: 11:00â€¯AMâ€‰â€“â€‰12:30â€¯AM, Sunday: 11:00â€¯AMâ€‰â€“â€‰11:00â€¯PM
Reviews: ["My recent experience at this restaurant was extremely disappointing. The food was absolutely terrible. We ordered the chicken Alfredo, and to our shock, it came with a mere six tiny pieces of chicken buried in a sea of bland, flavorless pasta. For a dish that costs 20â‚¬, I expected something far more substantial and satisfying. Instead, it felt like we were paying a premium price for a plate of plain pasta with barely any effort put into it. The quality of the food did not even come close to justifying the exorbitant price. I won't be returning and would advise others to avoid this place unless they want to leave hungry and disappointed. Unfortunately no fewer than one star is possible!", 'Reasonable price and superb atmosphere!  It is the first time I went to a branch of Vapiano. Everything was nicely organised. The taste of the food was also pretty good. The presentation was mouthwatering. I enjoyed their entire system. It was a great experience. If you like pasta/pizza it is a worthy place.', 'As good as it can be. Food was good, portions have big size.\nThe staff was very friendly and helpful.']

Reviews:
['Really nice food and really nice servers! We also had the most delicious rioja with our meal. Highly recommend for lunch or dinner. Good for vegetarians too. Cozy, casual but makes for a special meal with friends or a date night.', 'Sabore by Chef Mario, near Kotti, you can experience the passion for Napolitan cuisine expressed in every dish, from their pizzas, to their pastas, antipasti and desserts

We were impressed us by the quality, presentation and taste of the pizzas, some of which have been honoured with national and international awards

We tried 3 of their pizzas, including the award-winning Pizza Liguori - The Legend (19â‚¬), Pizza Burrata & Mortadella (19â‚¬), and Pizza Diavolo â€œSaboreâ€ (17â‚¬) that came literally in flames!', 'Without a doubt, the best pizza in town! Amazing doe and the highest quality produce for toppings, including the most important ingredient: love (for pizza). Mario is a true Italian "patrone" and Maria provides amazing service. 5 stars!']

Itâ€™s a massive rip off. it costs five euros and is probably 100ml of coffee in the tiniest glass youâ€™ve ever seen.', 'i have been here many times and the coffee tastes different each time. sometimes great, sometimes not', "Coffee and croissants were tasty. I can't rate the sandwiches unfortunately: I asked the staff if they could make me a sandwich leaving out one ingredient as i am pregnant. Name: Ki-Nova
Summary: Warm, trendy eatery offering creative takes on casual meals featuring health-conscious ingredients.
Opening Hours: Monday: 12:00â€‰â€“â€‰8:00â€¯PM, Tuesday: 12:00â€‰â€“â€‰8:00â€¯PM, Wednesday: 12:00â€‰â€“â€‰8:00â€¯PM, Thursday: 12:00â€‰â€“â€‰8:00â€¯PM, Friday: 12:00â€‰â€“â€‰8:00â€¯PM, Saturday: 12:00â€‰â€“â€‰8:00â€¯PM, Sunday: 12:00â€‰â€“â€‰8:00â€¯PM
Reviews:
["The place looks nice but that is pretty much all good I can say about this place. Burger wasn't tasty at all and looked a bit sad alone one the plate and I guess the patty wasn't even freshly made. The Flammkuchen was just some piece from the freezer quickly heated in the oven. There were some thick carots in the curry dish and they were not proberly cooked and still raw in the middle. The salmon dish was alright. Would not come here again as it wasn't the cheapest place. I expected a lot more.", "On a Thursday lunchtime it was empty but was nice inside. We ordered 5 tacos (between 5 people). There was a long wait for the food, so long in fact that two of our group  that were booked into a timed museum slot had to get it to go and pay â‚¬5 each for reusable boxes (shame we are tourists and leaving today). The food was very tasty and we'll presented (when it did come). 3 tacos pp.

To improve it I would have liked the option to add a spicy sause or for a spicy sause on the table (and for it to come a bit quicker).

If there were more than a few people here at a couple of tables, I wonder just how long the wait would be!", 'Nice vibe, maybe music too loud, waiters are kind. A bit pricy compared to other places in Berlin, however we are in a very touristic place.

The bathroom is not inside the restaurant.

I took a Duck Burger, I didnâ€™t like the fact that there were also the duck skin in it. Overall it was really tasty.

I went on a Saturday, at 14:30, lot of tables were reserved. Probably itâ€™s better to book in advance.']

Name: Le Bon

Reviews: ['The Eggs Benedict and Lemon Avocado Toast were absolutely delicious! The flavors were perfectly balanced, and the presentation was spot on. The waffles, though, were the bestâ€”crispy on the outside, fluffy on the inside, and simply unforgettable. Plus, they serve you tap water, which is a nice touch. A must-visit spot in Berlin for a great brunch!', 'Amazing eggs Benedict and pancakes. Coffee and OJ were good too. Decent price and cozy bar in a quiet space close to the park. Service was kind and friendly and very quick. Definitely would recommend', 'Great place, i had a very good brunch, the music was really good and the staff very nice for the first time since im in Berlin. Very friendly. I had a delicious moment. Thank you, Iâ€™ll definitely come back for something savory this time â˜ºï¸']

Opening Hours: Monday: 9:00â€¯AMâ€‰â€“â€‰3:00â€¯PM, Tuesday: Closed, Wednesday: Closed, Thursday: 9:00â€¯AMâ€‰â€“â€‰3:00â€¯PM, Friday: 9:00â€¯AMâ€‰â€“â€‰3:00â€¯PM, Saturday: 9:00â€¯AMâ€‰â€“â€‰3:00â€¯PM, Sunday: 10:00â€¯AMâ€‰â€“â€‰3:00â€¯PM
Reviews:
["Lovely place with great bagels (tracing their history from the NYC, as I've found out) and service. The lads got a kitchen that's working up to 3 PM, but they went above and beyond to get a bagel to a hungry man (me) and got me a New York Classic (which was very nice). Apart from Classic, my top 1 choice would be reuben-style sandwich. Coffee is great too, water refills are available, overall - can recommend.", 'The bagels are quite stuffed and filling! I had the breakfast bagel with extra bacon and avocado â€” mine was delicious. My boyfriend had the chipotle Turkey bagel and although it was packed with Turkey (yay) it was incredibly (!) bland. Nothing chipotle about this chipotle bagel. We would name it plain Turkey bagel ğŸ˜‚', "Have been thinking for quite a while that there was a serious lack of bagel places in Berlin that were worth going to, and man does this place really fill that void.

The iced coffee was smooth and velvety and the Reuben Sandwich was bomb. Seriously I've been dreaming about the sandwich since I ate it. The bagels have great crunch/chew as well.

10/10 will be back"]

Name: Sam Yuk Gu
Summary: Laid-back eatery preparing traditional Korean BBQ, hot pot & other dishes in hip surrounds.
Opening Hours: Monday: Closed, Tuesday: 5:00â€‰â€“â€‰10:00â€¯PM, Wednesday: 5:00â€‰â€“â€‰10:00â€¯PM, Thursday: 5:00â€‰â€“â€‰10:00â€¯PM, Friday: 5:00â€‰â€“â€‰10:00â€¯PM, Saturday: 5:00â€‰â€“â€‰10:00â€¯PM, Sunday: 5:00â€‰â€“â€‰10:00â€¯PM
Reviews: ["Sam Yuk Gu is a fantastic spot for Korean barbecue, offering a variety of options that capture the fun of dining in Korea. The beer is great, and the friendly staff are always ready to help if you're new to Korean barbecue. The interior design is basic, and it can get quite crowded, especially in the evenings and on weekends. Despite that, I love this place and plan to bring many friends to share in the great barbecue experience.", 'We ordered no. 26 and no. 32.  and Korean fried chicken. Not very recommended. Bowls are full with salad. No.32 meat is all â€Hackenfleischâ€œ.  Taste is just okay, average in Korean food. Overall deco of the restaurant is quite Berlin style, many German, little Asien people. Maybe better try Korean BBQ. Better to reserve a table before going.', "We really enjoyed the chicken bowl and the glass noodles, reminded us of a vacation we did a few years ago when we ate something similar. The service was pretty quick and very friendly. It was a bit loud when the ambulance drove past but otherwise it's okay sitting so close to the street."]

Name: Zur Haxe
Summary: Waiting staff in dirndls & lederhosen serve meaty dishes like pork knuckle at this Bavarian stop.
Opening Hours: Monday: 4:00â€¯PMâ€‰â€“â€‰12:00â€¯AM, Tuesday: 4:00â€¯PMâ€‰â€“â€‰12:00â€¯AM, Wednesday: Closed, Thursday: 4:00â€¯PMâ€‰â€“â€‰12:00â€¯AM, Friday: 4:00â€¯PMâ€‰â€“â€‰12:00â€¯AM, Saturday: 12:00â€¯PMâ€‰â€“â€‰12:00â€¯AM, Sunday: 12:00â€¯PMâ€‰â€“â€‰12:00â€¯AM
Reviews:
["Bavarian themed restaurant, serving up a host of traditional German/Bavarian meals, from schnitzel, sauerkraut, dumplings, and their speciality slow cooked (roasted and boiled) pork knuckle and lamb shank dishes.
The restaurant is beautifully decorated in traditional Bavarian decor, and the staff is kitted out in traditional outfits, which adds to the experience - one waiter, who is a funny friendly guy, even went so far as to grow an impressive beard (see pics)
Even more impressive is the food, which is rustik and homely. I had the goulash soup as a starter, which was hearty with a full depth of flavour, with a generous portion of thick cut veg and chunks of beef, and a generous portion. I then had the slow roast pork knuckle, with potato dumplings and sauerkraut, with a kind of gravy sauce. The pork fell off the bone, and was tender and moist, coated with a beautifully crisp and fatty crackling, which was all made to work with the sauce and sauerkraut to cut through the richness of the fat.
The portion sizes were HUGE, and definitely something you could share with 2 people, if you don't feel like you could face a whole portion on your own, which I had to force myself to do.
I had a look at the schnitzel another table had next to me, and vowed to go back just to try that when next in Berlin, it looked so good!
As well as the amazing food, the staff were super warm, friendly, and accommodating. I turned up without a booking, and they happily squeezed me in between bookings without making me feel a nuisance.
I had a lovely pint of Warsteiner with the meal, and all in all it came to only â‚¬30.50 (Â£25) which, in the UK could easily be double that amount. Considering the portions are enough for 2, then I'd say that's great value for money.
I can't recommend this place more!", 'Homely Bavarian restaurant with lovely warm atmosphere. The food is great, the service is always very good.', 'A nice and traditional German restaurant with spacious and cozy environment. The foods are very clean and delicious. I specially like schnitzel a lot. The desserts here are very delicious and not too sweet. Vanilla ice cream is perfect taste. I recommend to visit this place. The staff are nice and friendly.']

Name: EINSTEIN Unter den Linden
Summary: Stylish cafe-restaurant with historic feel, framed photos, dark wood, plus booth & sidewalk seating.
Opening Hours: Monday: 8:00â€¯AMâ€‰â€“â€‰10:00â€¯PM, Tuesday: 8:00â€¯AMâ€‰â€“â€‰10:00â€¯PM, Wednesday: 8:00â€¯AMâ€‰â€“â€‰10:00â€¯PM, Thursday: 8:00â€¯AMâ€‰â€“â€‰10:00â€¯PM, Friday: 8:00â€¯AMâ€‰â€“â€‰10:00â€¯PM, Saturday: 10:00â€¯AMâ€‰â€“â€‰10:00â€¯PM, Sunday: 10:00â€¯AMâ€‰â€“â€‰6:00â€¯PM
Reviews: ["We visited the restaurant for brunch on a warm Sunday. The staff were very friendly and helped us practice our German, and the food was fantastic - really fresh and we were both very full when we left! The cakes looked lovely but we didn't have room to try them unfortunately - we will have to go back!", 'So sad the Villa where the cafe was located closed last year. It was beloved by Berliners and had went there in 2022 on my first trip to the city. This location is great too. Just a walk away from the Brandenburg gate. The food was good. I had the classic Wien Schnitzel and we had some wine. The portion was huge! It was two slabs of porkchop. We also had some wine and I had the classic Sacher Torte.', "The staff were very nice. The food was unfortunately mid for the price. We ordered the schnitzel, which was pretty ok tho the potatoes on the side were bland as potatoes can be, and I got a mushroom risotto. It was so salty, almost inedible, not sure if it was just a one time fluke or if it's usually like that but I couldn't even taste anything but salt. It's a nice looking restaurant but there are better places to eat."]

Reviews:
['A rich variety of delicious vegetarian meals.
The price is very affordable. The service was quick despite the busy hour.

The sweet potato glass noodles are great as are the rice bowl and the seasonal dishes.
Moreover, I can recommend the homemade drinks.

There portions are filling but not satisfying.

Design and interior are lovely and there is space to eat outside.

Service was exceptionally friendly and helpful. (^_^)', 'Absolutely delicious meal at Vegup. The flavours in all of the dishes were incredible. I had the udon curry and it was very good. Friendly staff, clean and modern restaurant with relaxed atmosphere. Lots of nice options for food and drink', 'Great Asian food - Vietnamese, Korean and more. Interesting deep tastes, good prices and service.']

Name: Coffee shop in the Nikolai Quarter
Summary: Casual eatery with an outdoor patio serving hearty German staples & desserts plus coffee & beer.
Opening Hours: Monday: 11:00â€¯AMâ€‰â€“â€‰11:00â€¯PM, Tuesday: 11:00â€¯AMâ€‰â€“â€‰11:00â€¯PM, Wednesday: 11:00â€¯AMâ€‰â€“â€‰11:00â€¯PM, Thursday: 11:00â€¯AMâ€‰â€“â€‰11:00â€¯PM, Friday: 11:00â€¯AMâ€‰â€“â€‰11:00â€¯PM, Saturday: 11:00â€¯AMâ€‰â€“â€‰11:00â€¯PM, Sunday: 11:00â€¯AMâ€‰â€“â€‰11:00â€¯PM
Reviews:
["I stumbled upon the place while walking through the city.

For context, I do not speak German but I've worked in hospitality for over a decade.

They are understaffed and the one server was clearly overwhelmed and newer.

I had just ordered a glass of white wine and a bratwurst.
When it came to the bill, they were basically arguing with me about payment and items. This only occurred because the other server who wasn't serving me was helping close the bill.

In the end I paid cash, they have something on their menu about how they only take German credit card. No problem with that, I did read that before I sat down and ordered.

I get people get frustrated and overwhelmed but I had actually just wanted another drink (just a glass) not my bill. And again the original server placed the wrong thing on my bill and then tried to charge me for it.

I know I saw a male manager walking around to the other groups. Please help and train your team better.", 'I loved the atmosphere and friendly service
The curry wurst was delicious but the schnitzel was a little chewy for my taste', 'I was attracted to this restaurant by how beautiful the exterior was, looked really traditional.

Itâ€™s a beautiful cozy restaurant, seemed pretty old like it had been passed down from generations. I loved it. In my opinion I doubt the menu is extensive. Well I came here for breakfast. I had English breakfast in my opinion it looked great but I donâ€™t think itâ€™s nice to serve baked beans and bread together close to each other on the same plate. It makes everything messy.

For the same price, Iâ€™ve gotten larger English breakfast spreads. The coffee was cool.

Card payment is allowed so thatâ€™s a good thing.

I dislike pickles ğŸ¤­ğŸ˜¬ğŸ˜£']

Name: Restaurant Paris Moskau
Summary: Fine-dining restaurant in a timber-framed house with garden terrace, serving an international menu.
Reviews: ["Had a few hours to fill, before my train home and was looking for a nice restaurant not too far away. Wow, what a find. The service is exceptional. The food was beautiful and the wine and atmosphere finished the meal off. Located next to a road but the settings mean you don't really notice traffic noise. Salad starter and veal main course   both full of flavour.  Would highly recommend", 'Old school staple in berlin, great central location rustic house with friendly staff. The food left a little to be desired. Itâ€™s ok and that is the problem itâ€™s just ok. Itâ€™s your standard tartarâ€™s steak seafood etc while it tastes good I find for the price it should be perfect. Great date spot as the outdoor seating is lovely and the wine list is perfectly priced!\nMight return,', 'Adorable atmosphere. Lovely service and fantastic food. Starters and mains were displayed lovely and tasted even better. Definitely worth a visit.']

Name: Hindi
Summary: Spicy meat & veg curries, plus grills & rice dishes in a chic venue with exposed brick walls.
Opening Hours: Monday: 11:30â€¯AMâ€‰â€“â€‰11:00â€¯PM, Tuesday: 11:30â€¯AMâ€‰â€“â€‰11:00â€¯PM, Wednesday: 11:30â€¯AMâ€‰â€“â€‰11:00â€¯PM, Thursday: 11:30â€¯AMâ€‰â€“â€‰11:00â€¯PM, Friday: 11:30â€¯AMâ€‰â€“â€‰11:00â€¯PM, Saturday: 11:30â€¯AMâ€‰â€“â€‰11:00â€¯PM, Sunday: 12:00â€‰â€“â€‰11:00â€¯PM
Reviews:
['Server was super nice. You get a free chip thing and sauces which I love. Food was good although Iâ€™ve had better. I wish there was a bit more chicken in the chicken korma. Street is quiet and they have plenty of outdoor seating. Would definitely go back!', "This restaurant is amazing! Great prices for amazing food! When I came to them, it turned out that they serve lunch of the day and it's 7.50-7.90 for a full meal with soup. I was scared about the high prices in Berlin, but it's not true. I got a great, delicious soup, main meat dish, delicious, tender chicken, basmati rice and naan. After 8 hours without food, I was immensely happy. By the way, if I'm not mistaken, all the neighborhood restaurants offer a more expensive lunch. Thank you so much for that lunch!", 'Really good food at an amazing price.

Good quality Indian curry served in nice surroundings. The menu has lots of options for those wanting meat, fish or vegetables.

They sell cocktails, milkshakes and have beer on draught.

We had four main courses with rice,  naan bread and dessert... And a few beers. And we spent less than 100â‚¬. We all left feeling full.

There is plenty of parking across the street.']

Name: Panda Meister Berlin Ostbahnhof
Summary: Humble counter-serve snack shack doling out Chinese treats, such as dumplings & bubble tea.
Opening Hours: Monday: 10:30â€¯AMâ€‰â€“â€‰9:00â€¯PM, Tuesday: 10:30â€¯AMâ€‰â€“â€‰9:00â€¯PM, Wednesday: 10:30â€¯AMâ€‰â€“â€‰9:00â€¯PM, Thursday: 10:30â€¯AMâ€‰â€“â€‰9:00â€¯PM, Friday: 10:30â€¯AMâ€‰â€“â€‰9:00â€¯PM, Saturday: 11:00â€¯AMâ€‰â€“â€‰9:00â€¯PM, Sunday: 11:00â€¯AMâ€‰â€“â€‰9:00â€¯PM
Reviews:
['The food, atmosphere and service are extremely authentic! The male cook is businesslike and a little chaotic, but very fast and good! The lady is smiling and charming, throwing in some Chinese words. The prices are great, especially for the dumplings - which are probably their specialty and most ordered dish.', "Panda Meister is a hidden gem (but I guess everyone knows already this place). This food truck serves up the most delicious dumplings I've ever had, with a perfect balance of tender, flavorful fillings and delicate wrappers. The pork and veggie dumplings are a standout, bursting with juicy goodness. The dipping chili sauces are the perfect complement, adding an extra layer of flavor. Service is quick and friendly, making it an ideal spot for a tasty, on-the-go meal. To top it off, the lady is always nice and friendly. If you love dumplings, you need to go here ASAP!!", "Good dumplings for good affordable price. The place may looks a little rough but doesn't reflect the food quality at all. It even makes it more authentic. The service is quick and very friendly. The food overall was delicious and filling. The bubble tea is alright but not my taste. It had too much syrup in it. All in all I can recommend everyone who like street food Chinese style.
Also i recommend the other food stalls there. This won't be my last visit and will definitely try Mapo Tofu next time.

Side note: you can also pay electronically (credit card, apple pay etc.). Very convenient."]

Name: Skykitchen
Summary: Innovative global dishes & sweeping city views from a sleek 12th-floor space with edgy decor.
Opening Hours: Monday: Closed, Tuesday: Closed, Wednesday: 6:00â€‰â€“â€‰11:00â€¯PM, Thursday: 6:00â€‰â€“â€‰11:00â€¯PM, Friday: 6:00â€‰â€“â€‰11:00â€¯PM, Saturday: 6:00â€‰â€“â€‰11:00â€¯PM, Sunday: Closed
Reviews:
['We had the perfect sky view of the golden hour while having the dessert. Their serving was perfectly just in time until sundown. Excellent service, knowledgeable and attentive team, and the courses were just amazing. I appreciate that they were willing to customise the courses to adjust to my crustacean-molluscan allergy. It truly was an experience to remember and the greatest place to celebrate my boyfriendâ€™s birthday. â¤ï¸

Thank you, Team Skykitchen ğŸŒ¸', 'Amazing degustation menu from beginning until the end with a perfect service and a wonderful view.', 'Decor and ambience reminds me of Alice in wonderland and or Peter Pan â€œfairy tale like.â€ The seating arrangement for 2 person if you like a view is against the lining of the window facing outwards (like in a cafe) as oppose to traditional two person  table top in the middle of the room. The kitchen was behind us with glass over so it was â€œopen kitchenâ€ concept and I love to observe the team as they were super focused.

The staff does extremely well speaking in German and English. They were very personable and provided their favorite wines and were knowledgeable of their menu. Definitely Michelin worthy service. Each dish was presented with an attentive explanation.

The menu i believe is fusion cuisine featuring molecular gastronomy. The â€œonsen egg.â€ was the star of the evening and also their chocolate at the end for dessert. I want to point out the wine menu is very unique and noteworthy due to the fact it features mainly wines from Germany and eastwards. We selected the Slovenian bottle that is only carried at this restaurant and it paired beautifully with the dishes. Highly recommend this bottle if you get a chance to try it.']

Reviews:
['Visited today,
Ordered Tom Yam soup, duck breast and a glass of red wine.
The soup was nice, cost 11â‚¬, the glass of wine was OK cost 8.5â‚¬, the duck breast was absolutely burnt and not edible, cost ~18â‚¬.

The chef has not agreed to cancel the burnt meal and offered a compensation of extra glass of wine which I was not happy about.

The waitress was nice so I tipped her 15% anyway, and the place was cosy overall.', 'A lively, welcoming spot with very friendly staff. The service was a little slow, perhaps short on staff that evening but the food was worth the wait. Beautifully presented and full of fresh ingredients and flavours. Highly recommended!!', 'Well, best food I had in a long while! Staff is very friendly and competent. We were a group of 8, first time visiting Berlin, came here on first evening, then repeated on second - that good ğŸ¤— keep it up guys, doing a great job!']

So good so far, i can see myself returning for a next time.", 'Delicious food and nice ambiance.', 'Worth every euro! Pho was just how it supposed to be. Home made lemonade also was good!']

Reviews: ['I have been here a couple of times already and always good. Last time I finally tried something else then pizza. I had some truffle gnocchi with legumes. Really delicious. As a starter we shared asparagus carpaccio which was lovely too. If you donâ€™t have a reservation this place is usually a hit of a struggle but totally worth it. Unfortunately not fully vegan but mostly!', 'Lovely place with creative vegan pizzas. I had the vegan capriossa and the vegan diavola. The Diavola was the better one, the smoky carrots and spicy chilli oil made it a good vegan rendition of the original which is usually with spicy salami, I think. Iâ€™m not too sure about the almond cream, itâ€™s kinda nice and creamy but not really the best cheese replacement I think. Minus one star because the crust was too burnt because the restaurant was way too packed. Probably come on a less busy day to get the most out of the kitchen. Service staff were lovely.', 'The first time I tried a vegetarian pizza with ingredients I never thought would taste good, I was blown away by how delicious it was. à¸­à¸£à¹ˆà¸­à¸¢à¹à¸ªà¸‡à¸­à¸­à¸à¸›à¸²à¸ \\\\(*o*)//']

To save yourself the hassle, better to just not order from here.', 'We made an order and it was delivered I think in 30 minutes, that was very fast!\nAnd pizza, good, as you wait from American pizzas!', 'Iâ€™ve ordered 2 hours ago and never received my order I tried to cancel my order but I couldnâ€™t what a bad service. Never ordering again. Best advice NEVER ORDER they donâ€™t answer they accept the order and they donâ€™t show you any progress or where your order is.']

Name: Tadim
Summary: Simple venue with outdoor tables, making Turkish dishes like dÃ¶ner kebabs, Iskender kebabs & pide.
Opening Hours: Monday: 9:00â€¯AMâ€‰â€“â€‰12:00â€¯AM, Tuesday: 9:00â€¯AMâ€‰â€“â€‰12:00â€¯AM, Wednesday: 9:00â€¯AMâ€‰â€“â€‰12:00â€¯AM, Thursday: 9:00â€¯AMâ€‰â€“â€‰12:00â€¯AM, Friday: 9:00â€¯AMâ€‰â€“â€‰12:00â€¯AM, Saturday: 9:00â€¯AMâ€‰â€“â€‰12:00â€¯AM, Sunday: 9:00â€¯AMâ€‰â€“â€‰12:00â€¯AM
Reviews: ['Read it on a blog, apparently it was the number one DÃ¶ner Spot and i swear to god. The chicken was inedible. The only redeeming quality were the warm fries and i was hungry. Disgusting', 'Really good dÃ¶ner in Berlin! Sizes are gigantic and it tastes like kiss of Allah!', "We'd heard this was one of the best places for doner in Berlin. The bread was good but neither the meat nor the falafel was anything special. The two men working behind the counter almost seemed as though they'd rather we hadn't come in. Maybe it was an off night but from this experience I'd say you don't need to go out of your way to eat here."]

Name: Tangs Kantine
Summary: Dim sum & classic Szechuan & Shanghai cuisine served in a modest eatery with a sidewalk terrace.
Reviews:
['Tasty authentic food. I ate dimsams, a small portion of wonton soup and cucumber salad (be careful, it is really spicy. I ll be glad to return here. Any smell of cooking in the restaurant, by the way.', 'It gets really busy during lunch time, cash payment only. Food was tasty, love their fluffy white rice!', 'Had imagined itâ€™s a good authentic Chinese place. Maybe it is, if we go back and try some more selections. But overall, it was pretty underwhelming.

Seating outdoors is possible and we got the wok tips (fried dumplings) and the Shanghai Ente and Ente im GlÃ¼ck. Neither of them are that great, the dumplings were fine, nothing spectacular.

Starters came out pretty quick, but food took a pretty long time to come out. So as mentioned earlier, give it a shot but it wouldnâ€™t be on my list of recommendations. An average place for me.']

Name: Skykitchen
Summary: Innovative global dishes & sweeping city views from a sleek 12th-floor space with edgy decor.
Opening Hours: Monday: Closed, Tuesday: Closed, Wednesday: 6:00â€‰â€“â€‰11:00â€¯PM, Thursday: 6:00â€‰â€“â€‰11:00â€¯PM, Friday: 6:00â€‰â€“â€‰11:00â€¯PM, Saturday: 6:00â€‰â€“â€‰11:00â€¯PM, Sunday: Closed
Reviews:
['We had the perfect sky view of the golden hour while having the dessert. Their serving was perfectly just in time until sundown. Excellent service, knowledgeable and attentive team, and the courses were just amazing. I appreciate that they were willing to customise the courses to adjust to my crustacean-molluscan allergy. It truly was an experience to remember and the greatest place to celebrate my boyfriendâ€™s birthday. â¤ï¸

Thank you, Team Skykitchen ğŸŒ¸', 'Amazing degustation menu from beginning until the end with a perfect service and a wonderful view.', 'Decor and ambience reminds me of Alice in wonderland and or Peter Pan â€œfairy tale like.â€ The seating arrangement for 2 person if you like a view is against the lining of the window facing outwards (like in a cafe) as oppose to traditional two person  table top in the middle of the room. The kitchen was behind us with glass over so it was â€œopen kitchenâ€ concept and I love to observe the team as they were super focused.

The staff does extremely well speaking in German and English. They were very personable and provided their favorite wines and were knowledgeable of their menu. Definitely Michelin worthy service. Each dish was presented with an attentive explanation.

The menu i believe is fusion cuisine featuring molecular gastronomy. The â€œonsen egg.â€ was the star of the evening and also their chocolate at the end for dessert. I want to point out the wine menu is very unique and noteworthy due to the fact it features mainly wines from Germany and eastwards. We selected the Slovenian bottle that is only carried at this restaurant and it paired beautifully with the dishes. Highly recommend this bottle if you get a chance to try it.']

Name: Rice On! Berlin
Summary: Modern counter serve offering create-your-own bowls featuring Asian-inspired ingredients.
Address: Berlin Hauptbahnhof â€“ Foodcourt, Europaplatz 1, Berlin
Opening Hours: Monday: 10:00â€¯AMâ€‰â€“â€‰9:00â€¯PM, Tuesday: 10:00â€¯AMâ€‰â€“â€‰9:00â€¯PM, Wednesday: 10:00â€¯AMâ€‰â€“â€‰9:00â€¯PM, Thursday: 10:00â€¯AMâ€‰â€“â€‰9:00â€¯PM, Friday: 10:00â€¯AMâ€‰â€“â€‰9:00â€¯PM, Saturday: 10:00â€¯AMâ€‰â€“â€‰9:00â€¯PM, Sunday: 10:00â€¯AMâ€‰â€“â€‰9:00â€¯PM
Reviews: ['Located at the right spot at the very entrance of Food court in Berlin Central train station, this Asian food joint is more than awesome for its food quality, taste and price! Service is courteous and quick and the meal portions are great enough to fill hungry tummies either before the journey or after! The taste is one of the true definitions of fusion with all overlapping on one another like Indian, Chinese, Thai and Malaysian, suiting all types of taste buds. We bought their chicken ball bowl and tofu bowl and both were simply great! There is a great differentiator in the name of various sauces they carry like green sauce, red sauce, peanut sauce and tamarind sauce and all sauces are great! I would certainly go back again whenever I cross the station! Highly recommended.', 'Fresh, big size dishes, with love. Very tasty. Ate rice with chicken, broccoli, green beans, as much as you want coriander and tastey sauce!', 'I liked it at first glance it, everything looked fresh and clean. The staff was so nice and everything was delicious! I found it quite filling and was fully satisfied with the quality and price. Iâ€™m very happy to have a fast, healthy, delicious food :) definitely gonna revisit when Iâ€™m here again.']

Name: Cafe am Petriplatz
Summary: Coffee, cakes & simple meals in a quaint room with chandeliers & framed art, plus a courtyard patio.
Opening Hours: Monday: Closed, Tuesday: Closed, Wednesday: 9:00â€¯AMâ€‰â€“â€‰4:00â€¯PM, Thursday: 9:00â€¯AMâ€‰â€“â€‰4:00â€¯PM, Friday: 9:00â€¯AMâ€‰â€“â€‰4:00â€¯PM, Saturday: 9:00â€¯AMâ€‰â€“â€‰4:00â€¯PM, Sunday: 9:00â€¯AMâ€‰â€“â€‰4:00â€¯PM
Reviews:
["A wonderful little cafe in Central Berlin.

We came for brunch and had a lovely meal. The waiter / manager / owner was absolutely the most polite man I've met in Germany.

The food and coffee were excellent. We had heard the open pancakes were amazing in Germany and this did not disappoint.

We sat outside and had a great time, the inside was also charming looking.

Highly recommended.", 'Scrambled eggs with onion and potatoes was delicious but a bit salty and peppery. If you do not like salt and pepper that than be aware. The service was kind. The inside is very small but if the weather is good try outside.', 'This became our favourite cafe in Berlin and we went there multiple times. Very friendly and accommodating people and service. Great food (farmers breakfast, pulled pancakes and bratwurst) and really good coffee. Will become our regular stop every time we are here.']

Name: Augustiner am Gendarmenmarkt
Summary: Bavarian-style beer hall, with a dark wood-paneled ceiling & walls, serving South German cuisine.
Opening Hours: Monday: 12:00â€¯PMâ€‰â€“â€‰1:00â€¯AM, Tuesday: 12:00â€¯PMâ€‰â€“â€‰1:00â€¯AM, Wednesday: 12:00â€¯PMâ€‰â€“â€‰1:00â€¯AM, Thursday: 12:00â€¯PMâ€‰â€“â€‰1:00â€¯AM, Friday: 12:00â€¯PMâ€‰â€“â€‰1:00â€¯AM, Saturday: 12:00â€¯PMâ€‰â€“â€‰1:00â€¯AM, Sunday: 12:00â€¯PMâ€‰â€“â€‰1:00â€¯AM
Reviews:
['youâ€™re looking to experience authentic German cuisine and have a great time, head to this Bavarian Brauhaus. Centrally located, this charming restaurant offers a warm and inviting atmosphere. The menu boasts a variety of traditional German dishes, all prepared with care and flavor. Whether youâ€™re a tourist or a local, this restaurant promises a memorable dining experience with its delicious food and welcoming ambiance. The staff is very friendly and helpful. Sometimes itâ€™s better to reserve a table.', "We stumbled across this place by

accident and stopped for a beer to rehydrate ourselves! It's a popular place and is really nice with lots of outdoor street seating, but there can be a bad drain smell on one side we noticed.  The Berlin currywurst was just sausage and chips which we don't recommend over some of the other foods on the menu.

There's not a great choice of food choice for vegetarians though.

Wine spritzer is really nice and the Augustiner hell beer is really good too", "I was hoping for more out of this one! I ordered a Brezel to start, which sadly never came, and our food came out before our drinks (which we ordered first). All of the dishes were good but I was a little bummed by the service and atmosphere, which was a little slammed with tourists, so I get it. I'd say come here for a great beer (which is their specialty) and a decent traditional German meal on the side. But there are better schnitzels and sausages in the area if you're looking for something cozier or tasty. The service was friendly though and we were overall happy we tried it out."]

Name: Ristorante Masaniello
Summary: Casual Italian restaurant with a patio & rustic surrounds, offering Neapolitan wood-fired pizzas.
Opening Hours: Monday: 5:00â€¯PMâ€‰â€“â€‰12:00â€¯AM, Tuesday: 5:00â€¯PMâ€‰â€“â€‰12:00â€¯AM, Wednesday: Closed, Thursday: 5:00â€¯PMâ€‰â€“â€‰12:00â€¯AM, Friday: 5:00â€¯PMâ€‰â€“â€‰12:00â€¯AM, Saturday: 5:00â€¯PMâ€‰â€“â€‰12:00â€¯AM, Sunday: 12:00â€¯PMâ€‰â€“â€‰12:00â€¯AM
Reviews:
['We took pizza take away, but we waited inside and there was sooo nice atmosphere ğŸ”¥and pizza was awesome!!!

Thank you very much!', 'Pizza....and Pizza...After the restaurant got bigger, it lost a bit of the atmosphere, but the food keeps the quality over many visits and gives some variation in the daily menu, so you can get surprised. Maybe the best pizza in Berlin (Maybe no more since 2019 but still good). Pasta with swordfish was delicious! Great with kids in Summer... Friendly and attentive Staff. P.S. Number 16 is really great!', "Down to earth place serving hearty southern Italian cuisine. Popular for its pizza. Large variety. We ordered both pasta and pizza and it didn't disappoint.
There were a lot of families dining when we were there during dinner. Perhaps a testament to its quality and value for money.
Servings are rather large and it's inexpensive.
Service is attentive too. Highly recommended."]

Name: Trattoria Rossini
Summary: A wide Italian menu (including a kids' selection) is prepared at this relaxed & welcoming venue.
Opening Hours: Monday: 12:00â€¯PMâ€‰â€“â€‰12:00â€¯AM, Tuesday: 12:00â€¯PMâ€‰â€“â€‰12:00â€¯AM, Wednesday: 12:00â€¯PMâ€‰â€“â€‰12:00â€¯AM, Thursday: 12:00â€¯PMâ€‰â€“â€‰12:00â€¯AM, Friday: 12:00â€¯PMâ€‰â€“â€‰12:00â€¯AM, Saturday: 12:00â€¯PMâ€‰â€“â€‰12:00â€¯AM, Sunday: 12:00â€¯PMâ€‰â€“â€‰12:00â€¯AM
Reviews:
["The spaghetti carbonara was a bit disappointing. The egg texture wasn't quite what I expected for a carbonara â€“ it seemed scrambled rather than creamy. This made it feel more like pasta with scrambled eggs than the classic sauce.

The apfelschorle unfortunately came without gas, which took away from the refreshing quality.

However, my husband enjoyed his calzone, so there were definitely some good options on the menu.", "We came here for lunch and the place was great.
We ordered a ministroni soup, spagetti Bolognese, pizza capriciosa, and a diavola. The servings were big, we couldn't finish everything, even though we were hungry.
The prices are average, but the servings are bigger than average, so a good value overall.
The dishes were well made, and they took into account our wishes.
The service was great, the personnel were very friendly.
Overall we liked the place and would come again.", 'Delicious food, amazing staff, strong cocktails!
Lovely experience here, the pizzas are very large and also delicious. Tiramisu is worth a try too! Well priced and conveniently located from the S-Bahn at WollankstraÃŸe.']

Name: COZYMAZU
Summary: Compact, stylish venue for Taiwanese noodle dishes & street food, plus a range of teas.
Opening Hours: Monday: Closed, Tuesday: Closed, Wednesday: 5:00â€‰â€“â€‰10:00â€¯PM, Thursday: 5:00â€‰â€“â€‰10:00â€¯PM, Friday: 5:00â€‰â€“â€‰10:00â€¯PM, Saturday: 11:00â€¯AMâ€‰â€“â€‰10:00â€¯PM, Sunday: 11:00â€¯AMâ€‰â€“â€‰10:00â€¯PM
Reviews: ['Such a marvelous restaurant. It is a bit off the track but if you like (or want to try) real authentic Taiwanese cuisine go there!\nGreat Service awesome Tea selection (and presentation). Awesome Brunch on weekends.', 'The special breakfast menu on the weekends is a treat. The taste is rich but balanced. The sides a varied and tasty as well. The whole package together with the atmosphere make for a cozy and fulfilling dining experience and guarantee a good start into your weekend.', 'It is a very nice small but comfortable restaurant specializing with Taiwan food. They have different menus for weekend brunch and normal dinner. I have not tried their normal dinner menu yet, but I really enjoyed the brunch there. The porridge with meat and the pickled fruit were so nice. I would not recommend a spontaneous visiting, it is better to have a reservation beforehead.']

Name: QIU - Bar & Restaurant
Summary: Cocktails & modern German dishes in a chic, contemporary spot in a hotel, with views.
Reviews: ["Qiu Bar and Restaurant at Potsdamer Strasse is a great spot! The atmosphere is cool, the service is friendly, and the food is tasty. I enjoyed trying their menu of delicious dishes. If you're in the area, definitely check it out for a great dining experience!", 'Lovely place with good service and nice food. The waiter was attentive and took good care of us, even gave us some extra bread. The cheese platter was lovely with selected cheeses and what appeared to be home made bread and rhubarb-cherry jam. We enjoyed some more dishes along with selected beer, cocktails and wine. A nice evening!', '5 stars are for the cocktails! (We did not eat) They were perfect! Perfectly mixed, served, decorated. There were 4 of us to go to the movies around the corner, 2 for Oppenheimer, 2 for Barbie. I was in the Barbie fraction, so the 2 of us were able to drink before and after the movie while the Oppenheimer fraction was already or still watching. A real treat. The bar was not very full, rather empty and the cocktails rather expensive. TOTALLY WORTH IT! Nice crisps were served. Wasabi nuts and other snacks were served. Because of the rain, the bar-keeper offered an umbrella. The service was very good.']
