There were a lot of families dining when we were there during dinner. Perhaps a testament to its quality and value for money.
Servings are rather large and it's inexpensive.
Service is attentive too. Highly recommended."]

Name: Domino's Pizza Berlin SchÃ¶neberg-nord
Summary: Delivery/carryout chain offering a wide range of pizzas & a variety of other dishes & sides.
Reviews:
['do not order food there! it can barely be called food anyways. i took one bite of my pizza and just couldnt justify eating on ... i see the money paid as an investment in my health, by not eating what was delivered. if you know and value a fresh good pizza you just cant have it from dominos. very low quality ingredients. the pizza felt plastic-like and my body rejected it immediately. it would have made for a perfect movie-prop though. dominos isnt even a last resort for â€šfoodâ€˜ its non existant if you ask me.', "It all started in Ireland a few years ago... with this HUNGERRRRR for Domino's Pizza, it was exquisite!
Then.... I moved to Germany. So, I had to continue my tradition of 'exquisitenes'. BUT... to my surprise I had to face a lot of UPs and DOWNs regarding Domino's.
Firstly, the closest Domino's to Essen was the one in Velbert (17 km away) and the stretch...YES, it was reaaaally worth it. Just like before, same delicious garlic sauce (from which I bought separately 40 of them just to have at home :D)...the good old pizza!
Next time I went there, to my surprise...the shop was closed (forever!); no note, nothing. Nada. Zilch. Zero.
So,...I sighed and waited patiently the next ocassion to put my hands on a Domino's Pizza.
JACKPOT!!! In a few months a Domino's Franchise was opened...guess where...in Essen. Yahoo!
I was a bit puzzled when I got there. Different menus, different sauce size (and different look), different prices, different Pizza boxes and also the thing I was most afraid of: different recipe. It left me with a bad taste, both ways. But hey, it could have been a bad day for the guys so I ordered again from there; BIIIG mistake; I should have listened to my guts.
Long time, no eat. I / or Domino's Pizza in Germany got a new chance. In Hamburg. We thought...why not build our own usual pizzas so as to compare it with the ones before. If the pizza in Essen was eatable but not preferable anymore I can only say that in Hamburg we each ordered a big pizza, from which we each ate one slice and...the rest of it someone on the street seemed to be grateful for.
Next: DÃ¼sseldorf. First time, last time!
Toulouse (France) seemed to me that maybe will be different than the recipe in Germany. It was the same...'difference'.
It made no difference anymore.
I was already fed up with Domino's.

But here I am...ordering Domino's again. I was thinking: man, since I will anyway be here (Berlin) for a short while, why not just try it 'cause afterwards I will anyway not order anymore.
So, I was kind of 'afraid' but I was expecting it this time. No alarms and no surprises!..

I was like: oh my GOOOOSH, this is good. I ate a big pizza and when I finished it I wanted another one :D.
Today, I was like: I either do the most stupid spending of all times or I get myself not one, not 2, but 3 slices of heaven. I was again afraid because I was thinking that that pizza was good by mistake.

And I ordered (the heaven part)! As you can see in the image, the pizzas were already with me but the delivery has not even started in the live preview. They were hot, gorgeously looking ... pizzas!
You know that feeling when there is something soooo goooood that you cannot stop eating but you know you have to stop, otherwise you will be like a bug with the belly button up... yeah... I had to stop or I would have faced the acidity week :D

Anyway, long story short: I do not like to leave comment and reviews BUT in this case... BRAAAAVOOOOO Domino's Pizza Berlin SchÃ¶neberg-Nord, Potsdamer StraÃŸe 70, 10785 Berlin, YOU have restored my faith in Domino's Pizza AGAIN!

We will see next week what Stuttgart will have on the table for me ;)

Domino's Pizza: consume responsibly!", 'Ordered 2 pizzas and 2 sides online to go. Accidentally overlooked that one pizza had an ingredient that I did not want, called in, and they were super accommodating and fixed it for me. Pizzas were good and the staff was very friendly!']

Name: Mutter
Summary: Typical Thai curries, soups & meat skewers, plus cocktails, in a laid-back setup with a terrace.
Opening Hours: Monday: 12:00â€¯PMâ€‰â€“â€‰2:00â€¯AM, Tuesday: 12:00â€¯PMâ€‰â€“â€‰2:00â€¯AM, Wednesday: 12:00â€¯PMâ€‰â€“â€‰2:00â€¯AM, Thursday: 12:00â€¯PMâ€‰â€“â€‰2:00â€¯AM, Friday: 12:00â€¯PMâ€‰â€“â€‰2:00â€¯AM, Saturday: 10:00â€¯AMâ€‰â€“â€‰2:00â€¯AM, Sunday: 10:00â€¯AMâ€‰â€“â€‰2:00â€¯AM
Reviews:
['Visited today,
Ordered Tom Yam soup, duck breast and a glass of red wine.
The soup was nice, cost 11â‚¬, the glass of wine was OK cost 8.5â‚¬, the duck breast was absolutely burnt and not edible, cost ~18â‚¬.

The chef has not agreed to cancel the burnt meal and offered a compensation of extra glass of wine which I was not happy about.

The waitress was nice so I tipped her 15% anyway, and the place was cosy overall.', 'A lively, welcoming spot with very friendly staff. The service was a little slow, perhaps short on staff that evening but the food was worth the wait. Beautifully presented and full of fresh ingredients and flavours. Highly recommended!!', 'Well, best food I had in a long while! Staff is very friendly and competent. We were a group of 8, first time visiting Berlin, came here on first evening, then repeated on second - that good ğŸ¤— keep it up guys, doing a great job!']

Name: Zur Gerichtslaube
Summary: Eatery in 13th-century building with beer garden, serving Berlin/Brandenburg fare in vaulted rooms.
Reviews:
['Very impressive historical site where in medieval times your fate was determined but now you can eat from fully packed plates (be sure to be hungry before you walk in). Iâ€™m not too familiar with German eat culture but theyâ€™re big eaters for sure if this is the standard.', 'If you are in Berlin this place gives the full German experienceğŸ‡©ğŸ‡ª
Itâ€™s located in the Altstadt in a lovely medieval town and the place has a story you can read on the menu.
Food is great and the portions are massive. Staff is friendly and the dining room is medieval style.', 'Amazing place. The staff was very kind and funny. The suggestions were very good. The best knuckle we have eaten ever. The starter and dessert were very good as well.

The beers made only for them are very good, especially the black ones. Moreover, they have
Schneider-Weisse as well as wheat beer, is a safe bet.

We recommend it 100%. We will come back to BerlÃ­n only to eat there. It is worth crossing the city to eat here.']

Name: ORA Restaurant & Wine Bar
Summary: Seasonal European plates paired with an extensive wine list in a converted 19th-century apothecary.
Opening Hours: Monday: Closed, Tuesday: 5:00â€¯PMâ€‰â€“â€‰12:00â€¯AM, Wednesday: 5:00â€¯PMâ€‰â€“â€‰12:00â€¯AM, Thursday: 5:00â€¯PMâ€‰â€“â€‰12:00â€¯AM, Friday: 5:00â€¯PMâ€‰â€“â€‰12:00â€¯AM, Saturday: 5:00â€¯PMâ€‰â€“â€‰12:00â€¯AM, Sunday: Closed
Reviews: ['Food is created as a perfect set of well balanced menu - just go for the full option and you wonâ€™t regret it! Wonderful German Chardonnay. Lovely service. But the just after the food (which is obviously super good and the most important) just make sure you pay attention to the interiorâ€¦ with booking a spot inside, to feel the vibe :) great place!', 'We had dinner at Ora as a group of 25 people (team dinner) and this we had a set menu for the evening. The kindness of the service and atmosphere of the restaurant were great, I really liked this old apothecary vibe. Although the food was good and extremely fresh (there was even a living worm ğŸ›in the green saladâ€¦), it took quite long between each dishes so dinner felt quite tiring due to the wait.\nOverall would recommend for the vibe.', "Great find, excellent way to try local cuisine.   Portions aren't massive but the quality excellent.  The staff are helpful and there is a good selection of quality wines.  Best to book a table.  Very popular"]

Name: Tomasa

6) ğŸ‘serving time is little bit long. We were able to start eating 45 minutes after we sit our table.', 'Nice venue and outside area. Great staff. But the food is comparable to airport food: Supermarket bought smoked salmon, bland scrambled eggs, mediocore sausages, and really bad coffee.', 'Fancy breakfasts for really decent prices.
The places is very charming, historical building with many types of seating, two floors inside the building and many outside seating in many different corners and terraces.
We were 4, had 4 meals and drinks (see photos), bill was 62 EUR (not including tip).']

Itâ€™s a small place so youâ€™ll probably need a reservation, but sitting at the bar is also great because you can watch those wizards work.', 'The stuffing in the panipuri and all the textures were a pleasant surprise.  :) the chocolate mouse was such a good rich chocolate flavour. :) panna cotta subtle and mild and pleasant. Name: Ristorante Centro Sud
Summary: Mellow fixture with outdoor seating offering Italian staples such as pizza & pasta.
Opening Hours: Monday: 12:00â€‰â€“â€‰10:00â€¯PM, Tuesday: 12:00â€‰â€“â€‰10:00â€¯PM, Wednesday: 12:00â€‰â€“â€‰10:00â€¯PM, Thursday: 12:00â€‰â€“â€‰10:00â€¯PM, Friday: 12:00â€‰â€“â€‰10:00â€¯PM, Saturday: 1:00â€‰â€“â€‰10:00â€¯PM, Sunday: 1:00â€‰â€“â€‰10:00â€¯PM
Reviews:
['Tonight, me and my family went to this restaurant to enjoy some food, or we thought we would.
Among other dishes, we ordered a pizza. At first the owner served what is best described as a pizza totally destroyed. It was in several pieces and we werenâ€™t able to take a slice of pizza without it going into many small pieces. It looked mostly like it had maybe been dropped from the oven to the floor, and that the owner tried to see if we would notice. We told the owner this, without saying anything, he took the pizza and went away. About 10 minutes after, he serves a half cooked pizza. It was wet, and it clearly hadnâ€™t had enough time in the oven. The crust was not baked and the cheese wasnâ€™t melted.
We ate a little, and a family member tasted it. We all agreed that it wasnâ€™t cooked properly.
I went to talk to the owner and let him know that i didnâ€™t think that it would be fair to make us pay for the pizza that they had ruined twice.
The owner wasnâ€™t responsive to this, and said that there wasnâ€™t anything wrong with the pizza, and that he could cook it again, making this his third attempt in making a pizza, which i wasnâ€™t interested in. I continued to try to make the owner understand that it wasnâ€™t okay to make us pay for a pizza that he had ruined twice.
The owner got very mad ans started raising his voice and said that he out of kindness hadnâ€™t charged us a fee, that he usually uses.
This fee is made up by the owner himself and something that he forgets to tell his customers about. It is a fee of 1.50 euro pr. guest, in which he among other things charges for:
- That there is olive oil and balsamic on the table
- That there is extra parmesan (which there wasnâ€™t on the table)
- Bread (that we also didnâ€™t get)
- Napkins
- And the fact that he played music in the restaurant
- Included was also, that he has a garden
At last he then deletes the pizza, and instead adds the fee of 1.5 euro pr person (9 euro in total) which in the end is the same amount as the pizza on the bill.
All in all it was a very, very bad experience, the food was bad, the service was also bad. The owner was hostile. I can most certainly not recommend anyone going to this restaurant.', "Family run restaurant, with very delicious dishes and a nice ambiance. You really need to sit on the very green terrace in the backyard, perfect for summer days. Prices are higher than the average for the area but it's worth it for special occasions.", 'Very nice and quiet place, great food and nice staff!']

Name: The Tree
Summary: Szechuan rice bowls, noodle soups & small plates in a high-ceilinged space with eclectic decor.
Reviews: ['The interior design is very creative, with a touch of beauty that makes the space stand out, even if itâ€™s not the most comfortable. The art and atmosphere make up for it. The food was decent, and the vegetarian dishes are clearly highlighted on the menu.', 'Very friendly staff, good food.\nWe ordered the noodle soup with 3 different types of tofu and the mapo tofu with noodles (calla).\nThe food was ready within minutes. They serve the noodles with fresh vegetables (radish, carrots, cucumber, arugula, tomatoes) and in some spicy chilly oil. The noodle soup was not spicy at all. You can see on the menu which dishes are spicy and which are not. The beauty tea with goji, dates and rose petals was also very special and delicious. You can sit inside and outside. Very nice atmosphere. I would definitely go out to eat there again!', 'Food was actually good but charging 2â‚¬ for extra chilli oil is a bit too much!']

Name: OMONI ì˜¤ ëª¨ ë‹ˆ
Summary: Simple, wood-lined environment with counter seating, offering sushi, sashimi & rice dishes.
Opening Hours: Monday: Closed, Tuesday: Closed, Wednesday: 5:00â€‰â€“â€‰11:00â€¯PM, Thursday: 5:00â€‰â€“â€‰11:00â€¯PM, Friday: 5:00â€‰â€“â€‰11:00â€¯PM, Saturday: 5:00â€‰â€“â€‰11:00â€¯PM, Sunday: 5:00â€‰â€“â€‰11:00â€¯PM
Reviews:
['Amazing sushi place.
Probably I would keep the crown of best sushis of Berlin between them and Sasaya.
Loved the super fresh fish, delicious combinations, perfectly cooked rice, beautiful ceramics and a lovely, calm and peaceful atmosphere.
Extra kudos for an AC (not so common in Berlin) and for being pet friendly.
Absolutely wonderful experience, can only recommend!
Thanks for the great service as well.', 'Wow, if you are looking for some amazing and authentic sushi in Berlin, I definitely recommend this restaurant. Make sure to book your table as it can get packed and itâ€™s so worth it! Itâ€™s a chill spot where you can enjoy some great sushi for a great price.', 'Absolutely bizarre experience very badly handled by inexperienced staff.

This is not a food review as we werent served. We were visiting our friend in Berlin who reserved the table for us a week in advance. Heâ€™s been to this restaurant many times and is (was) a loyal customer.

When we showed up they told us that our name is not on the list and that they dont have any table for us (most of the tables were still free as the people didnt show up for their reservations).

They even asked my friend to show a call log to prove that he called. Which he did! It was an obvious mistake on the part of this restaurantâ€™s staff, but instead of serving a customer who was already in the restaurant and arranging us a table while rescheduling someone who had a reservation later, they just behaved silly, repeating the same â€we see you called but the list..â€ like a broken record.

We finally left because it was clear they were incapable of correcting their mistake and found much better option for dinner at the end.']

Reviews:
["Lovely place with great bagels (tracing their history from the NYC, as I've found out) and service. The lads got a kitchen that's working up to 3 PM, but they went above and beyond to get a bagel to a hungry man (me) and got me a New York Classic (which was very nice). Apart from Classic, my top 1 choice would be reuben-style sandwich. Coffee is great too, water refills are available, overall - can recommend.", 'The bagels are quite stuffed and filling! I had the breakfast bagel with extra bacon and avocado â€” mine was delicious. My boyfriend had the chipotle Turkey bagel and although it was packed with Turkey (yay) it was incredibly (!) bland. Nothing chipotle about this chipotle bagel. We would name it plain Turkey bagel ğŸ˜‚', "Have been thinking for quite a while that there was a serious lack of bagel places in Berlin that were worth going to, and man does this place really fill that void.

The iced coffee was smooth and velvety and the Reuben Sandwich was bomb. Seriously I've been dreaming about the sandwich since I ate it. The bagels have great crunch/chew as well.

10/10 will be back"]

Name: Sigiriya
Summary: Warm, understated restaurant specializing in traditional Sri Lankan meals & desserts.
Opening Hours: Monday: 5:00â€‰â€“â€‰11:00â€¯PM, Tuesday: 5:00â€‰â€“â€‰11:00â€¯PM, Wednesday: 5:00â€‰â€“â€‰11:00â€¯PM, Thursday: 12:00â€‰â€“â€‰11:00â€¯PM, Friday: 12:00â€¯PMâ€‰â€“â€‰12:00â€¯AM, Saturday: 12:00â€¯PMâ€‰â€“â€‰12:00â€¯AM, Sunday: 12:00â€‰â€“â€‰11:00â€¯PM
Reviews:
['the kottu was pretty good, not exceptional and definitely needed more salt, and more flavour in general. the curries looked super good though and menu was typically Sri Lankan.
sweet staff, nice chill local vibe. would come again to have hoppers & curry ğŸ˜‡
(half vegan menu, half that you can add meat or fish :))', "Went on Saturday evening no crowd at all.  Get plain Hoppers which are soggy and blent Don't recommended) and nothing is provided to dip in
And vadai is also not tasty at all but served with jam but a good combo

We Get mutton biryani and chicken biriyani
But its not buriyani at all
Just chicken curry and mutton curry mixed with basmati rice with excess oil.
They use an excess amount of salad that does not cut the stems of the leaves also very uncomfortable to eat

Service was good", "â€Sigiriyaâ€ is an absolute must-visit Sri Lankan restaurant for anyone seeking a delightful culinary adventure in Berlin, Germany. From the moment I stepped in, I was transported to Sri Lanka with the restaurant's cozy atmosphere and friendly staff. The service was impeccable - the staff were incredibly wonderful, lovely, and kind, making me feel right at home.

But the true star of the show is the food. Absolutely amazing.  Sigiriya's dishes are mouthwatering and spectacular.  Every bite was a delicious explosion of flavors.

If you're looking for an unforgettable Sri Lankan dining experience that combines exquisite food with exceptional service, look no further than â€™Sigiriyaâ€™ restaurant.

Their hospitality is truly unmatched, and I wholeheartedly recommend this Sri Lankan restaurant to anyone who visit Berlin. Defenitely we will visit you again. Cheers! (Sam & Ruwi - SwedenğŸ‡¸ğŸ‡ª)"]

Reviews: ['Food is created as a perfect set of well balanced menu - just go for the full option and you wonâ€™t regret it! Wonderful German Chardonnay. Lovely service. But the just after the food (which is obviously super good and the most important) just make sure you pay attention to the interiorâ€¦ with booking a spot inside, to feel the vibe :) great place!', 'We had dinner at Ora as a group of 25 people (team dinner) and this we had a set menu for the evening. The kindness of the service and atmosphere of the restaurant were great, I really liked this old apothecary vibe. Although the food was good and extremely fresh (there was even a living worm ğŸ›in the green saladâ€¦), it took quite long between each dishes so dinner felt quite tiring due to the wait.\nOverall would recommend for the vibe.', "Great find, excellent way to try local cuisine.   Portions aren't massive but the quality excellent.  The staff are helpful and there is a good selection of quality wines.  Best to book a table.  Very popular"]

Name: SuppengrÃ¼n
Summary: Cozy restaurant serving seasonally changing soups, salads & quiches, plus housemade loaves of bread.
Opening Hours: Monday: 7:30â€¯AMâ€‰â€“â€‰3:00â€¯PM, Tuesday: 7:30â€¯AMâ€‰â€“â€‰3:00â€¯PM, Wednesday: 7:30â€¯AMâ€‰â€“â€‰3:00â€¯PM, Thursday: 7:30â€¯AMâ€‰â€“â€‰3:00â€¯PM, Friday: 7:30â€¯AMâ€‰â€“â€‰3:00â€¯PM, Saturday: Closed, Sunday: Closed
Reviews:
['Such welcoming and helpful staff when a group of us visited for breakfast! They have such a range of delicious breakfast items, from scrambled eggs and baguettes, to Bircher muesli pots, fruit pots, and an assortment of croissants including vegan croissants.

Delicious hot chocolate and a marzipan croissant, and the Bircher muesli was also fresh and beautifully presented.', 'What more could you want from a place than really well constructed foods across the board..salads, soups, rolls and cakes, as earnest as a tee totaller at a wake. Service is patient and on point...the variety surprisingly wide for the size of the place. Every block on the planet should have a place like this.
BUT, they need to train in coffee making...it too is very berlin', 'One of the best restaurants in Berlin. I had the soup, salad, and a dessert. Everything made here tastes so fresh, flavorful, and good. Service is amazing! And they take credit cards.']

Name: Panda Meister Berlin Ostbahnhof
Summary: Humble counter-serve snack shack doling out Chinese treats, such as dumplings & bubble tea.
Opening Hours: Monday: 10:30â€¯AMâ€‰â€“â€‰9:00â€¯PM, Tuesday: 10:30â€¯AMâ€‰â€“â€‰9:00â€¯PM, Wednesday: 10:30â€¯AMâ€‰â€“â€‰9:00â€¯PM, Thursday: 10:30â€¯AMâ€‰â€“â€‰9:00â€¯PM, Friday: 10:30â€¯AMâ€‰â€“â€‰9:00â€¯PM, Saturday: 11:00â€¯AMâ€‰â€“â€‰9:00â€¯PM, Sunday: 11:00â€¯AMâ€‰â€“â€‰9:00â€¯PM
Reviews:
['The food, atmosphere and service are extremely authentic! The male cook is businesslike and a little chaotic, but very fast and good! The lady is smiling and charming, throwing in some Chinese words. The prices are great, especially for the dumplings - which are probably their specialty and most ordered dish.', "Panda Meister is a hidden gem (but I guess everyone knows already this place). This food truck serves up the most delicious dumplings I've ever had, with a perfect balance of tender, flavorful fillings and delicate wrappers. The pork and veggie dumplings are a standout, bursting with juicy goodness. The dipping chili sauces are the perfect complement, adding an extra layer of flavor. Service is quick and friendly, making it an ideal spot for a tasty, on-the-go meal. To top it off, the lady is always nice and friendly. If you love dumplings, you need to go here ASAP!!", "Good dumplings for good affordable price. The place may looks a little rough but doesn't reflect the food quality at all. It even makes it more authentic. The service is quick and very friendly. The food overall was delicious and filling. The bubble tea is alright but not my taste. It had too much syrup in it. All in all I can recommend everyone who like street food Chinese style.
Also i recommend the other food stalls there. This won't be my last visit and will definitely try Mapo Tofu next time.

Side note: you can also pay electronically (credit card, apple pay etc.). Very convenient."]

Name: Charlotte & Fritz
Summary: Upscale fine-dining venue with chandeliers, serving acclaimed French-inspired meat & seafood dishes.
Opening Hours: Monday: Closed, Tuesday: Closed, Wednesday: Closed, Thursday: 6:00â€‰â€“â€‰10:30â€¯PM, Friday: 6:00â€‰â€“â€‰10:30â€¯PM, Saturday: 6:00â€‰â€“â€‰10:30â€¯PM, Sunday: Closed
Reviews:
["There are different high-class restaurants. This one have their own old German atmosphere and a very tasty fresh dishes. The portions aren't so big, that you can't breathe, but also aren't too small, that you are going away hungry. I think three courses are enough. Also, there is a choice of an old and good alcohol, such as armaniak, Obstler, good vibes and others.", 'Wow ! What can I say ! simply stunning ... the whole experience was fabulous. My finance booked a surprise evening for my family/friends and I for my 50th Birthday week-end ! The restaurant did an outstanding job and we all loved it from start to finish. All the staff were outstanding  - their customer service skills were beyond excellent ! I have to give a shout out to the head waiter who has served at the hotel where the restaurant is for 30 years.

The food was absolutely divine and the restaurant setting was stunning. We were a group of 12 , and the entire restaurant team handled us so well.

Thank you so much for making my birthday week-end in Berlin so memorable.', 'We have dined at the Charlotte&Fritz on New Yearâ€™s eve. Not only was the food delicious and the wine great, but also the ambience and the service of the personnel could not be any better. The restaurant is   equipped with stylish furniture, and nice   decorations which we were lucky to enjoy because we visited on the 31/12.
The wine made an excellent combination with the aesthetic meals.
If you are fond of gourmet food and nice stylish restaurants-Charlotte&Fritz is for you:)']

Name: 3 Sisters
Summary: Cafe-restaurant with a high ceiling, arched windows & German cuisine.
Opening Hours: Monday: 5:00â€‰â€“â€‰11:00â€¯PM, Tuesday: 5:00â€‰â€“â€‰11:00â€¯PM, Wednesday: 5:00â€‰â€“â€‰11:00â€¯PM, Thursday: 5:00â€‰â€“â€‰11:00â€¯PM, Friday: 5:00â€‰â€“â€‰11:00â€¯PM, Saturday: 12:00â€‰â€“â€‰11:00â€¯PM, Sunday: 12:00â€‰â€“â€‰11:00â€¯PM
Reviews: ['What a great meal I had here! We were welcomed very friendly and were directed to the terrace in the garden. Such a beautiful place to eat. The meal itself was of very high quality and more than enough. A big compliment to the entire team, I will definitely recommend this place to others!', 'Unique location, great service, tasty food and an interesting mix of the menu - traditional dishes are mixed with some dishes which have a modern twist and vegan options - finally a menu which satisfies many different tastes at once! Definitely not my last time dining there', 'Amazing and calming place â¤ï¸ the food is great and full of taste']

Name: Sao Mai
Summary: Stylish restaurant with outdoor tables serving Vietnamese classics, such as pho & spring rolls.
Opening Hours: Monday: 11:30â€¯AMâ€‰â€“â€‰10:30â€¯PM, Tuesday: 11:30â€¯AMâ€‰â€“â€‰10:30â€¯PM, Wednesday: 11:30â€¯AMâ€‰â€“â€‰10:30â€¯PM, Thursday: 11:30â€¯AMâ€‰â€“â€‰10:30â€¯PM, Friday: 11:30â€¯AMâ€‰â€“â€‰10:30â€¯PM, Saturday: 11:30â€¯AMâ€‰â€“â€‰10:30â€¯PM, Sunday: 12:30â€‰â€“â€‰10:30â€¯PM
Reviews:
["I must say, it's an absolute gem! The food was incredibly delicious, with every dish bursting with flavor. What really stood out was the value for money. For such high-quality food, the prices are exceptionally reasonable, making it one of the best price-performance ratios I've experienced in Berlin. The portions were generous, and the service was attentive and friendly. I'll definitely be back! ğŸ˜Š", "Located at Nollendorfplatz, a bustling district in Berlin, especially at night, you'll find a fantastic Vietnamese restaurant called Sao Mai.

I ordered the Chicken Katsu Curry Mango for less than â‚¬10, which is affordable compared to other restaurants. The portion is generous, the chicken is cooked perfectly and crispy, and the vegetables are fresh. Overall, the food is excellent.

The service is decent, and the most important aspect is the cozy and awesome atmosphere. Highly recommended if you want to try Vietnamese food in this area.", 'The food is good for the price paid.  Donâ€™t expect global standard 5* and you wonâ€™t be disappointed. Ordered tofu and vegetables with rice and it cost around â‚¬7. Nice enough flavours and large portion for the price paid. The service was pleasant and the food was served quickly. One point less because when sitting inside, the place had a â€˜wet dogâ€™ smell and a day later, I cannot get the smell out of my jacket despite using plenty of Febreeze - next time will sit in the tent outside.']

Name: Gaffel Haus Berlin - Das kÃ¶lsche Konsulat in der Hauptstadt

Reviews: ['Great place to try local dishes, with a great environment a very nice and attentive service. They have the menu in English and many options to choose from, all of them delicious. Meatballs and sausages are top, but of course you have to combine it with some local beers. The amounts were fairly good and price-wise it was well worth it overall. Highly recommended for tourist.', 'A Cologne pub in Berlin that will amaze even the most loyal Berliner-PlÃ¶rre beer fan. The Cologne atmosphere is downright infectious, even if the KÃ¶lsch served brings back memories of headaches. The waiter is brisk and funny, and the Halve Hahn brings a smile. An entertaining evening with plenty of KÃ¶lsch, which traditionally causes a slight headache. Highly recommended for friends of koelsche hospitality customs.', 'Nice atmosphere and kind servers. The food and beer were amazing.\nRecommend the restaurant.']

Name: Rice On! Berlin
Summary: Modern counter serve offering create-your-own bowls featuring Asian-inspired ingredients.
Address: Berlin Hauptbahnhof â€“ Foodcourt, Europaplatz 1, Berlin
Opening Hours: Monday: 10:00â€¯AMâ€‰â€“â€‰9:00â€¯PM, Tuesday: 10:00â€¯AMâ€‰â€“â€‰9:00â€¯PM, Wednesday: 10:00â€¯AMâ€‰â€“â€‰9:00â€¯PM, Thursday: 10:00â€¯AMâ€‰â€“â€‰9:00â€¯PM, Friday: 10:00â€¯AMâ€‰â€“â€‰9:00â€¯PM, Saturday: 10:00â€¯AMâ€‰â€“â€‰9:00â€¯PM, Sunday: 10:00â€¯AMâ€‰â€“â€‰9:00â€¯PM
Reviews: ['Located at the right spot at the very entrance of Food court in Berlin Central train station, this Asian food joint is more than awesome for its food quality, taste and price! Service is courteous and quick and the meal portions are great enough to fill hungry tummies either before the journey or after! The taste is one of the true definitions of fusion with all overlapping on one another like Indian, Chinese, Thai and Malaysian, suiting all types of taste buds. We bought their chicken ball bowl and tofu bowl and both were simply great! There is a great differentiator in the name of various sauces they carry like green sauce, red sauce, peanut sauce and tamarind sauce and all sauces are great! I would certainly go back again whenever I cross the station! Highly recommended.', 'Fresh, big size dishes, with love. Very tasty. Ate rice with chicken, broccoli, green beans, as much as you want coriander and tastey sauce!', 'I liked it at first glance it, everything looked fresh and clean. The staff was so nice and everything was delicious! I found it quite filling and was fully satisfied with the quality and price. Iâ€™m very happy to have a fast, healthy, delicious food :) definitely gonna revisit when Iâ€™m here again.']

Name: Humboldt Forum im Berliner Schloss
Summary: Originally built in the 15th century, this stately royal & imperial palace offers exhibits & tours.
Opening Hours: Monday: 10:30â€¯AMâ€‰â€“â€‰6:30â€¯PM, Tuesday: Closed, Wednesday: 10:30â€¯AMâ€‰â€“â€‰6:30â€¯PM, Thursday: 10:30â€¯AMâ€‰â€“â€‰6:30â€¯PM, Friday: 10:30â€¯AMâ€‰â€“â€‰6:30â€¯PM, Saturday: 10:30â€¯AMâ€‰â€“â€‰6:30â€¯PM, Sunday: 10:30â€¯AMâ€‰â€“â€‰6:30â€¯PM
Reviews: ['Visited Humboldt Forum in June 2024 on a sunny weekend. The Museum Island was crowded with visitors relaxing and enjoying the sun. The Forum is located at the center of the island, and next to the subway line 5. The visit to Humboldt Forum was very pleasant. The collections are mostly free. Couple of highlights about its facility: 1. lockers and cloakroom allows flight carry on size luggage, and check them for visitors for free. 2. There is a bistro with various reasonably priced lunch options. 3. Roof terrace costs 5 Euro for access. But one can make a reservation at its roof terrace restaurant Baret to enjoy a cup of coffee and the Dom view. I went there for its Asian Art collection located on the third floor, and happily surprised with its temporary collections there, especially with the Wang Shu designed exhibition hall. Of course, one question the visitors might have after reading the descriptions of some of the objects in the hall is  the museum\'s efforts and role in addressing the ethical dilemma of preserving those admittedly "looted" during the Boxer Rebellion. Overall, the Forum also made efforts in including more English language description of objects that\'s more friendly to non-German speaking visitors. At the beginning of the Asian Art collection, there is also a timeline of the transformation of its collection since 19th century. One suggestion for future improvement of presenting such a timeline is to use different colors for English and German texts, and explain acronyms on the side. It would be easier for the visitors to follow.', "Lovely and magical place, for me it's one of the best places and one of the  best areas in Berlin. Not only is the museum free, but it contains great exposition and great items inside.\n\nThere is an observatory which is around 5 euros to access but you'll have one of the best views in Berlin. You won't regret visiting here.", 'The rooftop must be one of the best places to see the sunset and also see couples of tourist attractions like Berlin Cathedral, TV towel, etc. Plus, the staff at the roof top are very friendly, there wasnt anything I like on the main menu, so I only want to order drinks. And he said, dont worry. Just enjoy the view.']

Also pickled cucumbers and sour cream on the side, really doesn't pair together. Tartar sause and pickles, even anything else, than sour cream. My friends dish was a burger and he ate it like a stew because it was swimming in sauce. It was better than mine, tho. Lovely staff and place, but for the price of the food, they have some work to do.", 'I highly recommend a degustation set of beer, a â€œtrue loveâ€ set of meal and tiramisu IPA - everything was absolutely delicious!']

Reviews: ["My recent experience at this restaurant was extremely disappointing. The food was absolutely terrible. We ordered the chicken Alfredo, and to our shock, it came with a mere six tiny pieces of chicken buried in a sea of bland, flavorless pasta. For a dish that costs 20â‚¬, I expected something far more substantial and satisfying. Instead, it felt like we were paying a premium price for a plate of plain pasta with barely any effort put into it. The quality of the food did not even come close to justifying the exorbitant price. I won't be returning and would advise others to avoid this place unless they want to leave hungry and disappointed. Unfortunately no fewer than one star is possible!", 'Reasonable price and superb atmosphere!  It is the first time I went to a branch of Vapiano. Everything was nicely organised. The taste of the food was also pretty good. The presentation was mouthwatering. I enjoyed their entire system. It was a great experience. If you like pasta/pizza it is a worthy place.', 'As good as it can be. Food was good, portions have big size.\nThe staff was very friendly and helpful.']

Reviews:
['We stopped in here for breakfast, and in all honesty we really couldnâ€™t have selected in more fitting establishment. We had the farmer â€“ breakfast, and the vegan breakfast, which was served to us with one bread and simit each. we also got the Biscoff pancakes, and everything was served with a healthy portion of fruit. Service at this place was excellent staff friendly, and if you come here youâ€™re even in for a chilly surpriseâ€¦ We spent about â‚¬20 per person on an admittedly lavish brunch. 10/10.', 'Cash only eatery that was absolutely amazing. Insanely great prices and so many options to choose from. Superb coffee, and the food that was delivered was so fresh and tasty. In our visit to Berlin it will be hard to not just come here for breakfast each day!', 'This is by far the best kebap place we have been in Germany.

Their kebaps are very tasty and service is also very good. Portion is very big, if you are nit very hungry, 1 dish is also enough.

We have tried many dishes (Yogurtlu Kebap, Beyti Kebab, Chicken Shish Kebap, Meze platters, Grilled vegetable salad) and everything was good all time.

They give salad and meze plate as a starter before your main dish comes. They also give tea and baklava in the end.

Whenever we want to eat kebap, we always come here.']

But man, itâ€™s Sunday at 11 pm ğŸ˜‚ the place is empty, there was nobody elseâ€¦ I order a single McFlurry with Lion, nothing specialâ€¦ and I get this half empty thing ğŸ˜‚ Anyway, what do u expect from Mickey Dsâ€¦', 'Minus two points for that they did not have tea at al at 10 am Monday.  There were also no soya drinks available.', "the institution is very dirty! the toilet stinks! ordered a Caesar salad, they gave a different sauce because there was no Caesar dressing! Don't give a fork to eat! napkins were not given! terribly!"]

Name: SuppengrÃ¼n
Summary: Cozy restaurant serving seasonally changing soups, salads & quiches, plus housemade loaves of bread.
Opening Hours: Monday: 7:30â€¯AMâ€‰â€“â€‰3:00â€¯PM, Tuesday: 7:30â€¯AMâ€‰â€“â€‰3:00â€¯PM, Wednesday: 7:30â€¯AMâ€‰â€“â€‰3:00â€¯PM, Thursday: 7:30â€¯AMâ€‰â€“â€‰3:00â€¯PM, Friday: 7:30â€¯AMâ€‰â€“â€‰3:00â€¯PM, Saturday: Closed, Sunday: Closed
Reviews:
['Such welcoming and helpful staff when a group of us visited for breakfast! They have such a range of delicious breakfast items, from scrambled eggs and baguettes, to Bircher muesli pots, fruit pots, and an assortment of croissants including vegan croissants.

Delicious hot chocolate and a marzipan croissant, and the Bircher muesli was also fresh and beautifully presented.', 'What more could you want from a place than really well constructed foods across the board..salads, soups, rolls and cakes, as earnest as a tee totaller at a wake. Service is patient and on point...the variety surprisingly wide for the size of the place. Every block on the planet should have a place like this.
BUT, they need to train in coffee making...it too is very berlin', 'One of the best restaurants in Berlin. I had the soup, salad, and a dessert. Everything made here tastes so fresh, flavorful, and good. Service is amazing! And they take credit cards.']

Name: Sofram
Summary: Kebabs & other familiar Turkish plates turned out in a casual setup with tables & banquettes.
Opening Hours: Monday: 9:00â€¯AMâ€‰â€“â€‰11:00â€¯PM, Tuesday: 9:00â€¯AMâ€‰â€“â€‰11:00â€¯PM, Wednesday: 9:00â€¯AMâ€‰â€“â€‰11:00â€¯PM, Thursday: 9:00â€¯AMâ€‰â€“â€‰11:00â€¯PM, Friday: 9:00â€¯AMâ€‰â€“â€‰11:00â€¯PM, Saturday: 9:00â€¯AMâ€‰â€“â€‰11:00â€¯PM, Sunday: Closed
Reviews:
['Very tasty chicken kebabs and meatballs. Beautiful looking bread but weâ€™re on Keto! ğŸ˜« Lovely black tea to finish.', 'A very traditional place where you can find: healty products, smiling people and affordable prices. Not so often the picture on the menu represents what you will have, well, not in this case! I saw a nice picture of a Hallumi salat and what came to me was exactly the same. Check my pic and compare with the one on the menu. Waiters were very kind and always keep an eye on me if I need something. Kitchen is open (you can see the grill) and the offered me a nice tea at the end of the dinner. I will definitely come back here.', 'Must say the food is very delicious, service is nice and fast.
The only downside is that you can pay only with cash.
But overall very good experience.
Highly recommended.']

Name: ASMAN
Summary: Colorful, down-to-earth restaurant offering spicy meat & veg curries, biryani & fried samosas.
Opening Hours: Monday: 12:00â€¯PMâ€‰â€“â€‰12:00â€¯AM, Tuesday: 12:00â€¯PMâ€‰â€“â€‰12:00â€¯AM, Wednesday: 12:00â€¯PMâ€‰â€“â€‰12:00â€¯AM, Thursday: 12:00â€¯PMâ€‰â€“â€‰12:00â€¯AM, Friday: 12:00â€¯PMâ€‰â€“â€‰12:00â€¯AM, Saturday: 12:00â€¯PMâ€‰â€“â€‰12:00â€¯AM, Sunday: 12:00â€¯PMâ€‰â€“â€‰12:00â€¯AM
Reviews:
['Nice place, food was tasty but the service could have been better. Took the food long (45 min) time to come, but when it came it was great. Would have gotten 4 stars If not for their slow services.', 'Was here this weekend for lunch, with colleagues. Ordered Veg Thali, whereas the colleagues ordered Asman special thali.

Quality and quantity wise both the Thalis were awesome. Though it took some time for the preparation, but it was worth waiting a bit for the delicious food. The veg dishes as well as non-veg items were very tasty.

Staffs were very friendly.', 'Food was good and tasty and they have lunch offers. Anyone working in this vicinity can try their mittag angebot.']

Name: McDonald's
Summary: Classic, long-running fast-food chain known for its burgers & fries.
Opening Hours: Monday: 12:00â€‰â€“â€‰2:00â€¯AM, 7:00â€¯AMâ€‰â€“â€‰2:00â€¯AM, Tuesday: 7:00â€¯AMâ€‰â€“â€‰2:00â€¯AM, Wednesday: 7:00â€¯AMâ€‰â€“â€‰2:00â€¯AM, Thursday: 7:00â€¯AMâ€‰â€“â€‰2:00â€¯AM, Friday: 7:00â€¯AMâ€‰â€“â€‰12:00â€¯AM, Saturday: Open 24 hours, Sunday: Open 24 hours
Reviews:
['This McDonaldâ€™s is easily accessible from the platforms at the station, making it a great place for a quick bite or to sit and relax before your next destination. I visited one afternoon when it was very busy, and I had to wait several minutes before one of the kiosks became available. However, when I visited in the morning, it was much quieter, and the food was prepared quickly.

Unfortunately, there are no toilet facilities, which is why Iâ€™m deducting two stars. Itâ€™s important to wash your hands before a meal, especially if you enjoy finger foods like fries or nuggets. The lack of any toilet facility is disappointing.', 'Itâ€™s just weird that there is literally NO GAS in their cola every time I visit, no matter cola regular or light or zeroğŸ¥´ if you order one, youâ€™re basically drinking sugar water that is warm, they also donâ€™t bother to put ice cubes in them anymore.
Also, if you take out, always check the bags at the counter to make sure nothing is missing, they seem to forget things sometimes.', "The food is always slow, I see many times when I have been here. The employees will be just talking and food will be lying there on the stand. I asked and showed them. They said they have to follow the order and something. They didn't even care for one cappuccino once I ordered it's been 7 mins to get one."]

Name: Ephraims
Summary: Long-running spot for classic German dishes in a historic mansion or on a terrace with river views.
Reviews: ['Real authentic German food. Went there because a friend was visiting and wanted to experience traditional German cuisine.\nSo there we were, in the most German looking restaurant, with the most German tasting food. Coming from a place where German food was often regarded as bland and boring I was pretty surprised to discover itâ€™s not really the case! I mean, not a huge fan of boiled or steamed food so I guess I wasnâ€™t going to be a big fan of it anyways but itâ€™s some of the nicest boiled potato and steamed fish Iâ€™ve tried. Also the decor and the service were perfect. Thanks!', 'Really good food, the Pike was fantastic. Brilliant atmosphere and excellent service. Most amazing Apfel Strudel to end a perfect lunch.', 'Best food I have had during my 5 days in Berlin, and cheap price as well! Salad had very fresh vegetables, smoked salmon was wonderful, and presentation was pretty. Service 10/10; super helpful and friendly.']

Name: Zille-Stube
Summary: Old-fashioned restaurant with outdoor seats preparing traditional fare & cocktails.
Opening Hours: Monday: 12:00â€‰â€“â€‰11:00â€¯PM, Tuesday: 12:00â€‰â€“â€‰11:00â€¯PM, Wednesday: Closed, Thursday: 12:00â€‰â€“â€‰11:00â€¯PM, Friday: 12:00â€‰â€“â€‰11:00â€¯PM, Saturday: 12:00â€‰â€“â€‰11:00â€¯PM, Sunday: 12:00â€‰â€“â€‰11:00â€¯PM
Reviews: ['May 2024 update.\nFantastic spot directly at the water. Personnel was very friendly and food was great. Berliner dishes looking great and tasting even better. Highly reccomended. Large and clean toilets are a plus.', 'A beautiful place well located overlooking the Spree River, pleasant atmosphere, good food and generous portions', 'Excellent spot to sit by the River Spree, have a few drinks and order some pretty good food, service was excellent, food was great, and the views amazing. A little pricey but you are paying for the location.']

Name: Angry Chicken

Reviews:
['It is one of the best places to try the Korean spiciest chicken recipes.

Dishes served with different levels of hotnessğŸ”¥ğŸ”¥ğŸŒ¶ğŸŒ¶.

Enjoyed the spicy and hot dishes in berlin after a long tym. Value for money. Definitely recommendable!ğŸ‘Œ', "I was extremely happy with this food. From a very long time I wanted to eat proper Korean chicken and finally I found it. You can choose chickens in different tastes and they all taste cool. Hotdog was top of the top for me! It really was my taste. Everything also looked nice. The only thing which I would change is the quality of a chicken, I had a feeling that it's a cheap sort of chicken and it would be 10 times nicer if it would be a better one.", 'the chicken was okay, the sauce was a bit bland, not good as before. Hamburger was horrible, the patties were black burned â˜¹ï¸']

Name: Mutzenbacher

Reviews: ['Always a good place for some Austrian specialties like Schnitzel, KnÃ¶del, LeberkÃ¤s or Kaiserschmarren. The team is very quick and friendly. We really enjoyed our dinner.', 'The place has a great variety of Austrian dishes. I had the Schnitzel, which was fine, but nothing special. Annoyingly, the side wasnâ€™t included in this 20+ euro dish and cost another 4+ euros. I also had the Germ KnÃ¶del for dessert, which was very small but still cost â‚¬9.5. Overall, I found the price to be way too high for the quality of the food. The waiter who served us however was very friendly and attentive, so that was great.', 'The restaurant has a nice atmosphere and the food is good. The spinach dumplings "SpinatknÃ¶del" are amazing as well as the desserts. Staff is friendly and always around.']

Name: Cocoro
Summary: Ramen noodle soups & beef-topped rice bowls, plus matcha drinks & sake, at a snug neighborhood stop.
Reviews: ['Cute clean place. The lady that served us was extremely friendly, smiley and with an amazing vibe. The food was fresh and good, amazing non alcoholic cocktails.', 'The portion size was a bit too small for me. After the main course, I was still somewhat hungry. The main dish was mostly rice and a bit underwhelming. The matcha ice cream was great tho.', 'Since my partner tried out this restaurant during one of her lunch breaks in 2016, we have been coming here regularly - and itâ€™s been one of, if not THE, favorite place of mine. The owners are so kind, sweet and authentic; and the food is amazing, too!']

Name: CafÃ© Tasso - Das andere Antiquariat
Summary: Cafe with modern artwork, a selection of used books, newspapers & magazines, plus regular events.
Opening Hours: Monday: 10:00â€¯AMâ€‰â€“â€‰7:00â€¯PM, Tuesday: 10:00â€¯AMâ€‰â€“â€‰7:00â€¯PM, Wednesday: 10:00â€¯AMâ€‰â€“â€‰7:00â€¯PM, Thursday: 10:00â€¯AMâ€‰â€“â€‰7:00â€¯PM, Friday: 10:00â€¯AMâ€‰â€“â€‰7:00â€¯PM, Saturday: 10:00â€¯AMâ€‰â€“â€‰7:00â€¯PM, Sunday: Closed
Reviews: ["Highly recommend eating here, they have both light sweet/salty breakfast and more consistent food, plus great selection of cakes, including many vegan ones. I recommend the lentil soup. I also got the vegan breakfast but I didn't like they mix fruits with veggies. Plus the view over the window is great. Unfortunately didn't find any book to like", 'Lovely and cosy cafe near U-Bahn Frankfurter Tor. Beautiful and appealing interior. Currently you can have coffee inside with covid test, but outside, on the terrace you can stay without any tests. Tasty and beautifully decorated breakfast. Especially tasty fresh baked, and still warm croissants. Also friendly service. Beautiful place! Thank you :) Btw, there is also books store and shelfs with cheap, second hand books to buy.', 'A pleasant cafÃ© place along Frankfurter Allee in Berlin- Friedrichshain, with an integrated book store/sale. We stopped for a espresso & cappuccino and enjoyed both. There is some cake (nothing extraordinary) and some breakfast plates. The lady serving us was friendly and smiling. In some side rooms books were offered and a flyer with events was placed at each table. We will definitely check some of these musical events soon.']

Name: Sao Mai
Summary: Stylish restaurant with outdoor tables serving Vietnamese classics, such as pho & spring rolls.
Opening Hours: Monday: 11:30â€¯AMâ€‰â€“â€‰10:30â€¯PM, Tuesday: 11:30â€¯AMâ€‰â€“â€‰10:30â€¯PM, Wednesday: 11:30â€¯AMâ€‰â€“â€‰10:30â€¯PM, Thursday: 11:30â€¯AMâ€‰â€“â€‰10:30â€¯PM, Friday: 11:30â€¯AMâ€‰â€“â€‰10:30â€¯PM, Saturday: 11:30â€¯AMâ€‰â€“â€‰10:30â€¯PM, Sunday: 12:30â€‰â€“â€‰10:30â€¯PM
Reviews:
["I must say, it's an absolute gem! The food was incredibly delicious, with every dish bursting with flavor. What really stood out was the value for money. For such high-quality food, the prices are exceptionally reasonable, making it one of the best price-performance ratios I've experienced in Berlin. The portions were generous, and the service was attentive and friendly. I'll definitely be back! ğŸ˜Š", "Located at Nollendorfplatz, a bustling district in Berlin, especially at night, you'll find a fantastic Vietnamese restaurant called Sao Mai.

I ordered the Chicken Katsu Curry Mango for less than â‚¬10, which is affordable compared to other restaurants. The portion is generous, the chicken is cooked perfectly and crispy, and the vegetables are fresh. Overall, the food is excellent.

The service is decent, and the most important aspect is the cozy and awesome atmosphere. Highly recommended if you want to try Vietnamese food in this area.", 'The food is good for the price paid.  Donâ€™t expect global standard 5* and you wonâ€™t be disappointed. Ordered tofu and vegetables with rice and it cost around â‚¬7. Nice enough flavours and large portion for the price paid. The service was pleasant and the food was served quickly. One point less because when sitting inside, the place had a â€˜wet dogâ€™ smell and a day later, I cannot get the smell out of my jacket despite using plenty of Febreeze - next time will sit in the tent outside.']

Name: CafÃ© Chagall
Summary: Russian dishes & drinks presented in a dark, dramatic interior space or on a sidewalk patio.
Opening Hours: Monday: 12:00â€¯PMâ€‰â€“â€‰2:00â€¯AM, Tuesday: 12:00â€¯PMâ€‰â€“â€‰2:00â€¯AM, Wednesday: 12:00â€¯PMâ€‰â€“â€‰2:00â€¯AM, Thursday: 12:00â€¯PMâ€‰â€“â€‰2:00â€¯AM, Friday: 12:00â€¯PMâ€‰â€“â€‰2:00â€¯AM, Saturday: 12:00â€¯PMâ€‰â€“â€‰2:00â€¯AM, Sunday: 12:00â€¯PMâ€‰â€“â€‰2:00â€¯AM
Reviews:
['Wonderful hidden restaurant that we stumbled upon by chance.

The indoors have a Gothic medieval theme, with old benches and tables and candle lights. Loved the ambience and the vice.

Music is nice, service is friendly and prompt. Great selection of beers.

We orders the chicken schnitzel which was nice and crispy, came with a side of fries.

The potato and salmon blini was simply great! Every bite was savoured.

Highly recommended!', 'Great place to celebrate your birthday! I booked the red room and they made everything perfect! They have good burgers.', 'It used to be one of my favorite bars in Berlin, until one day Iâ€™ve forgotten they donâ€™t accept cards.
I had to pay for ONE BEER but didnâ€™t have cash and the waiter denied allowing me to withdraw it from ATM, I had to wait for my friend to bring me the cash.
In general, the stuff was extremely rude and accusing me of scamming them ( again, the bill in question was 3.80 â‚¬ for a bottle of beer :D
Instead of coming here, consider an amazing place nextdoor - Piruette']

Reviews:
['We love this place!

The food is incredible,  especially the pizza ğŸ•

The service is top class, we felt so welcomed every time we came to have food ğŸ‘¨‍ğŸ³

A very classy restaurant with good food and great service, highly recommend!!', 'The food tastes very good, and all the staff are very friendly, if you want good Italian pizza, pasta, and food I really can recommend this place.', 'Really good tasty food, I had a reallyyy generous portion of carbonara and was not able to finish it, even though it was delicious! All the rest was also perfect, positive stuff was bringing good mood, nice cozy atmosphere, not a lot of tables (which is great for me personally). Highly recommended for a date']

Name: Sigiriya
Summary: Warm, understated restaurant specializing in traditional Sri Lankan meals & desserts.
Opening Hours: Monday: 5:00â€‰â€“â€‰11:00â€¯PM, Tuesday: 5:00â€‰â€“â€‰11:00â€¯PM, Wednesday: 5:00â€‰â€“â€‰11:00â€¯PM, Thursday: 12:00â€‰â€“â€‰11:00â€¯PM, Friday: 12:00â€¯PMâ€‰â€“â€‰12:00â€¯AM, Saturday: 12:00â€¯PMâ€‰â€“â€‰12:00â€¯AM, Sunday: 12:00â€‰â€“â€‰11:00â€¯PM
Reviews:
['the kottu was pretty good, not exceptional and definitely needed more salt, and more flavour in general. the curries looked super good though and menu was typically Sri Lankan.
sweet staff, nice chill local vibe. would come again to have hoppers & curry ğŸ˜‡
(half vegan menu, half that you can add meat or fish :))', "Went on Saturday evening no crowd at all.  Get plain Hoppers which are soggy and blent Don't recommended) and nothing is provided to dip in
And vadai is also not tasty at all but served with jam but a good combo

We Get mutton biryani and chicken biriyani
But its not buriyani at all
Just chicken curry and mutton curry mixed with basmati rice with excess oil.
They use an excess amount of salad that does not cut the stems of the leaves also very uncomfortable to eat

Service was good", "â€Sigiriyaâ€ is an absolute must-visit Sri Lankan restaurant for anyone seeking a delightful culinary adventure in Berlin, Germany. From the moment I stepped in, I was transported to Sri Lanka with the restaurant's cozy atmosphere and friendly staff. The service was impeccable - the staff were incredibly wonderful, lovely, and kind, making me feel right at home.

But the true star of the show is the food. Absolutely amazing.  Sigiriya's dishes are mouthwatering and spectacular.  Every bite was a delicious explosion of flavors.

If you're looking for an unforgettable Sri Lankan dining experience that combines exquisite food with exceptional service, look no further than â€™Sigiriyaâ€™ restaurant.

Their hospitality is truly unmatched, and I wholeheartedly recommend this Sri Lankan restaurant to anyone who visit Berlin. Defenitely we will visit you again. Cheers! (Sam & Ruwi - SwedenğŸ‡¸ğŸ‡ª)"]

Name: Restaurant Facil
Summary: Acclaimed fine-dining spot with large glass windows and minimalist decor, serving a seasonal menu.
Reviews: ["The Food, the service and the location are simply awesome. We spontaneously went to Facil for birthday celebration and had the new menu. We absolutely loved it. Highly recommended  :) It's absolutely delicious :)", 'Without question one of the most amazing dining experiences I have had. Ambiance, cuisine and service were all exceptional. I most appreciated the harmony of the individual dishes, which were further enhanced by the well curated wine pairing. Deserving of every star!', 'An excellent dining experience. Lunch menu was very reasonably priced (â‚¬88 for three courses), considering the high quality of the food. After entering the hotel, take the lift on the left to the 5th floor and enter a very airy space. Service was formal and friendly. Cured mackerel was pleasant, but flank steak main and grapefruit pudding were truly excellent. Highly recommend both dishes']

Name: RESTAURANT ELLA
Summary: Sophisticated hotel restaurant serving refined, contemporary European cuisine & complimentary wines.
Reviews:
['Excellent service and kitchen. Very good value for money business lunch: 14,50 EUR for two courses incl a large bottle of water, bread and butter. For 3 euros more you get a dessert as well. Modern German/French kitchen. Great fÃ¼r business meetings or when you want to dine close to main station. Service was fast and helpful. Good choice of wines as well.', 'After paying 70â‚¬ for unsalted, overcooked pasta and a rather starter-sized portion of "catch of the day"-fish, I headed for the burger place at the train station.
As a consultant, I'm used to mediocre hotel restaurant. But price/quality ratio at Ella marks a low.

To be fair: ambient is nice, service friendly.', "Very nice atmosphere, but temporary service staff and long waiting times. The food was prepared rather mediocre and carelessly arranged. The duck for the main course of the 4-course menu, which cost 66 euros, was far too dry, and the potato canneloni filled with red cabbage didn't go well with it. The wine selection was very modest, both quantitatively and qualitatively. The cuisine is below average for a hotel of this category."]

Reviews: ['Service was good but the food unfortunately awful. Not only Pho soup lacked any flavor, they coriander that came with it was half dry and yellow and shouldâ€™ve been thrown away days ago. Also looked like it hasnâ€™t been washed. Also the chicken is the sliced chicken from the bag in a frozen section and taste nothing like chicken - but very strange and has a weird texture. I recommend to stop cutting corners and serving such low quality of food.', 'Delicious food. I love it. Come here again', 'Absolutely terrible. The older gentleman that served us was incredible rude and unwelcoming. Every question we asked, he responded with attitude and annoyance. He did not make it an enjoyable dinner at all. Will never be returning again.']

Name: ErgÃ¼n's Fischbude
Summary: Simple, laid-back tavern for Turkish & Mediterranean dishes with a focus on fish & seafood.
Opening Hours: Monday: 3:30â€‰â€“â€‰11:00â€¯PM, Tuesday: 3:30â€‰â€“â€‰11:00â€¯PM, Wednesday: 3:30â€‰â€“â€‰11:00â€¯PM, Thursday: 3:30â€‰â€“â€‰11:00â€¯PM, Friday: 3:30â€¯PMâ€‰â€“â€‰12:00â€¯AM, Saturday: 3:30â€¯PMâ€‰â€“â€‰12:00â€¯AM, Sunday: 3:30â€‰â€“â€‰11:00â€¯PM
Reviews:
['We were waiting over 1 hour and 15 minutes for our order. Two tables got their food and were already finished when we were still waiting. Waiters just told some rumours that apparently the grill is not working properly. But comes the others got their grilled fish?

If you pay, please ask to break down the costs. There are no receipts and cash only (you know why ;) )', "Nice and hearty Turkish restaurant in Berlin. One of the really few ones offering fresh fish. I also recommend to try their salad!
I had a few dinners there and I suggest to book in advance, especially on weekends as it can get quite crowded.
Overall it's a very nice fish place, with a real Turkish vibe!", 'Very authentic fish tavern!

The place is a long time family business. Itâ€™s more a tavern than a restaurant though.

The food (seafood) is very good. Taste fresh and homemade. We took a salad for 2, kalamaris, red fish and fries. That was enough for 2 persons. We paid 22â‚¬ each with drinks.

The place is full of pictures from visitors, famous people and old memories. Itâ€™s actually very nice. Donâ€™t expect something fancy, this place is nice and genuine but it is not a 4 stars restaurant.

Is worth it doe the food quality.']

Name: Rice On! Berlin
Summary: Modern counter serve offering create-your-own bowls featuring Asian-inspired ingredients.

Opening Hours: Monday: 10:00â€¯AMâ€‰â€“â€‰9:00â€¯PM, Tuesday: 10:00â€¯AMâ€‰â€“â€‰9:00â€¯PM, Wednesday: 10:00â€¯AMâ€‰â€“â€‰9:00â€¯PM, Thursday: 10:00â€¯AMâ€‰â€“â€‰9:00â€¯PM, Friday: 10:00â€¯AMâ€‰â€“â€‰9:00â€¯PM, Saturday: 10:00â€¯AMâ€‰â€“â€‰9:00â€¯PM, Sunday: 10:00â€¯AMâ€‰â€“â€‰9:00â€¯PM
Reviews: ['Located at the right spot at the very entrance of Food court in Berlin Central train station, this Asian food joint is more than awesome for its food quality, taste and price! Service is courteous and quick and the meal portions are great enough to fill hungry tummies either before the journey or after! The taste is one of the true definitions of fusion with all overlapping on one another like Indian, Chinese, Thai and Malaysian, suiting all types of taste buds. We bought their chicken ball bowl and tofu bowl and both were simply great! There is a great differentiator in the name of various sauces they carry like green sauce, red sauce, peanut sauce and tamarind sauce and all sauces are great! I would certainly go back again whenever I cross the station! Highly recommended.', 'Fresh, big size dishes, with love. Very tasty. Ate rice with chicken, broccoli, green beans, as much as you want coriander and tastey sauce!', 'I liked it at first glance it, everything looked fresh and clean. The staff was so nice and everything was delicious! I found it quite filling and was fully satisfied with the quality and price. Iâ€™m very happy to have a fast, healthy, delicious food :) definitely gonna revisit when Iâ€™m here again.']

Opening Hours: Monday: 8:00â€¯AMâ€‰â€“â€‰1:00â€¯AM, Tuesday: 8:00â€¯AMâ€‰â€“â€‰1:00â€¯AM, Wednesday: 8:00â€¯AMâ€‰â€“â€‰1:00â€¯AM, Thursday: 8:00â€¯AMâ€‰â€“â€‰1:00â€¯AM, Friday: 8:00â€¯AMâ€‰â€“â€‰2:00â€¯AM, Saturday: 8:00â€¯AMâ€‰â€“â€‰2:00â€¯AM, Sunday: 8:00â€¯AMâ€‰â€“â€‰2:00â€¯AM
Reviews:
['We stopped in here for breakfast, and in all honesty we really couldnâ€™t have selected in more fitting establishment. We had the farmer â€“ breakfast, and the vegan breakfast, which was served to us with one bread and simit each. we also got the Biscoff pancakes, and everything was served with a healthy portion of fruit. Service at this place was excellent staff friendly, and if you come here youâ€™re even in for a chilly surpriseâ€¦ We spent about â‚¬20 per person on an admittedly lavish brunch. 10/10.', 'Cash only eatery that was absolutely amazing. Insanely great prices and so many options to choose from. Superb coffee, and the food that was delivered was so fresh and tasty. In our visit to Berlin it will be hard to not just come here for breakfast each day!', 'This is by far the best kebap place we have been in Germany.

Their kebaps are very tasty and service is also very good. Portion is very big, if you are nit very hungry, 1 dish is also enough.

We have tried many dishes (Yogurtlu Kebap, Beyti Kebab, Chicken Shish Kebap, Meze platters, Grilled vegetable salad) and everything was good all time.

They give salad and meze plate as a starter before your main dish comes. They also give tea and baklava in the end.

Whenever we want to eat kebap, we always come here.']

Name: Restaurant Pasternak
Summary: Intimate, parquet-floored dining spot with crystal chandeliers & a piano, serving Russo-Jewish fare.
Opening Hours: Monday: 9:00â€¯AMâ€‰â€“â€‰12:00â€¯AM, Tuesday: 9:00â€¯AMâ€‰â€“â€‰12:00â€¯AM, Wednesday: 9:00â€¯AMâ€‰â€“â€‰12:00â€¯AM, Thursday: 9:00â€¯AMâ€‰â€“â€‰12:00â€¯AM, Friday: 9:00â€¯AMâ€‰â€“â€‰12:00â€¯AM, Saturday: 9:00â€¯AMâ€‰â€“â€‰12:00â€¯AM, Sunday: 9:00â€¯AMâ€‰â€“â€‰12:00â€¯AM
Reviews:
['One of the best restaurants you will find in this area and is worth a visit for some breakfast, brunch or lunch.

A big East European influence throughout the menu. Their breakfast choices, especially No2, is fantastic, as are the pancakes, which I was reliably informed once again by the "experts" in my family, were really really good.

Coffee was excellent as was their home made lemonade.

Service and atmosphere are first rate and deserve a mention. A great choice if the weather looks half decent as well.

There is a lot to choose from in this area, and still, this one sits above the others I have been to. Highly recommended.', "Classic eastern european style place in a nice, relaxing neighborhood with beautiful scenery if you choose to sit outside.

Food was amazing and beautifully presented on the plate. I mainly went because I was craving borscht and I was satisfied. The lunch(?) plates were packed with many components and each of them delicious. Many veggie options to choose from, you don't feel like it's just an afterthought. Vegan options also available.

Price is a bit on the higher end but because the food is good it's worth it for me. Service was friendly and fast.", 'The salmon was incredibly soft and tasty. Staff were friendly except at the end we couldnâ€™t get the attention of the waiter after we paid with a credit card. We returned the credit card machine to the counter.']

Name: Lemongrass

Reviews: ['Had a great dinner in this restaurant! All dishes taste authentic as they should be. Good vibe and good service. Highly recommended for everyone who loves authentic Thai cuisine ğŸ‘ğŸ¾ğŸ‘ğŸ¾', 'I was passing by this place and the Tom Yum soup looked delicious so I decided to book for the evening. My mumâ€™s pad Thai was truly delicious while I was expecting better from the green curry â€” I kinda left hungry, the portion wasnâ€™t big. Anyway for the price I will definitely come back again, surely for the pad Thai. They had many take away orders but the staff, the guy who served us in particular, was attentive and kind with clients in the restaurant. Thank you!', "Worst pad Thai I have ever eaten. It's super salty and too wet. I have to drink half a glass of water after one bite. I added an extra noodles and it was still super salty, so I had to leave itğŸ˜¢ But the fried rice is good. Service attitude is a bit rude but acceptable"]

Name: Masha's Bagels & Delicatessen
Summary: Down-to-earth counter-serve with sidewalk seats doling out NYC-style bagels & sandwiches.
Opening Hours: Monday: 9:00â€¯AMâ€‰â€“â€‰3:00â€¯PM, Tuesday: Closed, Wednesday: Closed, Thursday: 9:00â€¯AMâ€‰â€“â€‰3:00â€¯PM, Friday: 9:00â€¯AMâ€‰â€“â€‰3:00â€¯PM, Saturday: 9:00â€¯AMâ€‰â€“â€‰3:00â€¯PM, Sunday: 10:00â€¯AMâ€‰â€“â€‰3:00â€¯PM
Reviews:
["Lovely place with great bagels (tracing their history from the NYC, as I've found out) and service. The lads got a kitchen that's working up to 3 PM, but they went above and beyond to get a bagel to a hungry man (me) and got me a New York Classic (which was very nice). Apart from Classic, my top 1 choice would be reuben-style sandwich. Coffee is great too, water refills are available, overall - can recommend.", 'The bagels are quite stuffed and filling! I had the breakfast bagel with extra bacon and avocado â€” mine was delicious. My boyfriend had the chipotle Turkey bagel and although it was packed with Turkey (yay) it was incredibly (!) bland. Nothing chipotle about this chipotle bagel. We would name it plain Turkey bagel ğŸ˜‚', "Have been thinking for quite a while that there was a serious lack of bagel places in Berlin that were worth going to, and man does this place really fill that void.

The iced coffee was smooth and velvety and the Reuben Sandwich was bomb. Seriously I've been dreaming about the sandwich since I ate it. The bagels have great crunch/chew as well.

10/10 will be back"]

Name: Viale dei Tigli
Summary: Long-standing, relaxed eatery with sidewalk tables serving up typical Italian dishes & aperitifs.
Opening Hours: Monday: 12:00â€¯PMâ€‰â€“â€‰12:00â€¯AM, Tuesday: 12:00â€¯PMâ€‰â€“â€‰12:00â€¯AM, Wednesday: 12:00â€¯PMâ€‰â€“â€‰12:00â€¯AM, Thursday: 12:00â€¯PMâ€‰â€“â€‰12:00â€¯AM, Friday: 12:00â€¯PMâ€‰â€“â€‰12:00â€¯AM, Saturday: 12:00â€¯PMâ€‰â€“â€‰12:00â€¯AM, Sunday: 12:00â€¯PMâ€‰â€“â€‰12:00â€¯AM
Reviews:
['Not to be recommended. Everything is overcooked.
Look at the picture of what used to be carrots, beans and potatoes. I did eat the dorade dish, which was also overcooked.
According to the menu it would be on a bed on spinach, but it ended up on top of some rocket.

Just go elsewhere.', 'Everything was delicious! Very quick service with a very friendly and energetic staff.', 'I had the absolute worst experience at Viale dei Tigli. From the moment we walked in, the staff were incredibly unprofessional and downright rude. It felt like they were only interested in taking our money without providing any form of service. Our waiter seemed annoyed and indifferent to our requests, and the food arrived late and cold.

But the worst part is that it is clearly a tourist trap. They do everything to cheat with the bill. We found extra charges and dishes we never ordered. When we pointed this out, the waiter became defensive and tried to explain it away with poor excuses. In the end, we had to fight to get the bill corrected, which ruined the entire experience.

I strongly advise against anyone visiting Viale dei Tigli. If you donâ€™t want to feel cheated and poorly treated, find somewhere else to eat.']

Reviews:
['Really nice food and really nice servers! We also had the most delicious rioja with our meal. Highly recommend for lunch or dinner. Good for vegetarians too. Cozy, casual but makes for a special meal with friends or a date night.', 'Sabore by Chef Mario, near Kotti, you can experience the passion for Napolitan cuisine expressed in every dish, from their pizzas, to their pastas, antipasti and desserts

We were impressed us by the quality, presentation and taste of the pizzas, some of which have been honoured with national and international awards

We tried 3 of their pizzas, including the award-winning Pizza Liguori - The Legend (19â‚¬), Pizza Burrata & Mortadella (19â‚¬), and Pizza Diavolo â€œSaboreâ€ (17â‚¬) that came literally in flames!', 'Without a doubt, the best pizza in town! Amazing doe and the highest quality produce for toppings, including the most important ingredient: love (for pizza). Mario is a true Italian "patrone" and Maria provides amazing service. 5 stars!']

Name: Il Ritrovo - Cucina Casalinga Popolare
Summary: Italian-style pizzas whipped up in cool space with wall scribblings & vintage posters.
Reviews: ["Usually I really like this place. But sometimes the pizzas are completely burned underneath which definitely is a health issue. Unfortunately I didn't check my take away pizza before I left and only saw it today when I noticed a bad taste.\nPlease please please control your pizzas before you give them out like this...\nIt's 30â‚¬ for two pizzas which are burnt... :-/", "Honestly one of my favorite restaurants in the world. Ritrovo encapsulates the rebellious grittyness that Berlin radiates and combines it with top tier Italian food. I've come here pretty much all my life and they never disappoint with a pizza crust so thin and delicious any future pizzas you order will seem like American deep dish. Come here to get great food, experience a great atmosphere, service is serviceable. Also they left a little complimentary drink on the table with some bread to wash it down, very thick and tasted like olives, good tho.", 'The staff was really friendly, the pizzas arenâ€™t expensive and theyâ€™re super big. So for the price itâ€™s a really good deal. The pizzas are authentic Italian pizzas and the menu is in Italian and German. I really like atmosphere there, and thatâ€™s probably why itâ€™s so popular. I had a really good time there. Would recommend this place']

We ordered three happy meals for the kids but there were no toys. They also forgot to serve fries with the meals. No napkins provided either.']

Name: Orania.Restaurant & Orania.Bar
Summary: High-end, international food & cocktails are served in this refined space with live music.
Opening Hours: Monday: 6:30â€¯AMâ€‰â€“â€‰10:30â€¯PM, Tuesday: 6:30â€¯AMâ€‰â€“â€‰10:30â€¯PM, Wednesday: 6:30â€¯AMâ€‰â€“â€‰10:30â€¯PM, Thursday: 6:30â€¯AMâ€‰â€“â€‰10:30â€¯PM, Friday: 6:30â€¯AMâ€‰â€“â€‰10:30â€¯PM, Saturday: 6:30â€¯AMâ€‰â€“â€‰10:30â€¯PM, Sunday: 6:30â€¯AMâ€‰â€“â€‰10:30â€¯PM
Reviews:
['Iâ€˜ve actually sympathized with going to the Orania Restaurant for at least a couple of years. I guess the trigger was one of the very first articles Iâ€˜ve read about the â€Peking/Kreuzberg Duck Menuâ€œ and the (intrinsic) stopper probably was the restaurant being a â€hotel restaurantâ€œ. Iâ€˜ve to admit, I gave the place a first check by visiting the Bar for some drinks after a stroll with a friend on Oranienstreet the other day. And guess what, our Bar experience was amazing!
So the Orania Restaurant became my very first choice for this yearâ€™s birthday dinner, to finally go for the â€mysteriousâ€œ Kreuzberg Duck (X-Bergs answer to the Peking Duck)! Not sure if thereâ€™s a word cut here and therefore giving the executive summary first: w/o questionâ€¦ one of the top 5 culinary experiences in Berlin for me over the past 21years Iâ€˜d the pleasure of living & enjoying many-many wonderful & inspirational culinary events here.
No way of mentioning even some of them here w/o dissing/missing others. As well Iâ€˜d the opportunity to run some wonderful & mystic places as part of an awesome team myself.
Ok. Letâ€™s cut the marketing blabla. Listen folks, as a trained chef, a foodie & service lover by DNA as well as someone who fully gets, reads & understands the challenges of the moment, this experience was simply â€Extraordinaryâ€œ!
The four course Kreuzberg Duck menu has been one of the top notch culinary & value4money experiences in Berlin EVER! On top of that the food was accompanied by an out of ordinary level of service. Iâ€˜d guess, that over the 4 courses weâ€˜d had a minimum of 10 different service & chef people at the table. Might sound stressful, but believe me, it was a pure pleasure to get to know every single one of them, especially because of their so much away from average commitment & positive energy which came with each & everyone!
Folks, hands on my heart, I paid the full bill and this feedback is 100% personal, not paid at all and simply based on my beliefs to â€give backâ€œ!
Before ending, my wifeâ€™s favorite part of a menu is the dessert (-> yeahhh, sheâ€™s a true sweetheart ğŸ˜) and even here, these crazy folks not only send their â€TV style PattissiÃ¨reâ€œ to our table, but she also dropped some freaking amazing, no chi-chi & simply really tasty desserts.
Ok. I get it. Itâ€™s seems far too much for an unpaid review, but hej, how much crap, average, overrated and simply â€not ever come back shitâ€œ have you been going through!?
So I thought, Iâ€˜d might want to allow myself to get really carried away for once ğŸ˜‰!
Again, very personal, very much of a Monday evening and very-very slightly infused by birthday emotions.
Simply fueled by a very special experience, which I believe needs to be shared! N-joy folks!', "Returning to Orania for my second visit was an absolute delight. Nestled within a charming hotel, this restaurant offers a unique dining experience where the open kitchen concept takes center stage. Being able to watch the culinary team at work adds an intimate touch to the meal, bridging the gap between chef and diner.

The food, without a doubt, was exceptional. Each dish was a sophisticated blend of flavors, clearly showcasing the kitchen's dedication to quality and creativity. What stood out just as much was the professionalism and attentiveness of the staff. Their attention to detail ensured a flawless dining experience from start to finish.

I left Orania feeling thoroughly impressed once again. For anyone looking for an exquisite dining experience in Berlin, I wholeheartedly recommend Orania. It's not just a meal; it's an experience that speaks to the senses and lingers in memory.", 'Everything is almost OK. In my opinion, the last course, which is fried rice, could be better, why? Because the first course and second course is full of flavors, the fried rice is missing some salt or sauce, maybe. And i would like to have a "real rice," not some crispy rice.ğŸ¤·‍â™€ï¸']

Reviews:
['best middle eastern food tasted in Berlin, it was during middle of week, itâ€™s next to a beautiful canal, staff speaks English as well, food is amazing a true taste of Middle East. staff is friendly and price is reasonable.', 'Itâ€™s an oriental Lebanese restaurant with all decorations and vibes .
The kofta was well seasoned and smoked.
Chicken was tender and delicious.
The meat was tender and the sauce was flavorful.
The drink wasnâ€™t as expected but not bad as well.
The staff were really friendly with us
They accept card payments and cash too.', "This restaurant offers two dining options: a buffet, which I recommend, and Ã  la carte selections from the menu. We opted for lunch here, finding the food tasty, albeit slightly oily. The buffet is priced at 10 euros per person, making it a great choice for a quick and economical meal. I'd suggest this place for those looking for value and convenience."]
