Name: Skykitchen
Summary: Innovative global dishes & sweeping city views from a sleek 12th-floor space with edgy decor.
Opening Hours: Monday: Closed, Tuesday: Closed, Wednesday: 6:00â€‰â€“â€‰11:00â€¯PM, Thursday: 6:00â€‰â€“â€‰11:00â€¯PM, Friday: 6:00â€‰â€“â€‰11:00â€¯PM, Saturday: 6:00â€‰â€“â€‰11:00â€¯PM, Sunday: Closed
Reviews:
['We had the perfect sky view of the golden hour while having the dessert. Their serving was perfectly just in time until sundown. Excellent service, knowledgeable and attentive team, and the courses were just amazing. I appreciate that they were willing to customise the courses to adjust to my crustacean-molluscan allergy. It truly was an experience to remember and the greatest place to celebrate my boyfriendâ€™s birthday. â¤ï¸

Thank you, Team Skykitchen ğŸŒ¸', 'Amazing degustation menu from beginning until the end with a perfect service and a wonderful view.', 'Decor and ambience reminds me of Alice in wonderland and or Peter Pan â€œfairy tale like.â€ The seating arrangement for 2 person if you like a view is against the lining of the window facing outwards (like in a cafe) as oppose to traditional two person  table top in the middle of the room. The kitchen was behind us with glass over so it was â€œopen kitchenâ€ concept and I love to observe the team as they were super focused.

The staff does extremely well speaking in German and English. They were very personable and provided their favorite wines and were knowledgeable of their menu. Definitely Michelin worthy service. Each dish was presented with an attentive explanation.

The menu i believe is fusion cuisine featuring molecular gastronomy. The â€œonsen egg.â€ was the star of the evening and also their chocolate at the end for dessert. I want to point out the wine menu is very unique and noteworthy due to the fact it features mainly wines from Germany and eastwards. We selected the Slovenian bottle that is only carried at this restaurant and it paired beautifully with the dishes. Highly recommend this bottle if you get a chance to try it.']

Name: Sofram
Summary: Kebabs & other familiar Turkish plates turned out in a casual setup with tables & banquettes.
Opening Hours: Monday: 9:00â€¯AMâ€‰â€“â€‰11:00â€¯PM, Tuesday: 9:00â€¯AMâ€‰â€“â€‰11:00â€¯PM, Wednesday: 9:00â€¯AMâ€‰â€“â€‰11:00â€¯PM, Thursday: 9:00â€¯AMâ€‰â€“â€‰11:00â€¯PM, Friday: 9:00â€¯AMâ€‰â€“â€‰11:00â€¯PM, Saturday: 9:00â€¯AMâ€‰â€“â€‰11:00â€¯PM, Sunday: Closed
Reviews:
['Very tasty chicken kebabs and meatballs. Beautiful looking bread but weâ€™re on Keto! ğŸ˜« Lovely black tea to finish.', 'A very traditional place where you can find: healty products, smiling people and affordable prices. Not so often the picture on the menu represents what you will have, well, not in this case! I saw a nice picture of a Hallumi salat and what came to me was exactly the same. Check my pic and compare with the one on the menu. Waiters were very kind and always keep an eye on me if I need something. Kitchen is open (you can see the grill) and the offered me a nice tea at the end of the dinner. I will definitely come back here.', 'Must say the food is very delicious, service is nice and fast.
The only downside is that you can pay only with cash.
But overall very good experience.
Highly recommended.']

Name: VIET HA - Goldener Karpfen
Summary: Simple eatery serving sushi & pan-Asian mains in compact, unassuming surroundings.
Opening Hours: Monday: 11:00â€¯AMâ€‰â€“â€‰10:00â€¯PM, Tuesday: 11:00â€¯AMâ€‰â€“â€‰10:00â€¯PM, Wednesday: 11:00â€¯AMâ€‰â€“â€‰10:00â€¯PM, Thursday: 11:00â€¯AMâ€‰â€“â€‰10:00â€¯PM, Friday: 11:00â€¯AMâ€‰â€“â€‰10:00â€¯PM, Saturday: 12:00â€‰â€“â€‰10:00â€¯PM, Sunday: 12:00â€‰â€“â€‰10:00â€¯PM
Reviews:
["It's a cosy Vietnamese restaurant. The food is really good and has a great quantity. Great ambience and polite service. Highly recommend. It's a few meters from Strausberg platz U bahn. I don't know if it's available on wolt, I have added the menu as well.", 'This little restaurant is one of my favorite ones around the neighborhood! The staff is always so kind and friendly and the portions are huge and very tasty!

5/5 ğŸ™‚', 'This is perfect restaurant to treat your taste buds for Vietnamese food. I being a frequent visitor to this place have tried multiple Vietnamese dishes and have to say they are worth it for the price they are offering.

The staff working here is really helpful and if you are first time visitor to this place they will help you to choose a perfect dish according to your interest.

This place offers both veg and non-veg food so you have big menu to try from.

Always served piping hot and freshly prepared noodles, chicken and veg options. You can visit here for breakfast, Lunch and Dinner.

The payment can be made by card or cash depending on the option you have available with you.

And most importantly, they have both English as well as German Menu Card so they can serve a large number of customers( yes, staff speaks fluent English ğŸ˜€ and obviously German).

Enjoy your dish and hit like if you find this review helpful.

TschÃ¼ss ğŸ¤ŸğŸ¼']

Reviews: ['Read it on a blog, apparently it was the number one DÃ¶ner Spot and i swear to god. The chicken was inedible. The only redeeming quality were the warm fries and i was hungry. Disgusting', 'Really good dÃ¶ner in Berlin! Sizes are gigantic and it tastes like kiss of Allah!', "We'd heard this was one of the best places for doner in Berlin. The bread was good but neither the meat nor the falafel was anything special. The two men working behind the counter almost seemed as though they'd rather we hadn't come in. Maybe it was an off night but from this experience I'd say you don't need to go out of your way to eat here."]

Name: Brauhaus SÃ¼dstern
Summary: Bustling brewery featuring specialty beers, hearty dishes & schnitzels, plus a beer garden.

Reviews: ["Very nice, good typical brewery house. I've been here in a company event and as a regular. I've had fun times! Beer is very good (very heavy tho). Food was good. Nice location next to the park. Totally recommended.", 'During my stay in Berlin, we visited this place for lunch and were seated in their delightful outdoor seating area. The food was quite good, featuring typical German dishes, and they served beer from their own brewery.\n\nIn our case, the service was friendly and excellent. The prices were reasonable and average for Berlin, making it an affordable option.', "We've had a dinner at that place. Food quality was very good and the beer was excellent which they produce and have their own brand. Cosy atmosphere and very friendly young lady who served us. We were very about everything."]

Name: KAFFE

Name: OMONI ì˜¤ ëª¨ ë‹ˆ
Summary: Simple, wood-lined environment with counter seating, offering sushi, sashimi & rice dishes.
Opening Hours: Monday: Closed, Tuesday: Closed, Wednesday: 5:00â€‰â€“â€‰11:00â€¯PM, Thursday: 5:00â€‰â€“â€‰11:00â€¯PM, Friday: 5:00â€‰â€“â€‰11:00â€¯PM, Saturday: 5:00â€‰â€“â€‰11:00â€¯PM, Sunday: 5:00â€‰â€“â€‰11:00â€¯PM
Reviews:
['Amazing sushi place.
Probably I would keep the crown of best sushis of Berlin between them and Sasaya.
Loved the super fresh fish, delicious combinations, perfectly cooked rice, beautiful ceramics and a lovely, calm and peaceful atmosphere.
Extra kudos for an AC (not so common in Berlin) and for being pet friendly.
Absolutely wonderful experience, can only recommend!
Thanks for the great service as well.', 'Wow, if you are looking for some amazing and authentic sushi in Berlin, I definitely recommend this restaurant. Make sure to book your table as it can get packed and itâ€™s so worth it! Itâ€™s a chill spot where you can enjoy some great sushi for a great price.', 'Absolutely bizarre experience very badly handled by inexperienced staff.

This is not a food review as we werent served. We were visiting our friend in Berlin who reserved the table for us a week in advance. Heâ€™s been to this restaurant many times and is (was) a loyal customer.

When we showed up they told us that our name is not on the list and that they dont have any table for us (most of the tables were still free as the people didnt show up for their reservations).

They even asked my friend to show a call log to prove that he called. Which he did! It was an obvious mistake on the part of this restaurantâ€™s staff, but instead of serving a customer who was already in the restaurant and arranging us a table while rescheduling someone who had a reservation later, they just behaved silly, repeating the same â€we see you called but the list..â€ like a broken record.

We finally left because it was clear they were incapable of correcting their mistake and found much better option for dinner at the end.']

Name: leo e pepe

Reviews: ['Great food , even greater people. 5/5 would absolutely recommend to everyone. Its a mouth watering dessert which has dark chocolate and coffee taste and as you put in in your mouth, it melts like butter. Delicious is also a very small word I would say. Do try it once if you visit this restaurant.', 'My best Italian restaurant in Berlin. Tasty food and excellent service. All waiters are great very polite and professional. Pizza is fantastic but I love the most Gnocchi e Pepe â¤ï¸ğŸ‘Œ']

Name: Tangs Kantine
Summary: Dim sum & classic Szechuan & Shanghai cuisine served in a modest eatery with a sidewalk terrace.
Reviews:
['Tasty authentic food. I ate dimsams, a small portion of wonton soup and cucumber salad (be careful, it is really spicy. I ll be glad to return here. Any smell of cooking in the restaurant, by the way.', 'It gets really busy during lunch time, cash payment only. Food was tasty, love their fluffy white rice!', 'Had imagined itâ€™s a good authentic Chinese place. Maybe it is, if we go back and try some more selections. But overall, it was pretty underwhelming.

Seating outdoors is possible and we got the wok tips (fried dumplings) and the Shanghai Ente and Ente im GlÃ¼ck. Neither of them are that great, the dumplings were fine, nothing spectacular.

Starters came out pretty quick, but food took a pretty long time to come out. So as mentioned earlier, give it a shot but it wouldnâ€™t be on my list of recommendations. An average place for me.']

Name: McDonald's
Summary: Classic, long-running fast-food chain known for its burgers & fries.

Reviews: ['Even if the staff was nice, the Royal cheese Hamburger was dry and Iâ€™m talking not only about meet but the bun was crispy and it shouldnâ€™t. On top of that we were told that they donâ€™t sell some of burgers that are in the standard McDonaldâ€™s menus, for example filet-o-fish and even if the position that you want is in â€œtheirâ€ menu you canâ€™t be sure if itâ€™s available. Do not recommend that restaurant. :(', 'It seems dangerous to go into 3 star mcdonalds, but in Berlin its average. Heighest rating mcdonald is 4 stars in Berlin so we werent that much afraid of this franchize. They dont take Mcdonalds points from phone app and also the sortiment is smaller then in bigger Mc restaurants I got it. For me it was average visit of any other Mcdonalds restaurant in Europe. Stuff was very friendly and free to help. Burgers were just a classic burgers, havent seen something strange.\nYeah we liked it', 'Itâ€™s disgusting there were roaches running around :(']

Name: Ephraims
Summary: Long-running spot for classic German dishes in a historic mansion or on a terrace with river views.
Reviews: ['Real authentic German food. Went there because a friend was visiting and wanted to experience traditional German cuisine.\nSo there we were, in the most German looking restaurant, with the most German tasting food. Coming from a place where German food was often regarded as bland and boring I was pretty surprised to discover itâ€™s not really the case! I mean, not a huge fan of boiled or steamed food so I guess I wasnâ€™t going to be a big fan of it anyways but itâ€™s some of the nicest boiled potato and steamed fish Iâ€™ve tried. Also the decor and the service were perfect. Thanks!', 'Really good food, the Pike was fantastic. Brilliant atmosphere and excellent service. Most amazing Apfel Strudel to end a perfect lunch.', 'Best food I have had during my 5 days in Berlin, and cheap price as well! Salad had very fresh vegetables, smoked salmon was wonderful, and presentation was pretty. Service 10/10; super helpful and friendly.']

Name: I due forni
Summary: Casual Italian restaurant serving pizza, pasta, beer & wine in a cozy, brick-lined space.
Reviews:
['The place has a vibe and food is prepared fast, with big portions and tastes amazing. However service can be faster and waiters can pay more attention to smaller groups as well. Otherwise very good restaurant and definitely recommend the house wines!!!!!', 'Amazing location, with great pizzas. The service was super friendly and we enjoyed our time on the terrace during a warm Berlin summer night. Wonderful place to gather with a larger group and have great value for your money! Especially in the area it is a great launching point for your night.', "Suitable for a team event, a small dinner or anything in between.
The seafood pasta is always worth it, as is the tiramisu and I've never had a bad pizza here.
Sometimes the kitchen is a bit busy but even so you won't have to wait too long.
Great for takeout too"]

Name: Zur Haxe
Summary: Waiting staff in dirndls & lederhosen serve meaty dishes like pork knuckle at this Bavarian stop.
Opening Hours: Monday: 4:00â€¯PMâ€‰â€“â€‰12:00â€¯AM, Tuesday: 4:00â€¯PMâ€‰â€“â€‰12:00â€¯AM, Wednesday: Closed, Thursday: 4:00â€¯PMâ€‰â€“â€‰12:00â€¯AM, Friday: 4:00â€¯PMâ€‰â€“â€‰12:00â€¯AM, Saturday: 12:00â€¯PMâ€‰â€“â€‰12:00â€¯AM, Sunday: 12:00â€¯PMâ€‰â€“â€‰12:00â€¯AM
Reviews:
["Bavarian themed restaurant, serving up a host of traditional German/Bavarian meals, from schnitzel, sauerkraut, dumplings, and their speciality slow cooked (roasted and boiled) pork knuckle and lamb shank dishes.
The restaurant is beautifully decorated in traditional Bavarian decor, and the staff is kitted out in traditional outfits, which adds to the experience - one waiter, who is a funny friendly guy, even went so far as to grow an impressive beard (see pics)
Even more impressive is the food, which is rustik and homely. I had the goulash soup as a starter, which was hearty with a full depth of flavour, with a generous portion of thick cut veg and chunks of beef, and a generous portion. I then had the slow roast pork knuckle, with potato dumplings and sauerkraut, with a kind of gravy sauce. The pork fell off the bone, and was tender and moist, coated with a beautifully crisp and fatty crackling, which was all made to work with the sauce and sauerkraut to cut through the richness of the fat.
The portion sizes were HUGE, and definitely something you could share with 2 people, if you don't feel like you could face a whole portion on your own, which I had to force myself to do.
I had a look at the schnitzel another table had next to me, and vowed to go back just to try that when next in Berlin, it looked so good!
As well as the amazing food, the staff were super warm, friendly, and accommodating. I turned up without a booking, and they happily squeezed me in between bookings without making me feel a nuisance.
I had a lovely pint of Warsteiner with the meal, and all in all it came to only â‚¬30.50 (Â£25) which, in the UK could easily be double that amount. Considering the portions are enough for 2, then I'd say that's great value for money.
I can't recommend this place more!", 'Homely Bavarian restaurant with lovely warm atmosphere. The food is great, the service is always very good.', 'A nice and traditional German restaurant with spacious and cozy environment. The foods are very clean and delicious. I specially like schnitzel a lot. The desserts here are very delicious and not too sweet. Vanilla ice cream is perfect taste. I recommend to visit this place. The staff are nice and friendly.']

Name: Humboldt Forum im Berliner Schloss
Summary: Originally built in the 15th century, this stately royal & imperial palace offers exhibits & tours.
Opening Hours: Monday: 10:30â€¯AMâ€‰â€“â€‰6:30â€¯PM, Tuesday: Closed, Wednesday: 10:30â€¯AMâ€‰â€“â€‰6:30â€¯PM, Thursday: 10:30â€¯AMâ€‰â€“â€‰6:30â€¯PM, Friday: 10:30â€¯AMâ€‰â€“â€‰6:30â€¯PM, Saturday: 10:30â€¯AMâ€‰â€“â€‰6:30â€¯PM, Sunday: 10:30â€¯AMâ€‰â€“â€‰6:30â€¯PM
Reviews: ['Visited Humboldt Forum in June 2024 on a sunny weekend. The Museum Island was crowded with visitors relaxing and enjoying the sun. The Forum is located at the center of the island, and next to the subway line 5. The visit to Humboldt Forum was very pleasant. The collections are mostly free. Couple of highlights about its facility: 1. lockers and cloakroom allows flight carry on size luggage, and check them for visitors for free. 2. There is a bistro with various reasonably priced lunch options. 3. Roof terrace costs 5 Euro for access. But one can make a reservation at its roof terrace restaurant Baret to enjoy a cup of coffee and the Dom view. I went there for its Asian Art collection located on the third floor, and happily surprised with its temporary collections there, especially with the Wang Shu designed exhibition hall. Of course, one question the visitors might have after reading the descriptions of some of the objects in the hall is  the museum\'s efforts and role in addressing the ethical dilemma of preserving those admittedly "looted" during the Boxer Rebellion. Overall, the Forum also made efforts in including more English language description of objects that\'s more friendly to non-German speaking visitors. At the beginning of the Asian Art collection, there is also a timeline of the transformation of its collection since 19th century. One suggestion for future improvement of presenting such a timeline is to use different colors for English and German texts, and explain acronyms on the side. It would be easier for the visitors to follow.', "Lovely and magical place, for me it's one of the best places and one of the  best areas in Berlin. Not only is the museum free, but it contains great exposition and great items inside.\n\nThere is an observatory which is around 5 euros to access but you'll have one of the best views in Berlin. You won't regret visiting here.", 'The rooftop must be one of the best places to see the sunset and also see couples of tourist attractions like Berlin Cathedral, TV towel, etc. Plus, the staff at the roof top are very friendly, there wasnt anything I like on the main menu, so I only want to order drinks. And he said, dont worry. Just enjoy the view.']

Name: Charlotte & Fritz
Summary: Upscale fine-dining venue with chandeliers, serving acclaimed French-inspired meat & seafood dishes.
Opening Hours: Monday: Closed, Tuesday: Closed, Wednesday: Closed, Thursday: 6:00â€‰â€“â€‰10:30â€¯PM, Friday: 6:00â€‰â€“â€‰10:30â€¯PM, Saturday: 6:00â€‰â€“â€‰10:30â€¯PM, Sunday: Closed
Reviews:
["There are different high-class restaurants. This one have their own old German atmosphere and a very tasty fresh dishes. The portions aren't so big, that you can't breathe, but also aren't too small, that you are going away hungry. I think three courses are enough. Also, there is a choice of an old and good alcohol, such as armaniak, Obstler, good vibes and others.", 'Wow ! What can I say ! simply stunning ... the whole experience was fabulous. My finance booked a surprise evening for my family/friends and I for my 50th Birthday week-end ! The restaurant did an outstanding job and we all loved it from start to finish. All the staff were outstanding  - their customer service skills were beyond excellent ! I have to give a shout out to the head waiter who has served at the hotel where the restaurant is for 30 years.

The food was absolutely divine and the restaurant setting was stunning. We were a group of 12 , and the entire restaurant team handled us so well.

Thank you so much for making my birthday week-end in Berlin so memorable.', 'We have dined at the Charlotte&Fritz on New Yearâ€™s eve. Not only was the food delicious and the wine great, but also the ambience and the service of the personnel could not be any better. The restaurant is   equipped with stylish furniture, and nice   decorations which we were lucky to enjoy because we visited on the 31/12.
The wine made an excellent combination with the aesthetic meals.
If you are fond of gourmet food and nice stylish restaurants-Charlotte&Fritz is for you:)']

Name: Zille-Stube
Summary: Old-fashioned restaurant with outdoor seats preparing traditional fare & cocktails.
Opening Hours: Monday: 12:00â€‰â€“â€‰11:00â€¯PM, Tuesday: 12:00â€‰â€“â€‰11:00â€¯PM, Wednesday: Closed, Thursday: 12:00â€‰â€“â€‰11:00â€¯PM, Friday: 12:00â€‰â€“â€‰11:00â€¯PM, Saturday: 12:00â€‰â€“â€‰11:00â€¯PM, Sunday: 12:00â€‰â€“â€‰11:00â€¯PM
Reviews: ['May 2024 update.\nFantastic spot directly at the water. Personnel was very friendly and food was great. Berliner dishes looking great and tasting even better. Highly reccomended. Large and clean toilets are a plus.', 'A beautiful place well located overlooking the Spree River, pleasant atmosphere, good food and generous portions', 'Excellent spot to sit by the River Spree, have a few drinks and order some pretty good food, service was excellent, food was great, and the views amazing. A little pricey but you are paying for the location.']

Name: Zollpackhof
Summary: Restaurant with central fire, 2 patios & beer garden serving German food with Mediterranean twists.
Reviews:
['Fantastic place to eat, drink, and relax. The terrace is lovely and has the full menu from the restaurant (German and English menus available). Service is perfect - efficient and friendly. We came back another day and tried the biergarten, under an ancient wide spread tree that sheltered us from the sun or sprinkles.

I really liked the white asparagus, only in season during early summer, and the cheese sauce for the pretzel.', 'Relatively high end German beer garden with tasty food, great beer and wine, also friendly attentive staff. Been here a couple of times and it never disappoints. Great buisness lunch deal 14 euros and water included. Will return again when in the neighborhood', "Just sat down for a beer to enjoy the view and it started raining!
Stayed to eat and enjoy a beer or 2 , lovely calming garden area , good food and drink , tried the snapps, it's not for everyone! Lol
We had to ask nicely, but the restaurant did allow us to take away a cake for birthday ğŸ‚"]

Name: Lunch Time
Summary: Compact Italian counter-serve place offering pizza, pasta & salads in informal surrounds.
Opening Hours: Monday: 8:00â€¯AMâ€‰â€“â€‰7:00â€¯PM, Tuesday: 8:00â€¯AMâ€‰â€“â€‰7:00â€¯PM, Wednesday: 8:00â€¯AMâ€‰â€“â€‰7:00â€¯PM, Thursday: 8:00â€¯AMâ€‰â€“â€‰7:00â€¯PM, Friday: 8:00â€¯AMâ€‰â€“â€‰7:00â€¯PM, Saturday: Closed, Sunday: Closed
Reviews:
['Nice place for breakfast. Everythig was very fast. Pizza, egg breakfast, coffee were very tasty. Friendly staff. Recommended.', 'Fine little cafe with many different things to eat.
I tried a pizza ğŸ• slice and it was huge :)
Flavor was okay but a bit bland. Could not eat everything.

A bit nosy with a boom box blasting radio over the place.

It was clean', 'A short walk from Museum Island, this Pizza/Pasta place was a nice lunch break for the hungry traveler. The veggie pizza, lentil soup, and house salad all hit the spot. Even our picky eater devoured his food.']

Name: Fatih Servet DÃ¶ner
Summary: Petite counter-serve member of a chain serving meat skewers, plus salads & pizza.
Opening Hours: Monday: 9:00â€¯AMâ€‰â€“â€‰4:00â€¯AM, Tuesday: 9:00â€¯AMâ€‰â€“â€‰4:00â€¯AM, Wednesday: 9:00â€¯AMâ€‰â€“â€‰4:00â€¯AM, Thursday: 9:00â€¯AMâ€‰â€“â€‰4:00â€¯AM, Friday: 9:00â€¯AMâ€‰â€“â€‰4:00â€¯AM, Saturday: 9:00â€¯AMâ€‰â€“â€‰4:00â€¯AM, Sunday: 9:00â€¯AMâ€‰â€“â€‰4:00â€¯AM
Reviews: ["I enjoyed my visit here. The staff were super friendly, which made the whole experience even better. One thing that really stood out was how fast they cooked everything. If you're in a rush, this place is perfect for grabbing a quick bite. No long waits here, just speedy service and hot food. I went for the dÃ¼rÃ¼m, and it was filling. The taste was goodâ€”nothing too crazy, but good. Plus, the portions were pretty generous, so youâ€™re definitely getting your moneyâ€™s worth. All in all, this dÃ¶ner spot has a lot going for it: friendly staff, quick service, and decent prices. It's a great pick if you need something fast and tasty.", 'It is very tasty and delicious food is delivered there. It is very strongly recommended to have your meal after a long trip and tiredness.  And the price is good and not expensive.', 'I was there at the main station after 9.30 pm, and not everything was open. So, easiest pick was kebap. I ordered a DÃ¶ner box. I have to say the kebap had a different and good taste. I picked KraÃ¼ter sauce and it was tasty. The service was a bit chaotic for me, as the person who took my order forgot to process my order. Nevertheless, they were able to realize fast once they asked me to pay for Sis Kebap, which I did not order. ğŸ˜…']

Name: Sabore
Summary: Breakfast plates, meze & grills, plus vegan options, in rustic-chic surrounds or at sidewalk tables.
Opening Hours: Monday: 11:30â€¯AMâ€‰â€“â€‰5:00â€¯PM, Tuesday: 11:30â€¯AMâ€‰â€“â€‰10:00â€¯PM, Wednesday: 11:30â€¯AMâ€‰â€“â€‰10:00â€¯PM, Thursday: 11:30â€¯AMâ€‰â€“â€‰10:00â€¯PM, Friday: 11:30â€¯AMâ€‰â€“â€‰10:00â€¯PM, Saturday: 4:00â€‰â€“â€‰11:00â€¯PM, Sunday: 11:30â€¯AMâ€‰â€“â€‰10:00â€¯PM
Reviews:
['Really nice food and really nice servers! We also had the most delicious rioja with our meal. Highly recommend for lunch or dinner. Good for vegetarians too. Cozy, casual but makes for a special meal with friends or a date night.', 'Sabore by Chef Mario, near Kotti, you can experience the passion for Napolitan cuisine expressed in every dish, from their pizzas, to their pastas, antipasti and desserts

We were impressed us by the quality, presentation and taste of the pizzas, some of which have been honoured with national and international awards

We tried 3 of their pizzas, including the award-winning Pizza Liguori - The Legend (19â‚¬), Pizza Burrata & Mortadella (19â‚¬), and Pizza Diavolo â€œSaboreâ€ (17â‚¬) that came literally in flames!', 'Without a doubt, the best pizza in town! Amazing doe and the highest quality produce for toppings, including the most important ingredient: love (for pizza). Mario is a true Italian "patrone" and Maria provides amazing service. 5 stars!']

Name: Milch & Zucker
Summary: Breakfast bowls, coffee & cake plus salads & lunch dishes, in an industrial-chic space with art.
Opening Hours: Monday: 7:30â€¯AMâ€‰â€“â€‰7:00â€¯PM, Tuesday: 7:30â€¯AMâ€‰â€“â€‰7:00â€¯PM, Wednesday: 7:30â€¯AMâ€‰â€“â€‰7:00â€¯PM, Thursday: 7:30â€¯AMâ€‰â€“â€‰7:00â€¯PM, Friday: 7:30â€¯AMâ€‰â€“â€‰7:00â€¯PM, Saturday: 8:00â€¯AMâ€‰â€“â€‰7:00â€¯PM, Sunday: 8:00â€¯AMâ€‰â€“â€‰7:00â€¯PM
Reviews: ['My friends and I came here two days in a row in our visit of Berlin. The food and coffee is just superb. It is great value for money and a very chilled out spot.\nThere are loads of options for food such as cakes and treats as well as cooked breakfast. I had the American breakfast which was amazing. I have attached a photo but it was just nuts to get eggs and bacon as well as a hefty portion of tasty pancakes. The staff were nice too so I do recommend this breakfast spot.', 'Very tasty and well priced! We paid less for a breakfast for two than at the hostel. And they accept credit card payment.', 'We were walking by Kreuzberg and found this place. We had the most delicious cheesecake here. I was surprised by how tasty it was. The coffee was also nice but it was definitely the cheesecake that stole my heart.']

Name: tulus lotrek
Summary: Inventive, multi-course menus & a huge global wine list in a contemporary space with rustic flair.
Opening Hours: Monday: 6:30â€‰â€“â€‰11:00â€¯PM, Tuesday: Closed, Wednesday: Closed, Thursday: 6:30â€‰â€“â€‰11:00â€¯PM, Friday: 6:30â€‰â€“â€‰11:00â€¯PM, Saturday: 6:30â€‰â€“â€‰11:00â€¯PM, Sunday: 6:30â€‰â€“â€‰11:00â€¯PM
Reviews:
['Honestlyâ€¦ one of the best fine dining experiences we ever had in Germany!
Make sure you put this restaurant onto your list.

We are still dreaming about those mouthwatering, umami sauces! ğŸ¤¤ From some we would have loved to get a bucket full of them.

All in all - amazing food and outstanding wines. We went by bottle and we got some amazing recommendations.

We especially loved the laid back vibe and the warm and welcoming staff.

In our opinion they definitely deserve more michelin stars ğŸ¤©', "Great atmosphere! We were greeted warmly with our names written on the table in chalk. The staff are extremely friendly and attentive. However, when it comes to the food, while it features many fancy ingredientsâ€”caviar, carabinero, truffle, buck meat, top-quality sushi riceâ€”and utilizes special preparation techniques like purÃ©e, tartare, and bouillabaisse, the flavors don't always hit the mark. I was a bit disappointed with the â‚¬225 set menu. For instance, the buck meat had a strong gamey flavor mixed with blood, which was quite challenging for me to enjoy. The addition of fried dough made the dish even heavier. On a positive note, there were some delightful surprises. The chawanmushi had a subtle hint of hazelnut flavor, and the scallops featured a pine nut flavor that paired beautifully with the truffle. Given the price, I would probably not return, but it was an interesting experience overall.", 'just excellent menu curation
great for celebrations
atmo is relaxed, calm, everyone minds their own business
we love the staffâ€™s explanation to each course']

Name: Aromi e Sapori - Restaurant & Weinbar
Summary: Elegant Italian option with sidewalk tables, offering wine & familiar favorites like pasta.
Opening Hours: Monday: 5:30â€‰â€“â€‰11:00â€¯PM, Tuesday: 5:30â€‰â€“â€‰11:00â€¯PM, Wednesday: 5:30â€‰â€“â€‰11:00â€¯PM, Thursday: 5:30â€‰â€“â€‰11:00â€¯PM, Friday: 5:30â€‰â€“â€‰11:00â€¯PM, Saturday: 5:30â€‰â€“â€‰11:00â€¯PM, Sunday: Closed
Reviews:
['Might have become my favorite italian place. Food was delicious, generous portions - great atmosphere.
Need to come back soon to try more things on their menu!
Carpaccio was fab, Carbonara and the ragu/burrata pasta as well. Tiramisu was greatğŸ‘ğŸ½', 'Super good pasta, very good servings.
Ravioli was amazing and the pasta carbonara as well.', 'Wonderful food, wine, and atmosphere. Typical italian restaurant with a small but very nice selection of dishes.
We took the fish platter for two and the cannoli. Wonderful sicilian wine selection.  Highly recommended when in Berlin.']

Name: Biertempel 2
Summary: Schnitzel, plus German fish dishes & grills, in a simple, old-school interior or a beer garden.
Opening Hours: Monday: 8:00â€¯AMâ€‰â€“â€‰11:00â€¯PM, Tuesday: 8:00â€¯AMâ€‰â€“â€‰11:00â€¯PM, Wednesday: 8:00â€¯AMâ€‰â€“â€‰11:00â€¯PM, Thursday: 8:00â€¯AMâ€‰â€“â€‰11:00â€¯PM, Friday: 8:00â€¯AMâ€‰â€“â€‰11:00â€¯PM, Saturday: 8:00â€¯AMâ€‰â€“â€‰11:00â€¯PM, Sunday: 8:00â€¯AMâ€‰â€“â€‰11:00â€¯PM
Reviews: ["Dinner was very tasty. Portions in perfect size. Prices reasonable. 9-13 euro for dish. Personel nice. I was very hungry so I was happy that I didn't have to wait long time for dish - it was very quick. It's good place to feel old fashioned German style. But also the decoration of place was little bit funny. Plus is that they have nice beer garden.", 'Great food and service. Lovely outdoor seating (indoor seating available).', 'Tasty food, true German cuisine, huge portions at good and reasonable prices.']

Name: La Stella Nera
Summary: Hip, eco-conscious venture known for wood-fired vegan pizzas & calzones, plus desserts.
Opening Hours: Monday: Closed, Tuesday: 5:00â€‰â€“â€‰11:00â€¯PM, Wednesday: 5:00â€‰â€“â€‰11:00â€¯PM, Thursday: 5:00â€‰â€“â€‰11:00â€¯PM, Friday: 5:00â€‰â€“â€‰11:00â€¯PM, Saturday: 5:00â€‰â€“â€‰11:00â€¯PM, Sunday: 5:00â€‰â€“â€‰11:00â€¯PM
Reviews:
['This place was nice! I tried the margarita pizza and the pepperoni pizza. The vegan cheese and salami were good and the crust on both was excellent, but I found the pizzas could have used a few more toppings. My friend let me try some of his polenta fries with garlic dipping sauce and those were super yummy, Iâ€™d definitely order those next time.

I was confused about why where there were so many options without cheese and only a few with cheeseâ€¦ I would have liked to have tried the mushroom pizza with cheese.

The atmosphere was cool and the service was fine.', "Excellent pizza with nice fluffy dough. It was hardly noticeable that the cheese was vegan. We had the heavy weather calzone and the asparagus pizza and both were great.
We didn't have to wait long despite the place being rather full and the staff were very friendly.", 'Gorgeous pizza from a wood oven. We had a diavola and carciofina piccante. Unlike other vegan pizza places you get the chance to get some additional proteins on your pizza due to tofu and seitan toppings. We loved that and definitely coming back. We didnâ€™t have a reservation but for two people it wasnâ€™t a big deal to get a table with a bit of waiting time.']

Name: Villa Rodizio
Summary: High-ceilinged, art nouveau venue combining churrascaria, Mexican cantina & Argentine steakhouse.
Opening Hours: Monday: Closed, Tuesday: 6:00â€‰â€“â€‰11:00â€¯PM, Wednesday: 6:00â€‰â€“â€‰11:00â€¯PM, Thursday: 6:00â€‰â€“â€‰11:00â€¯PM, Friday: 5:00â€‰â€“â€‰11:00â€¯PM, Saturday: 5:00â€‰â€“â€‰11:00â€¯PM, Sunday: 4:00â€‰â€“â€‰10:00â€¯PM
Reviews: ["Enjoyable Rodizio style restaurant on the outskirts of town. They are very happy to please you. I had a tough piece of beef, which was inedible and they couldn't do enough to put it right! Basic but satisfactory salad bar, excellent service. I would happily visit again.", 'What a great experience! A ten course meat feast sounds impossible,  but the way it is done is really good. They bring the skewers of the different meats straight from the spit and carve off washer you want at the table. There is good variety,  and buffet vegetables and salad to go with it. Make sure you are hungry when you go! The service we got from Angelo was excellent. Friendly and helpful. Highly recommend', 'Great food, huge variety at the buffet. Meat has never stopped for a minute. Food was delicious, service was friendly and proficient. We had a great time!']

Name: ErgÃ¼n's Fischbude
Summary: Simple, laid-back tavern for Turkish & Mediterranean dishes with a focus on fish & seafood.
Opening Hours: Monday: 3:30â€‰â€“â€‰11:00â€¯PM, Tuesday: 3:30â€‰â€“â€‰11:00â€¯PM, Wednesday: 3:30â€‰â€“â€‰11:00â€¯PM, Thursday: 3:30â€‰â€“â€‰11:00â€¯PM, Friday: 3:30â€¯PMâ€‰â€“â€‰12:00â€¯AM, Saturday: 3:30â€¯PMâ€‰â€“â€‰12:00â€¯AM, Sunday: 3:30â€‰â€“â€‰11:00â€¯PM
Reviews:
['We were waiting over 1 hour and 15 minutes for our order. Two tables got their food and were already finished when we were still waiting. Waiters just told some rumours that apparently the grill is not working properly. But comes the others got their grilled fish?

If you pay, please ask to break down the costs. There are no receipts and cash only (you know why ;) )', "Nice and hearty Turkish restaurant in Berlin. One of the really few ones offering fresh fish. I also recommend to try their salad!
I had a few dinners there and I suggest to book in advance, especially on weekends as it can get quite crowded.
Overall it's a very nice fish place, with a real Turkish vibe!", 'Very authentic fish tavern!

The place is a long time family business. Itâ€™s more a tavern than a restaurant though.

The food (seafood) is very good. Taste fresh and homemade. We took a salad for 2, kalamaris, red fish and fries. That was enough for 2 persons. We paid 22â‚¬ each with drinks.

The place is full of pictures from visitors, famous people and old memories. Itâ€™s actually very nice. Donâ€™t expect something fancy, this place is nice and genuine but it is not a 4 stars restaurant.

Is worth it doe the food quality.']

Name: Crack Bellmer
Summary: Trendy, rustic-chic nightclub with edgy art & a terrace, offering dancing to DJs till late.
Reviews: ['Fun, more intimate than some of the other spaces in Berlin. Good music, good sound, good people.', "Dance bar with impressive sound system and interior. For the entrance you are asked for donation, so it's mostly up to you. DJs usually play melodic tech-house, so rather don't expect anything harder.", 'We really enjoyed coming here! They were very nice to us as as tourists, which was better than some of the other places in the area. The DJ was down tempo. They did have a credit card machine.']

Name: Ristorante Primavera
Summary: Pizza, pasta & grilled steaks at an enduring, family-run dining room with tables in the backyard.
Reviews: ['Great food. Great service. And not too expensive. We could sit in the back garden away from the busy street which was perfect. But be aware, cash only no CC or EC.', "Very friendly staff and prompt service at once! It was quite crowded in and outside so we gave it a try. In general, food quality didn't meet our expectations but the staff and services were so superb. They offer huge portions", "Food was tasty and inexpensive. Service was very good. It was easy to get a table inside, although outside was quite full.\nIt's nice to be able to add a green salad to an Italian meal for a reasonable price... I'd been missing vegetables here in Berlin."]

Name: Restaurant Balthazar 2
Summary: Innovative Japanese-Italian fare in an elegant dining room with a riverside terrace.
Opening Hours: Monday: Closed, Tuesday: Closed, Wednesday: 4:00â€‰â€“â€‰10:00â€¯PM, Thursday: 4:00â€‰â€“â€‰10:00â€¯PM, Friday: 4:00â€‰â€“â€‰10:00â€¯PM, Saturday: 12:00â€‰â€“â€‰10:00â€¯PM, Sunday: 12:00â€‰â€“â€‰10:00â€¯PM
Reviews:
['Nice view and easy location.
Seafood was successful.
Service capacity is low, cannot serve main menu to groups with 10+', 'Itâ€™s a dining, but not fine.

Iâ€™ve been here with friends for a special occasion; we had a tasting menu (4-course meal). The starter was perfect, the soup was salty, and my friends couldnâ€™t finish it even with beer. For me, it was ok and delicious. The main dish was nice but too simple. The dessert was a total disappointment (strawberry theme); the taste was artificial.

But if the food was more or less ok, the service was a disaster. We had to wait a lot for someone to come and get our order, and when they finally came, they turned to another table in the middle of the conversation with us. Only one girl explained the dish when we asked her. Others didnâ€™t know the menu and didnâ€™t care about our experience.

We paid â‚¬170 for three persons for average food, bad service, and a loud street musician nearby, and they wanted us to tip ğŸ¤¡

Please note that in Berlin, you must choose the tip amount on every terminal. And they have it starting from 10% to 20+. Zero is not an option on the screen; you have to choose it manually.', 'We stopped for wine and stayed for dinner.
Exceptional service, very good wine selection, and the food, we had the tapas and risotto, were an absolute delight.']

Name: VAPIANO Berlin Europaplatz
Summary: Laid-back restaurant featuring made-to-order fresh pasta dishes, along with pizza & salad.
Opening Hours: Monday: 8:00â€¯AMâ€‰â€“â€‰10:30â€¯PM, Tuesday: 8:00â€¯AMâ€‰â€“â€‰10:30â€¯PM, Wednesday: 8:00â€¯AMâ€‰â€“â€‰10:30â€¯PM, Thursday: 8:00â€¯AMâ€‰â€“â€‰10:30â€¯PM, Friday: 8:00â€¯AMâ€‰â€“â€‰10:30â€¯PM, Saturday: 8:00â€¯AMâ€‰â€“â€‰10:30â€¯PM, Sunday: 8:00â€¯AMâ€‰â€“â€‰10:30â€¯PM
Reviews:
['Good price for the cost benefit of it. Food was prepared quickly. The place is a bit confusing, on where you should order the food, where you take it, and etc. The carbonara was average, and the pizza was good. Super convenient the location.', "Great value for money! Food is prepared at the moment so it's hot and full of taste.
Very nice ambience too.
The only con was a member of staff named Ahmed who was totally unhelpful with no willingness to be proactive regarding customer satisfaction, so somebody else had to come and take our order.
But that was a minor stain in our otherwise flawless mealğŸ˜", 'Debating if or not to do this review. The lady at the order counter was either really trying to be incredibly rude, or she is just not good at her job. I asked for a Funghi Risotto with beef to go (donâ€™t judge my order please) and had to repeat it 5 times, slowly, and she still didnâ€™t write it correctly. The kitchen staff was rude when I pointed out that I had ordered it differently and to go. The risotto in question was very mid, at best. No flavour at all. And then the guy at the door, who if was any snarkier would probably show up on one of MTVâ€™s reality shows. Overall, the service was bad, the food was okay, and if I never have to eat at the Hauptbahnhof again I will never visit this place.']

Name: Imren Grill
Summary: Late-opening pit stop for Turkish shawarma wraps, pide flatbreads & lentil soup.
Opening Hours: Monday: 9:00â€¯AMâ€‰â€“â€‰4:00â€¯AM, Tuesday: 9:00â€¯AMâ€‰â€“â€‰4:00â€¯AM, Wednesday: 9:00â€¯AMâ€‰â€“â€‰4:00â€¯AM, Thursday: 9:00â€¯AMâ€‰â€“â€‰4:00â€¯AM, Friday: 9:00â€¯AMâ€‰â€“â€‰5:00â€¯AM, Saturday: 9:00â€¯AMâ€‰â€“â€‰5:00â€¯AM, Sunday: 9:00â€¯AMâ€‰â€“â€‰4:00â€¯AM
Reviews: ['Who is on the hunt for a yummy, well-priced mercimek soup will find it here. The restaurant itself is very authentic, even the seating area reminds me of eating in TÃ¼rkiye.', "[on a mission to find Berlin's best dÃ¶ner kebap]\n\nQuite an authentic atmosphere that took me back to Istanbul. The dÃ¶ner, however, was nothing exceptional. The meat was a bit dry, and the bread was average. Good for trying once and the people were lovely!", 'Best DÃ¶ner in town, great choice of foods, the free Turkish tea. Everything is on point, the staff is always friendly. I visit frequently and recommend 100% my personal top']

Name: Gaffel Haus Berlin - Das kÃ¶lsche Konsulat in der Hauptstadt
Summary: Schnitzel, currywurst & beer in a large brewery with wood-paneled interiors & a terrace.
Address: Direkt neben dem Maritim proArte Hotel, DorotheenstraÃŸe 65, Berlin
Opening Hours: Monday: 12:00â€¯PMâ€‰â€“â€‰12:00â€¯AM, Tuesday: 12:00â€¯PMâ€‰â€“â€‰12:00â€¯AM, Wednesday: 12:00â€¯PMâ€‰â€“â€‰12:00â€¯AM, Thursday: 12:00â€¯PMâ€‰â€“â€‰12:00â€¯AM, Friday: 12:00â€¯PMâ€‰â€“â€‰12:00â€¯AM, Saturday: 12:00â€¯PMâ€‰â€“â€‰12:00â€¯AM, Sunday: Closed
Reviews: ['Great place to try local dishes, with a great environment a very nice and attentive service. They have the menu in English and many options to choose from, all of them delicious. Meatballs and sausages are top, but of course you have to combine it with some local beers. The amounts were fairly good and price-wise it was well worth it overall. Highly recommended for tourist.', 'A Cologne pub in Berlin that will amaze even the most loyal Berliner-PlÃ¶rre beer fan. The Cologne atmosphere is downright infectious, even if the KÃ¶lsch served brings back memories of headaches. The waiter is brisk and funny, and the Halve Hahn brings a smile. An entertaining evening with plenty of KÃ¶lsch, which traditionally causes a slight headache. Highly recommended for friends of koelsche hospitality customs.', 'Nice atmosphere and kind servers. The food and beer were amazing.\nRecommend the restaurant.']

Name: The Neighborhood
Summary: Laid-back restaurant & bar offering homestyle American cooking like wings, tacos & mac â€™nâ€™ cheese.
Reviews: ['Ask for the frozen margaritas if theyâ€™re not on the menu cause theyâ€™re phenomenal! Also the food! Do much comfort food and proper buffalo wings which isnâ€™t something easy to come by in Berlin! But also their Mac& cheese Cajun style! Yum', 'Went for boozy brunch/lunch here. Great staff and in house doggo (pepper)! We had so much food and drinks over the time we were there.\nHighly recommend the brioche breakfast bun and the tatter tots.\nWill go again!', "Was so happy to find The Neighborhood around the corner and all the comforts for a fellow American. Where else can you have mac n cheese, a BLAT, elote, and wings and a magarita. I've had take out a few times, always yummy and hot and fresh tasting even with takeout. I like to get a double mimosa to-go. ğŸ˜ the owner is super sweet and makes you feel like home. Can't wait to enjoy everything they have to offer on the patio. Must try!"]

Name: Humboldt Forum im Berliner Schloss
Summary: Originally built in the 15th century, this stately royal & imperial palace offers exhibits & tours.
Opening Hours: Monday: 10:30â€¯AMâ€‰â€“â€‰6:30â€¯PM, Tuesday: Closed, Wednesday: 10:30â€¯AMâ€‰â€“â€‰6:30â€¯PM, Thursday: 10:30â€¯AMâ€‰â€“â€‰6:30â€¯PM, Friday: 10:30â€¯AMâ€‰â€“â€‰6:30â€¯PM, Saturday: 10:30â€¯AMâ€‰â€“â€‰6:30â€¯PM, Sunday: 10:30â€¯AMâ€‰â€“â€‰6:30â€¯PM
Reviews: ['Visited Humboldt Forum in June 2024 on a sunny weekend. The Museum Island was crowded with visitors relaxing and enjoying the sun. The Forum is located at the center of the island, and next to the subway line 5. The visit to Humboldt Forum was very pleasant. The collections are mostly free. Couple of highlights about its facility: 1. lockers and cloakroom allows flight carry on size luggage, and check them for visitors for free. 2. There is a bistro with various reasonably priced lunch options. 3. Roof terrace costs 5 Euro for access. But one can make a reservation at its roof terrace restaurant Baret to enjoy a cup of coffee and the Dom view. I went there for its Asian Art collection located on the third floor, and happily surprised with its temporary collections there, especially with the Wang Shu designed exhibition hall. Of course, one question the visitors might have after reading the descriptions of some of the objects in the hall is  the museum\'s efforts and role in addressing the ethical dilemma of preserving those admittedly "looted" during the Boxer Rebellion. Overall, the Forum also made efforts in including more English language description of objects that\'s more friendly to non-German speaking visitors. At the beginning of the Asian Art collection, there is also a timeline of the transformation of its collection since 19th century. One suggestion for future improvement of presenting such a timeline is to use different colors for English and German texts, and explain acronyms on the side. It would be easier for the visitors to follow.', "Lovely and magical place, for me it's one of the best places and one of the  best areas in Berlin. Not only is the museum free, but it contains great exposition and great items inside.\n\nThere is an observatory which is around 5 euros to access but you'll have one of the best views in Berlin. You won't regret visiting here.", 'The rooftop must be one of the best places to see the sunset and also see couples of tourist attractions like Berlin Cathedral, TV towel, etc. Plus, the staff at the roof top are very friendly, there wasnt anything I like on the main menu, so I only want to order drinks. And he said, dont worry. Just enjoy the view.']

Name: VIET HA - Goldener Karpfen
Summary: Simple eatery serving sushi & pan-Asian mains in compact, unassuming surroundings.
Opening Hours: Monday: 11:00â€¯AMâ€‰â€“â€‰10:00â€¯PM, Tuesday: 11:00â€¯AMâ€‰â€“â€‰10:00â€¯PM, Wednesday: 11:00â€¯AMâ€‰â€“â€‰10:00â€¯PM, Thursday: 11:00â€¯AMâ€‰â€“â€‰10:00â€¯PM, Friday: 11:00â€¯AMâ€‰â€“â€‰10:00â€¯PM, Saturday: 12:00â€‰â€“â€‰10:00â€¯PM, Sunday: 12:00â€‰â€“â€‰10:00â€¯PM
Reviews:
["It's a cosy Vietnamese restaurant. The food is really good and has a great quantity. Great ambience and polite service. Highly recommend. It's a few meters from Strausberg platz U bahn. I don't know if it's available on wolt, I have added the menu as well.", 'This little restaurant is one of my favorite ones around the neighborhood! The staff is always so kind and friendly and the portions are huge and very tasty!

5/5 ğŸ™‚', 'This is perfect restaurant to treat your taste buds for Vietnamese food. I being a frequent visitor to this place have tried multiple Vietnamese dishes and have to say they are worth it for the price they are offering.

The staff working here is really helpful and if you are first time visitor to this place they will help you to choose a perfect dish according to your interest.

This place offers both veg and non-veg food so you have big menu to try from.

Always served piping hot and freshly prepared noodles, chicken and veg options. You can visit here for breakfast, Lunch and Dinner.

The payment can be made by card or cash depending on the option you have available with you.

And most importantly, they have both English as well as German Menu Card so they can serve a large number of customers( yes, staff speaks fluent English ğŸ˜€ and obviously German).

Enjoy your dish and hit like if you find this review helpful.

TschÃ¼ss ğŸ¤ŸğŸ¼']

Name: TZOM - Eritrean Restaurant
Summary: Compact restaurant dishing up homestyle Eritrean cooking amid laid-back surroundings.
Opening Hours: Monday: Closed, Tuesday: 5:00â€‰â€“â€‰10:00â€¯PM, Wednesday: 5:00â€‰â€“â€‰10:00â€¯PM, Thursday: 5:00â€‰â€“â€‰10:00â€¯PM, Friday: 5:00â€‰â€“â€‰10:00â€¯PM, Saturday: 12:00â€‰â€“â€‰10:00â€¯PM, Sunday: 12:00â€‰â€“â€‰10:00â€¯PM
Reviews: ["Went here to try something I haven't tried before, I wasn't expecting too much but TZOM FAR exceeded my expectations! Not only were the portion sizes large, everything we tried tasted incredible and the waitress was super attentive and friendly. The mixed platter for 1 was great to try out a few different flavours, the fatta was a huge portion and my personal favourite was the deep fried bread strips with minced meat and yogurt, definitely a must-try here!\n\nI've never had Eritrean food (or anything similar to it even) before, can safely say it's definitely worth checking out! We ended up paying about 51 euros in total, for the amount of food we got I'd say you can't ask for much better value.", 'Everything was beyond excellent. We loved the food from TZOM, super tasty and flavorful. The service was exceptional. Highly recommend to any foodies', 'We ordered platters to share to get a taste of everything. The food was delicious. The sauce with mushroom was on a spicier side. But the taste of everything else together balanced it. So talk to the server before ordering the food regarding the spice level, if you cannot handle the spice. In all, delicious food. Totally recommend it.']

Name: Cevicheria
Summary: Ceviche & grilled seafood, plus pisco sours, in a pared-back dining room or at outdoor tables.
Opening Hours: Monday: 6:00â€¯PMâ€‰â€“â€‰12:00â€¯AM, Tuesday: 6:00â€¯PMâ€‰â€“â€‰12:00â€¯AM, Wednesday: 6:00â€¯PMâ€‰â€“â€‰12:00â€¯AM, Thursday: 6:00â€¯PMâ€‰â€“â€‰12:00â€¯AM, Friday: 6:00â€¯PMâ€‰â€“â€‰12:00â€¯AM, Saturday: 6:00â€¯PMâ€‰â€“â€‰12:00â€¯AM, Sunday: 6:00â€¯PMâ€‰â€“â€‰12:00â€¯AM
Reviews:
['Great ceviche! Very high quality ingredients and the taste. Lovely staff and atmosphere. Highly recommended!', 'Cevicheria in Berlin is a standout dining destination for anyone craving authentic Peruvian cuisine in a vibrant and welcoming atmosphere. This charming restaurant brings the rich flavors of Peru to the heart of Berlin, offering a delightful culinary experience that is both flavorful and memorable.

The menu at Cevicheria showcases a variety of traditional Peruvian dishes, with a particular focus on ceviche, which is prepared with the freshest ingredients and expertly balanced flavors. Each dish is a testament to the skill and passion that goes into creating Peruvian cuisine. The ceviche, in particular, is a highlight, featuring perfectly marinated fish with a zesty, tangy kick that captures the essence of Peruâ€™s culinary heritage.

In addition to the exceptional food, Cevicheria boasts a fantastic selection of drinks. From refreshing pisco cocktails to expertly crafted mocktails, the beverage menu complements the food perfectly and adds to the overall dining experience.

What truly elevates the visit to Cevicheria is the service. The staff are not only attentive and friendly but also genuinely passionate about the food they serve. A special mention goes to "Valery," a great waiter from Peru who adds a personal touch to the experience. Valeryâ€™s warmth, knowledge, and enthusiasm make every meal at Cevicheria feel special. His recommendations and genuine care enhance the dining experience, making guests feel right at home.

Overall, Cevicheria is a must-visit for anyone in Berlin looking to indulge in delicious Peruvian cuisine. With its great food, excellent drinks, and outstanding service, it promises a dining experience that is both enjoyable and authentic.', 'A friend of mine brought me here and introduced me to a lovely owner. We had a great evening here. Amazing food, amazing atmosphere. We are different plates. All prepared with love.
There is  good selection of wine and cocktails ğŸ¸']

Name: Cassiopeia
Summary: Nightclub with a subculture edge & live music program in a former industrial hall with a courtyard.
Reviews:
['This is my favorite place to go out to dance. I love the vibe of this club I love the dirty dancing party. I always have an amazing time when I go here.
The biergarten is also so nice in the summer, I love to go and to chill with my friends.
The employees are always really sweet.
I recommend it 100%', "The place is great. It's big open air club, surrounded by trees. It has skate park and climbing area which is pretty big. Prices for drinks are not much different from prices in other clubs. It's family and dog friendly.
Staff is also nice. Club has live music events.", 'I went there for a Friday night party. It was one of the worst spend money in my life (12â‚¬  entrance fee and 10â‚¬ for a beer). The average age of people is 40+ and the music is horrible.']

Name: Izumi Restaurant-Sushi Bar & Lieferservice
Summary: Compact dining room with Japanese hanging lamps, banquette seating & freshly prepared sushi dishes.
Reviews:
["Very friendly and helpful stuff. Delicious and fresh sushi. Waiter Alex is a very nice and kind person. He helped me to select the sushi and generally just made my day. I am so happy that people, who are working here truly love their job and people. Alex is very professional. I can feel that he really loves his job. I am always feeling better, when I visit such kind of places, where people cook and work with love. Izumi Restaurant is a really good place to visit. It's a restaurant, where I would like to come back again and again.
I think that the true success of the restaurant depends not just on food, but also on the emotions and atmosphere, that people create. I am really glad that this restaurant really cares about the people's experience and does not let the people stay alone with hard choices. They are always ready to help, give good advice and help to make a good choice. Waiters here can find a good approach to every client. Thank you for a great experience ğŸ‘
Food itself was very good ğŸ‘ High level sushi quality, a little bit warm rice ğŸš. Everything how it should be.
ğŸ£ Authentic and delicious sushi ğŸ£ğŸ£
Definitely recommend to everyone
Green tea ğŸµ ğŸ¨ ice-cream with lichy 10/10
Definitely RECOMMEND to everyone !", 'Mediocre sushi place. Food is literally just OK. Not worth taking a detour for
Place was empty despite euro finals weekend and served by a single waitress.', 'This was an exiting experience. Very very fresh sushi. Very tasty. Thanks for the chief cook. Good service. We will definitely come back to try again!!!']

Reviews:
['Review based on  blue cheese burger
Burger

Good ;
- wide options of American style burger
- choose degree grilled ( rare, medium rare, medium, ..)

Bad:
- The restaurant recommendation is to order medium rare but since in some burgers types the patty is very thick which means most of the core portions will be rare meat', 'Nice atmosphere and super friendly staff.
But the food does not live to its hype.
The hamburger was dry, the filet was good but no good sauce to it.
Nice place to meet friends shot a Ducks fart. And have ok meal.', 'One of the best burger in berlin.
Grate atmosphere, cold beer, tasty meet (recommended to order it medium rare).
Relatively small scone (a good thing so you can finish the dish).
A decent amount of french fries)
Overall we really enjoyed it.']

Name: Sushi & Asian Tveita
Summary: Intimate eatery providing Vietnamese dishes, beer, wine, cocktails & espresso drinks.
Reviews: ['Awesome Vietnamese restaurant with loads of fresh fish options, indoor and outdoor seating, and Vietnamese drip coffee!\n\nI enjoyed the salmon bowl which came with salad that packed a crunch and complimented the salmon nicely.', "Sorry haven't taken the photos of meals, but I have to say the shrimps in curry are frozen ones... It ruined the whole curry ğŸ«  sommerrollen are good", "Great food, big portions. At first the menu doesn't seem very veggie/vegan friendly, but you can substitute the chicken or duck in any plate for their vegan versions!"]

Name: TZOM - Eritrean Restaurant
Summary: Compact restaurant dishing up homestyle Eritrean cooking amid laid-back surroundings.
Opening Hours: Monday: Closed, Tuesday: 5:00â€‰â€“â€‰10:00â€¯PM, Wednesday: 5:00â€‰â€“â€‰10:00â€¯PM, Thursday: 5:00â€‰â€“â€‰10:00â€¯PM, Friday: 5:00â€‰â€“â€‰10:00â€¯PM, Saturday: 12:00â€‰â€“â€‰10:00â€¯PM, Sunday: 12:00â€‰â€“â€‰10:00â€¯PM
Reviews: ["Went here to try something I haven't tried before, I wasn't expecting too much but TZOM FAR exceeded my expectations! Not only were the portion sizes large, everything we tried tasted incredible and the waitress was super attentive and friendly. The mixed platter for 1 was great to try out a few different flavours, the fatta was a huge portion and my personal favourite was the deep fried bread strips with minced meat and yogurt, definitely a must-try here!\n\nI've never had Eritrean food (or anything similar to it even) before, can safely say it's definitely worth checking out! We ended up paying about 51 euros in total, for the amount of food we got I'd say you can't ask for much better value.", 'Everything was beyond excellent. We loved the food from TZOM, super tasty and flavorful. The service was exceptional. Highly recommend to any foodies', 'We ordered platters to share to get a taste of everything. The food was delicious. The sauce with mushroom was on a spicier side. But the taste of everything else together balanced it. So talk to the server before ordering the food regarding the spice level, if you cannot handle the spice. In all, delicious food. Totally recommend it.']

Name: Curry Baude Gesundbrunnen
Summary: Intimate counter-service specializing in currywurst, fries & other comfort fare.
Opening Hours: Monday: 6:00â€¯AMâ€‰â€“â€‰9:00â€¯PM, Tuesday: 6:00â€¯AMâ€‰â€“â€‰9:00â€¯PM, Wednesday: 6:00â€¯AMâ€‰â€“â€‰9:00â€¯PM, Thursday: 6:00â€¯AMâ€‰â€“â€‰9:00â€¯PM, Friday: 6:00â€¯AMâ€‰â€“â€‰9:00â€¯PM, Saturday: 9:00â€¯AMâ€‰â€“â€‰9:00â€¯PM, Sunday: 9:00â€¯AMâ€‰â€“â€‰8:00â€¯PM
Reviews: ["I can't comment on food as that was my first time having currywurst but they have the most compositable prices I've seen in Berlin.  The couple owners were so nice.", 'This is a good place to taste traditional Berliner curry sausages. The food itself is not really special but the shop owner is quite nice and ambitious with his business!', 'Visitors in the market for currywurst are often directed to big names like Curry 36 or Konnopkeâ€™s Imbiss. But locals prefer Curry Baude, little more than a window tacked on the side of the Gesundbrunnen U-Bahn station. The sausage attains the perfect equilibrium of crispy yet juicy, the ketchup-to-curry ratio is near-perfect, and the pommes are perfectly portioned to balance out the meat. Sure, the service may be especially gruff, even by German standards, but thatâ€™s part of the charm. [$]']

Name: NaNum
Summary: Elevated Korean cuisine served on trendy dishware in an airy, bi-level space with a leafy patio.
Opening Hours: Monday: Closed, Tuesday: Closed, Wednesday: 7:00â€‰â€“â€‰11:00â€¯PM, Thursday: 12:00â€‰â€“â€‰2:00â€¯PM, 7:00â€‰â€“â€‰11:00â€¯PM, Friday: 7:00â€‰â€“â€‰11:00â€¯PM, Saturday: 7:00â€‰â€“â€‰11:00â€¯PM, Sunday: Closed
Reviews: ["You can  have a chance to enjoy premium and being like authentic Korean cousine. It is differentiated from normal Korean restaurant.  A kind of Michelin style Korean experience under the owner's philosophy who has majored vocal music at the berlin university and studied ceramic art and made all food utensils by herself!", 'Went for dinner on a Saturday evening, ordered the fish menu. Food was absolutely amazing. Brutalistic concrete decor juxtaposed with delicate and beautiful ceramics (that often compliment the texture of the foods served in them). Impeccable yet relaxed service. Wine pairings mostly good, sometimes great. Owner is such an interesting and lovely person. Would definitely recommend a visit!', "One of the best dinner experience I've had in my life! Definitely recommend. Extremely welcoming and friendly staff! The taste is out of this world amazing. Every detail and thought in the menu is outstanding and we'll thought with a gentle touch by the heart.\nIf you're seeking a nice fancy dinner that will rock your world, this is the place to come ğŸ«´\nDefinitely recommend and will come back ğŸ§¡"]

Reviews:
['Nice place, food was tasty but the service could have been better. Took the food long (45 min) time to come, but when it came it was great. Would have gotten 4 stars If not for their slow services.', 'Was here this weekend for lunch, with colleagues. Ordered Veg Thali, whereas the colleagues ordered Asman special thali.

Quality and quantity wise both the Thalis were awesome. Though it took some time for the preparation, but it was worth waiting a bit for the delicious food. The veg dishes as well as non-veg items were very tasty.

Staffs were very friendly.', 'Food was good and tasty and they have lunch offers. Anyone working in this vicinity can try their mittag angebot.']

Name: Smack Burger
Summary: Offbeat restaurant serving burgers, grilled cheese sandwiches & poutine, plus desserts.
Opening Hours: Monday: 11:00â€¯AMâ€‰â€“â€‰12:00â€¯AM, Tuesday: 11:00â€¯AMâ€‰â€“â€‰12:00â€¯AM, Wednesday: 11:00â€¯AMâ€‰â€“â€‰12:00â€¯AM, Thursday: 11:00â€¯AMâ€‰â€“â€‰12:00â€¯AM, Friday: 11:00â€¯AMâ€‰â€“â€‰12:00â€¯AM, Saturday: 11:00â€¯AMâ€‰â€“â€‰1:00â€¯AM, Sunday: 12:00â€¯PMâ€‰â€“â€‰12:00â€¯AM
Reviews:
["Yesterday, I ordered from Smack Burger at BadstraÃŸe 66, Berlin, BE 13357 via Uber Eats. I got their Single Smash Burger and Homemade Fries. It took the delivery guy a long time to find me, and communication was challenging. When I finally got my food, it was really cold.

The fries portion was shockingly small and tasted cold and disgusting. The Smash Burger was better than the fries but still nothing more than an average street burger. Honestly, I'm surprised that over 5,000 people have given them more than 4.5 stars on Uber Eats.", 'Best burger in Berlin. I have visited them multiple times, the taste is consistent as well.
Dine in area is small. Perfect for takeaways.', "First of all, I can say it was the best hamburger I've ever had in my life. We ordered the patty melt. The bread, the meat and the cheese ratio was perfect. It is definitely one of the dishes I will eat next time I come to Berlin. I am very happy to taste such a burger, I really recommend it! ğŸ” ğŸ’–"]

Name: Midtown Grill
Summary: Modern, airy steakhouse restaurant with lounge music & banquettes, also serving seafood & cocktails.
Reviews:
['This Chain Steak House
Is supposed to be the
Equivalent of my Fave
Steak House by Ruthâ€¦.
Well it is definitely NOT.
I got an advertisement via
Instagram for a RIBS and
Beer 4th of July Cookout
BBQ featuring all the RIBS
You can eat along with
Other Grilled favorites.
LIes they told.
Not one of the several
Items served came from
A Hot Grill.
Nor  did the Only Rib
Option which happen
To be some Strange
BBQ sauced Cold
Korean??? Babyback Ribs.
The Sauce was not Korean
nor American and was not
Grilled with the meat because
This meat was never grilled.
The only HOT ITEM was ONE
Of the two French fry Choices.
The wait staff was more interested
In the SINGLE GIRL in the RED DRESS
than they were about serving
Anything HOT.
This was a BAIT and SWITCH.
And HIGHLY disappointing.
The guacamole was from a can.
The melted cheese wasnâ€™t even
Whiz, it was some canned concoction
As well as the salsa which is so easy
to prepare . And why am I even
Eating NACHOS at a RIB BBQ?
Because there were literally NO
RIBS featured. Especially the ones
OFF the  Grill Sticky and
Smoked Tender and Tasty.
The waiter and I mean that
Literally WAIT_er. I had to call
Him over SEVERAL times because
I had WAITED with no attention,
Warned us about the amount
Of Food and said order one burger
It might be too much! Then he
Brings this BURNT turd on an
Oversized bun with sauce I said
Not to be added. I looked and
Laughed and handed the two
Two bite burnt turd burger with
Sauce I did not order to my
Dining partner. Who immediately
Took the bread away and ate the
Tiny Turd burgers. As they over
cooked and under seasoned.
If this was supposed to be a
â€˜Teaseâ€™ for me to come back
and try your full menu you
FAILED miserably.
My Death By Chocolate
was supposed to be a dark
Chocolate ice cream and
a layered chocolate mousse.
Well the ice cream melted and
the plastic cover took 1/3 of
The Mousse away because it
wasnâ€™t delivered by the WAIT_er
On Time.
And then came the FINAL
BLOW. The knockout Punch.
Pride Month is Over and the
Restaurant returned to â€˜Straightâ€™
Wineâ€¦â€¦â€¦.Literally.
Which was actually the BEST
Part of the Entire Meal. A Riesling
FRESH yet Full Bodied Giving
Scents of Spring and early Summer.
So sensual we finished a Bottle.
Lecker. Unlike the Meal.', "An exquisite restaurant where you can come for a special evening with your friends and family. It truly deserves every star with its rich menu, service and taste. I was also lucky enough to have the gluten-free bread option (which tasted delicious). We really wanted cheesecake for dessert, but it wasn't available anymore. We tried chocolate mouse instead, and it was also very successful. The wines were delicious, I would like more Argentinian wine. Rib eye was delicious. Thank you Midtown Grill Berlin!", 'I visited this restaurant based on its high Google review score and ordered a ribeye and a cola for 55â‚¬, which I found overpriced. Despite the restaurant being empty, the waiter rudely asked me to move from a comfortable 4-person table to a cramped 2-person table with a sunshade pole obstructing the middle, making it very inconvenient. Although the food was good, the waiterâ€™s unprofessional behavior and poor service were unacceptable. If you donâ€™t mind the cost, the food is decent, but for a better atmosphere, I recommend looking elsewhere.']

Name: Villa Rodizio
Summary: High-ceilinged, art nouveau venue combining churrascaria, Mexican cantina & Argentine steakhouse.
Opening Hours: Monday: Closed, Tuesday: 6:00â€‰â€“â€‰11:00â€¯PM, Wednesday: 6:00â€‰â€“â€‰11:00â€¯PM, Thursday: 6:00â€‰â€“â€‰11:00â€¯PM, Friday: 5:00â€‰â€“â€‰11:00â€¯PM, Saturday: 5:00â€‰â€“â€‰11:00â€¯PM, Sunday: 4:00â€‰â€“â€‰10:00â€¯PM
Reviews: ["Enjoyable Rodizio style restaurant on the outskirts of town. They are very happy to please you. I had a tough piece of beef, which was inedible and they couldn't do enough to put it right! Basic but satisfactory salad bar, excellent service. I would happily visit again.", 'What a great experience! A ten course meat feast sounds impossible,  but the way it is done is really good. They bring the skewers of the different meats straight from the spit and carve off washer you want at the table. There is good variety,  and buffet vegetables and salad to go with it. Make sure you are hungry when you go! The service we got from Angelo was excellent. Friendly and helpful. Highly recommend', 'Great food, huge variety at the buffet. Meat has never stopped for a minute. Food was delicious, service was friendly and proficient. We had a great time!']

Name: Masha's Bagels & Delicatessen

Reviews:
["Lovely place with great bagels (tracing their history from the NYC, as I've found out) and service. The lads got a kitchen that's working up to 3 PM, but they went above and beyond to get a bagel to a hungry man (me) and got me a New York Classic (which was very nice). Apart from Classic, my top 1 choice would be reuben-style sandwich. Coffee is great too, water refills are available, overall - can recommend.", 'The bagels are quite stuffed and filling! I had the breakfast bagel with extra bacon and avocado â€” mine was delicious. My boyfriend had the chipotle Turkey bagel and although it was packed with Turkey (yay) it was incredibly (!) bland. Nothing chipotle about this chipotle bagel. We would name it plain Turkey bagel ğŸ˜‚', "Have been thinking for quite a while that there was a serious lack of bagel places in Berlin that were worth going to, and man does this place really fill that void.

The iced coffee was smooth and velvety and the Reuben Sandwich was bomb. Seriously I've been dreaming about the sandwich since I ate it. The bagels have great crunch/chew as well.

10/10 will be back"]
