There were also no soya drinks available.', "the institution is very dirty! the toilet stinks! ordered a Caesar salad, they gave a different sauce because there was no Caesar dressing! Don't give a fork to eat! napkins were not given! terribly!"]

Name: LA PAZ
Summary: Colorful venue with a terrace, offering burritos, enchiladas & classic tequila cocktails.
Opening Hours: Monday: 4:00â€‰â€“â€‰11:00â€¯PM, Tuesday: 4:00â€‰â€“â€‰11:00â€¯PM, Wednesday: 4:00â€‰â€“â€‰11:00â€¯PM, Thursday: 4:00â€‰â€“â€‰11:00â€¯PM, Friday: 4:00â€¯PMâ€‰â€“â€‰12:00â€¯AM, Saturday: 12:00â€¯PMâ€‰â€“â€‰12:00â€¯AM, Sunday: 12:00â€‰â€“â€‰10:00â€¯PM
Reviews: ['The restaurant has a nice environment, with both indoor and outdoor sections, and good music inside. In terms of price, eating with friends would be a better deal because I ordered a few glasses of wine, so it seemed more expensive, but the food portions were adequate. The waiters here are very friendly.\n\nThere was a little situation when paying, but the waiter was very nice and the other customers were kind enough to help, which made me impressed', 'Visited this in my birthday. I had some pasta and it was delicious! The waiter was super nice and he even gave me a shot for free!', 'If you know and like Mexican food, this is not it. If anything is more Tex-Mex, but not even that. We order two different dishes, and both had the same in common; like eating meet with no flavor, with very big chunks of vegetables in a tomato salse soup. And to top of, price is ridiculous for what you get. This is no way anything near Mexican food.']

Name: Ristorante Primavera
Summary: Pizza, pasta & grilled steaks at an enduring, family-run dining room with tables in the backyard.
Reviews: ['Great food. Great service. And not too expensive. We could sit in the back garden away from the busy street which was perfect. But be aware, cash only no CC or EC.', "Very friendly staff and prompt service at once! It was quite crowded in and outside so we gave it a try. In general, food quality didn't meet our expectations but the staff and services were so superb. They offer huge portions", "Food was tasty and inexpensive. Service was very good. It was easy to get a table inside, although outside was quite full.\nIt's nice to be able to add a green salad to an Italian meal for a reasonable price... I'd been missing vegetables here in Berlin."]

Name: Baba Ä‘u Restaurant
Summary: Hip eatery in an industrial-style space with outdoor tables serving sushi & familiar Asian dishes.
Opening Hours: Monday: 11:00â€¯AMâ€‰â€“â€‰10:00â€¯PM, Tuesday: 11:00â€¯AMâ€‰â€“â€‰10:00â€¯PM, Wednesday: 11:00â€¯AMâ€‰â€“â€‰10:00â€¯PM, Thursday: 11:00â€¯AMâ€‰â€“â€‰10:00â€¯PM, Friday: 11:00â€¯AMâ€‰â€“â€‰10:00â€¯PM, Saturday: 12:00â€‰â€“â€‰10:00â€¯PM, Sunday: 12:00â€‰â€“â€‰10:00â€¯PM
Reviews: ["Nice selection of dishes. We initially came there because we saw pictures of Sushi in Google, however this place no longer offers sushi. But the other dishes we tried were good. The prices were IMHO higher as usual in this area, but the main dishes are really large and satisfying.\nIt's quite well located, near a tram station.\nIt's recommended to reserve a table before coming.", 'Solid Asian restaurant in Pankow, and for me, one of the best in the area. The menu has great choices, and the portions are generous. Prices have gone up a bit, but this is not surprising, especially considering the current inflation. Still a go-to spot for satisfying Asian cuisine!', "Nice atmosphere and very delicious food. We had salmon teriyaki dish and another dish with meat and noodle. They were both very delicious and big portion. Usually I don't get full from eating fish but the salmon piece they gave was very big. The oyster mushrooms in my dish were also super delicious. Moreover the waiters were also very polite. I can't recommend this restaurant enough!"]

Name: Subway
Summary: Casual counter-serve chain for build-your-own sandwiches & salads, with health-conscious options.
Opening Hours: Monday: 9:00â€¯AMâ€‰â€“â€‰10:00â€¯PM, Tuesday: 9:00â€¯AMâ€‰â€“â€‰10:00â€¯PM, Wednesday: 9:00â€¯AMâ€‰â€“â€‰10:00â€¯PM, Thursday: 9:00â€¯AMâ€‰â€“â€‰10:00â€¯PM, Friday: 9:00â€¯AMâ€‰â€“â€‰10:00â€¯PM, Saturday: 10:00â€¯AMâ€‰â€“â€‰10:00â€¯PM, Sunday: 10:00â€¯AMâ€‰â€“â€‰10:00â€¯PM
Reviews:
['Last week I ordered a sandwich from you guys. It was really tasty.

staff was really friendly and was hygienic too. I definitely recommend them.

Keep it up.', 'Was with you today. An Afghan young man helped me choose a sandwich.

was really tasty. especially the vegetable combination and the sauces.

I will definitely come back again.', "The place was cold and they only take cash, which is pretty lame for a Subway. The sandwich was okay but they were greedy on the vegetables, they barely gave me any, so my sub was a bit empty. I payed 10â‚¬ for all of this, my drink was a 30cl one, i don't know if refills were accepted though."]

Name: CafÃ© & Restaurant Spreeblick
Summary: Elegant setting for German & international dishes, plus a terrace with views of city landmarks.
Opening Hours: Monday: 12:00â€‰â€“â€‰11:00â€¯PM, Tuesday: 12:00â€‰â€“â€‰11:00â€¯PM, Wednesday: Closed, Thursday: 12:00â€‰â€“â€‰11:00â€¯PM, Friday: 12:00â€‰â€“â€‰11:00â€¯PM, Saturday: 12:00â€‰â€“â€‰11:00â€¯PM, Sunday: 12:00â€‰â€“â€‰11:00â€¯PM
Reviews: ['An almost excluded spot away from the main area with a great location on the Spree and the Saint George and the dragon statue. Nice restaurant with good local food for a quick meal and even better drinks! Our first experience of a German classic curry wurst and we were pleasantly surprised. This place really stood out for the service which was attentive and super friendly. You couldnâ€™t have asked for nicer staff.', 'How delightful! I came here, ordered an apfel strudel and a hot chocolate with cream. It was soo good. Lovely flavours, the vanilla sauce, the apples and the ice cream. It was a perfect mid day break. The strudel was not too sweet and had incredibly balanced flavours. Great experience and a good, fun waiter. It did not take too long to receive our order as well which is a huge bonus. Thanks and Hello.', "Stopped in randomly for a small bite and a drink, and were very pleasantly surprised! The vegan currywurst and ragout were excellent, and we didn't find anything comparable to the Dutch coffee or Porter black beer in all the rest of Berlin!"]

Name: Il Ritrovo - Cucina Casalinga Popolare
Summary: Italian-style pizzas whipped up in cool space with wall scribblings & vintage posters.
Reviews: ["Usually I really like this place. But sometimes the pizzas are completely burned underneath which definitely is a health issue. Unfortunately I didn't check my take away pizza before I left and only saw it today when I noticed a bad taste.\nPlease please please control your pizzas before you give them out like this...\nIt's 30â‚¬ for two pizzas which are burnt... :-/", "Honestly one of my favorite restaurants in the world. Ritrovo encapsulates the rebellious grittyness that Berlin radiates and combines it with top tier Italian food. I've come here pretty much all my life and they never disappoint with a pizza crust so thin and delicious any future pizzas you order will seem like American deep dish. Come here to get great food, experience a great atmosphere, service is serviceable. Also they left a little complimentary drink on the table with some bread to wash it down, very thick and tasted like olives, good tho.", 'The staff was really friendly, the pizzas arenâ€™t expensive and theyâ€™re super big. So for the price itâ€™s a really good deal. The pizzas are authentic Italian pizzas and the menu is in Italian and German. I really like atmosphere there, and thatâ€™s probably why itâ€™s so popular. I had a really good time there. Would recommend this place']

Name: Le Bon
Summary: Laid-back, cozy restaurant serving brunch & light meals, plus smoothies & cocktails.
Opening Hours: Monday: 10:00â€¯AMâ€‰â€“â€‰3:30â€¯PM, Tuesday: 10:00â€¯AMâ€‰â€“â€‰3:30â€¯PM, Wednesday: 10:00â€¯AMâ€‰â€“â€‰3:30â€¯PM, Thursday: 10:00â€¯AMâ€‰â€“â€‰3:30â€¯PM, Friday: 10:00â€¯AMâ€‰â€“â€‰3:30â€¯PM, Saturday: 10:00â€¯AMâ€‰â€“â€‰3:30â€¯PM, Sunday: 10:00â€¯AMâ€‰â€“â€‰3:30â€¯PM
Reviews: ['The Eggs Benedict and Lemon Avocado Toast were absolutely delicious! The flavors were perfectly balanced, and the presentation was spot on. The waffles, though, were the bestâ€”crispy on the outside, fluffy on the inside, and simply unforgettable. Plus, they serve you tap water, which is a nice touch. A must-visit spot in Berlin for a great brunch!', 'Amazing eggs Benedict and pancakes. Coffee and OJ were good too. Decent price and cozy bar in a quiet space close to the park. Service was kind and friendly and very quick. Definitely would recommend', 'Great place, i had a very good brunch, the music was really good and the staff very nice for the first time since im in Berlin. Very friendly. I had a delicious moment. Thank you, Iâ€™ll definitely come back for something savory this time â˜ºï¸']

Name: Curry Baude Gesundbrunnen
Summary: Intimate counter-service specializing in currywurst, fries & other comfort fare.
Opening Hours: Monday: 6:00â€¯AMâ€‰â€“â€‰9:00â€¯PM, Tuesday: 6:00â€¯AMâ€‰â€“â€‰9:00â€¯PM, Wednesday: 6:00â€¯AMâ€‰â€“â€‰9:00â€¯PM, Thursday: 6:00â€¯AMâ€‰â€“â€‰9:00â€¯PM, Friday: 6:00â€¯AMâ€‰â€“â€‰9:00â€¯PM, Saturday: 9:00â€¯AMâ€‰â€“â€‰9:00â€¯PM, Sunday: 9:00â€¯AMâ€‰â€“â€‰8:00â€¯PM
Reviews: ["I can't comment on food as that was my first time having currywurst but they have the most compositable prices I've seen in Berlin.  The couple owners were so nice.", 'This is a good place to taste traditional Berliner curry sausages. The food itself is not really special but the shop owner is quite nice and ambitious with his business!', 'Visitors in the market for currywurst are often directed to big names like Curry 36 or Konnopkeâ€™s Imbiss. But locals prefer Curry Baude, little more than a window tacked on the side of the Gesundbrunnen U-Bahn station. The sausage attains the perfect equilibrium of crispy yet juicy, the ketchup-to-curry ratio is near-perfect, and the pommes are perfectly portioned to balance out the meat. Sure, the service may be especially gruff, even by German standards, but thatâ€™s part of the charm. [$]']

Name: Tomasa
Summary: Modern 2-story eatery in a villa with a modern German menu, courtyard tables, stove & bar area.
Opening Hours: Monday: 9:00â€¯AMâ€‰â€“â€‰11:00â€¯PM, Tuesday: 9:00â€¯AMâ€‰â€“â€‰11:00â€¯PM, Wednesday: 9:00â€¯AMâ€‰â€“â€‰11:00â€¯PM, Thursday: 9:00â€¯AMâ€‰â€“â€‰11:00â€¯PM, Friday: 9:00â€¯AMâ€‰â€“â€‰11:00â€¯PM, Saturday: 9:00â€¯AMâ€‰â€“â€‰11:00â€¯PM, Sunday: 9:00â€¯AMâ€‰â€“â€‰11:00â€¯PM
Reviews:
['1) ğŸ‘It is the best place to have a dinner with your small kid
2) ğŸ‘foods are delicious
3) ğŸ‘people are friendly
4) ğŸ‘nice decorations and atmosphere
5) ğŸ‘many parking spots in front of the building

6) ğŸ‘serving time is little bit long. We were able to start eating 45 minutes after we sit our table.', 'Nice venue and outside area. Great staff. But the food is comparable to airport food: Supermarket bought smoked salmon, bland scrambled eggs, mediocore sausages, and really bad coffee.', 'Fancy breakfasts for really decent prices.
The places is very charming, historical building with many types of seating, two floors inside the building and many outside seating in many different corners and terraces.
We were 4, had 4 meals and drinks (see photos), bill was 62 EUR (not including tip).']

Name: Volkskammer
Summary: Concept restaurant inspired by East Berlin, with meaty dishes prepared by chefs from the former GDR.
Opening Hours: Monday: Closed, Tuesday: 11:00â€¯AMâ€‰â€“â€‰10:00â€¯PM, Wednesday: 11:00â€¯AMâ€‰â€“â€‰10:00â€¯PM, Thursday: 11:00â€¯AMâ€‰â€“â€‰10:00â€¯PM, Friday: 11:00â€¯AMâ€‰â€“â€‰10:00â€¯PM, Saturday: 11:00â€¯AMâ€‰â€“â€‰10:00â€¯PM, Sunday: 11:00â€¯AMâ€‰â€“â€‰5:00â€¯PM
Reviews:
["The place is very atmospheric. The food is great, I'd like to highlight the goulash, it's really delicious. Just a note: jagerschnitzel is very simple and there's no meat in it. Don't expect it to be tasty. But I still leave 5 stars because it's supposed to be like that. Other dishes (like goulash) have real and tasty meat though", 'As an Eastern European, I have to say they did a great job! The restaurant feels really authentic. They used to be situated exactly like this on the floor level in a communist bloc of apartments. The decoration is a lot, which takes away some of the authenticity, but I understand why. The details are so fun, I love it! The food and service are also very good!
Overall, it was a great experience and it is worth a visit!', "Despite good reviews on maps, visiting Volkskammer in Berlin offers an immersive dive into a GDR-themed ambiance, complete with dim lighting and quirky, communist block-style decor. Unfortunately, the dining experience didn't match the interesting setting.
The schnitzel was disappointing, made from breaded ham instead of fresh pork, and the penne was overly simplistic, tasting mainly of ketchup and sweetness.
Additionally, being charged 4 euros for still water felt excessive. The service was adequate, and the only consolation was the quick arrival of our meals, which was a relief as we were eager to leave."]

Name: Panda Meister Berlin Ostbahnhof
Summary: Humble counter-serve snack shack doling out Chinese treats, such as dumplings & bubble tea.
Opening Hours: Monday: 10:30â€¯AMâ€‰â€“â€‰9:00â€¯PM, Tuesday: 10:30â€¯AMâ€‰â€“â€‰9:00â€¯PM, Wednesday: 10:30â€¯AMâ€‰â€“â€‰9:00â€¯PM, Thursday: 10:30â€¯AMâ€‰â€“â€‰9:00â€¯PM, Friday: 10:30â€¯AMâ€‰â€“â€‰9:00â€¯PM, Saturday: 11:00â€¯AMâ€‰â€“â€‰9:00â€¯PM, Sunday: 11:00â€¯AMâ€‰â€“â€‰9:00â€¯PM
Reviews:
['The food, atmosphere and service are extremely authentic! The male cook is businesslike and a little chaotic, but very fast and good! The lady is smiling and charming, throwing in some Chinese words. The prices are great, especially for the dumplings - which are probably their specialty and most ordered dish.', "Panda Meister is a hidden gem (but I guess everyone knows already this place). This food truck serves up the most delicious dumplings I've ever had, with a perfect balance of tender, flavorful fillings and delicate wrappers. The pork and veggie dumplings are a standout, bursting with juicy goodness. The dipping chili sauces are the perfect complement, adding an extra layer of flavor. Service is quick and friendly, making it an ideal spot for a tasty, on-the-go meal. To top it off, the lady is always nice and friendly. If you love dumplings, you need to go here ASAP!!", "Good dumplings for good affordable price. The place may looks a little rough but doesn't reflect the food quality at all. It even makes it more authentic. The service is quick and very friendly. The food overall was delicious and filling. The bubble tea is alright but not my taste. It had too much syrup in it. All in all I can recommend everyone who like street food Chinese style.
Also i recommend the other food stalls there. This won't be my last visit and will definitely try Mapo Tofu next time.

Side note: you can also pay electronically (credit card, apple pay etc.). Very convenient."]

Name: Lunch Time
Summary: Compact Italian counter-serve place offering pizza, pasta & salads in informal surrounds.
Opening Hours: Monday: 8:00â€¯AMâ€‰â€“â€‰7:00â€¯PM, Tuesday: 8:00â€¯AMâ€‰â€“â€‰7:00â€¯PM, Wednesday: 8:00â€¯AMâ€‰â€“â€‰7:00â€¯PM, Thursday: 8:00â€¯AMâ€‰â€“â€‰7:00â€¯PM, Friday: 8:00â€¯AMâ€‰â€“â€‰7:00â€¯PM, Saturday: Closed, Sunday: Closed
Reviews:
['Nice place for breakfast. Everythig was very fast. Pizza, egg breakfast, coffee were very tasty. Friendly staff. Recommended.', 'Fine little cafe with many different things to eat.
I tried a pizza ğŸ• slice and it was huge :)
Flavor was okay but a bit bland. Could not eat everything.

A bit nosy with a boom box blasting radio over the place.

It was clean', 'A short walk from Museum Island, this Pizza/Pasta place was a nice lunch break for the hungry traveler. The veggie pizza, lentil soup, and house salad all hit the spot. Even our picky eater devoured his food.']

Name: Lemongrass
Summary: Pad Thai, coconut-based curries & rice dishes in a relaxed venue with colorful decor.
Reviews: ['Had a great dinner in this restaurant! All dishes taste authentic as they should be. Good vibe and good service. Highly recommended for everyone who loves authentic Thai cuisine ğŸ‘ğŸ¾ğŸ‘ğŸ¾', 'I was passing by this place and the Tom Yum soup looked delicious so I decided to book for the evening. My mumâ€™s pad Thai was truly delicious while I was expecting better from the green curry â€” I kinda left hungry, the portion wasnâ€™t big. Anyway for the price I will definitely come back again, surely for the pad Thai. They had many take away orders but the staff, the guy who served us in particular, was attentive and kind with clients in the restaurant. Thank you!', "Worst pad Thai I have ever eaten. It's super salty and too wet. I have to drink half a glass of water after one bite. I added an extra noodles and it was still super salty, so I had to leave itğŸ˜¢ But the fried rice is good. Service attitude is a bit rude but acceptable"]

Name: CafÃ© Tasso - Das andere Antiquariat
Summary: Cafe with modern artwork, a selection of used books, newspapers & magazines, plus regular events.
Opening Hours: Monday: 10:00â€¯AMâ€‰â€“â€‰7:00â€¯PM, Tuesday: 10:00â€¯AMâ€‰â€“â€‰7:00â€¯PM, Wednesday: 10:00â€¯AMâ€‰â€“â€‰7:00â€¯PM, Thursday: 10:00â€¯AMâ€‰â€“â€‰7:00â€¯PM, Friday: 10:00â€¯AMâ€‰â€“â€‰7:00â€¯PM, Saturday: 10:00â€¯AMâ€‰â€“â€‰7:00â€¯PM, Sunday: Closed
Reviews: ["Highly recommend eating here, they have both light sweet/salty breakfast and more consistent food, plus great selection of cakes, including many vegan ones. I recommend the lentil soup. I also got the vegan breakfast but I didn't like they mix fruits with veggies. Plus the view over the window is great. Unfortunately didn't find any book to like", 'Lovely and cosy cafe near U-Bahn Frankfurter Tor. Beautiful and appealing interior. Currently you can have coffee inside with covid test, but outside, on the terrace you can stay without any tests. Tasty and beautifully decorated breakfast. Especially tasty fresh baked, and still warm croissants. Also friendly service. Beautiful place! Thank you :) Btw, there is also books store and shelfs with cheap, second hand books to buy.', 'A pleasant cafÃ© place along Frankfurter Allee in Berlin- Friedrichshain, with an integrated book store/sale. We stopped for a espresso & cappuccino and enjoyed both. There is some cake (nothing extraordinary) and some breakfast plates. The lady serving us was friendly and smiling. In some side rooms books were offered and a flyer with events was placed at each table. We will definitely check some of these musical events soon.']

Name: Angry Chicken
Summary: Korean spicy fried chicken, plus burgers, noodles & bibimbap rice, in a compact, low-key space.
Opening Hours: Monday: 12:00â€‰â€“â€‰9:00â€¯PM, Tuesday: 12:00â€‰â€“â€‰9:00â€¯PM, Wednesday: 12:00â€‰â€“â€‰9:00â€¯PM, Thursday: 12:00â€‰â€“â€‰10:00â€¯PM, Friday: 12:00â€‰â€“â€‰11:00â€¯PM, Saturday: 12:00â€‰â€“â€‰11:00â€¯PM, Sunday: 12:00â€‰â€“â€‰10:00â€¯PM
Reviews:
['It is one of the best places to try the Korean spiciest chicken recipes.

Dishes served with different levels of hotnessğŸ”¥ğŸ”¥ğŸŒ¶ğŸŒ¶.

Enjoyed the spicy and hot dishes in berlin after a long tym. Value for money. Definitely recommendable!ğŸ‘Œ', "I was extremely happy with this food. From a very long time I wanted to eat proper Korean chicken and finally I found it. You can choose chickens in different tastes and they all taste cool. Hotdog was top of the top for me! It really was my taste. Everything also looked nice. The only thing which I would change is the quality of a chicken, I had a feeling that it's a cheap sort of chicken and it would be 10 times nicer if it would be a better one.", 'the chicken was okay, the sauce was a bit bland, not good as before. Hamburger was horrible, the patties were black burned â˜¹ï¸']

Name: Cafe Hermann Eicke
Summary: Trendy breakfasts, bagels, sandwiches & espresso in a hip, minimalist space with an industrial feel.
Opening Hours: Monday: 8:00â€¯AMâ€‰â€“â€‰4:00â€¯PM, Tuesday: 8:00â€¯AMâ€‰â€“â€‰4:00â€¯PM, Wednesday: 8:00â€¯AMâ€‰â€“â€‰4:00â€¯PM, Thursday: 8:00â€¯AMâ€‰â€“â€‰4:00â€¯PM, Friday: 8:00â€¯AMâ€‰â€“â€‰4:00â€¯PM, Saturday: 9:00â€¯AMâ€‰â€“â€‰4:00â€¯PM, Sunday: 9:00â€¯AMâ€‰â€“â€‰4:00â€¯PM
Reviews:
["The cafÃ© is really cozy, and it's in a nice spot with super friendly staff. They're pros at what they do, and the prices are fair. I have to say, the cakes and coffee are absolutely delicious.

The service is warm and welcoming, and the whole vibe is great. But, you know, inside could be a bit tidier and calmer. That's the only thing I'd say could be better. Overall, though, it's a cool spot, especially with that awesome outdoor area in the summer.", 'Today it was my second time here, i ordered Americano(seems like middle size), i paid 4,40â‚¬â€¦ only for very ordinary black coffee.
because i took paper to-go cup.

Because of the environment. of course environment is important. but this is just an excuse.
they aim to eco-friendly, but not a customer friendly. disappointed.', 'A perfect and quaint experience at Herman Eicke!

I went for a solo brunch at Hermann Eicke on my last day in Berlin.

The interiors were clean and there were many spaces to sit.
I noticed a few guests were working from their laptops; so I could sense the vibe here was a nice place to chill but also work if you needed to.

Service was fast and professional! I opted for the Avocadotoast and added a poached egg. It was brilliant! Fresh, tasty and vibrant. It exceeded my expectations!

I also got an orange immune booster to just perk me up! It was tasty too!

Price is just right, you get quality food for what you pay for! Plenty of options on such a simple menu.

Thank you!']

Name: Subway
Summary: Casual counter-serve chain for build-your-own sandwiches & salads, with health-conscious options.
Opening Hours: Monday: 9:00â€¯AMâ€‰â€“â€‰10:00â€¯PM, Tuesday: 9:00â€¯AMâ€‰â€“â€‰10:00â€¯PM, Wednesday: 9:00â€¯AMâ€‰â€“â€‰10:00â€¯PM, Thursday: 9:00â€¯AMâ€‰â€“â€‰10:00â€¯PM, Friday: 9:00â€¯AMâ€‰â€“â€‰10:00â€¯PM, Saturday: 9:00â€¯AMâ€‰â€“â€‰10:00â€¯PM, Sunday: 9:00â€¯AMâ€‰â€“â€‰10:00â€¯PM
Reviews: ['Food was as ok. But the menu on the door said 5.99. We order 2 menus and paid 15.38 EUR. Feel like I was scammed.', 'My son really wanted a Subway sandwich, figured it is near the end of winter holidays so I took him into Berlin since there are none near our place and wanted a change of view. Decided to go here, as I wanted to avoid the Alexa crowds. Service was great, friendly staff, clean tables and over all it was clean. Unfortunately they no longer serve a Turkey sub, so my son went with a spicy chicken, I got the classic tuna sub. One thing, the street access door is locked, you need to enter at the side. Not sure why this is the case.', "I had luck finding this place open at 9 am in this very cold Sunday morning. Staff isn't the kindest this early in the morning but at least I could spend my next hour warm and cozy until anything else opens."]

Name: Vapiano
Summary: Laid-back restaurant featuring made-to-order fresh pasta dishes, along with pizza & salad.
Opening Hours: Monday: 11:00â€¯AMâ€‰â€“â€‰11:00â€¯PM, Tuesday: 11:00â€¯AMâ€‰â€“â€‰11:00â€¯PM, Wednesday: 11:00â€¯AMâ€‰â€“â€‰11:00â€¯PM, Thursday: 11:00â€¯AMâ€‰â€“â€‰11:00â€¯PM, Friday: 11:00â€¯AMâ€‰â€“â€‰12:30â€¯AM, Saturday: 11:00â€¯AMâ€‰â€“â€‰12:30â€¯AM, Sunday: 11:00â€¯AMâ€‰â€“â€‰11:00â€¯PM
Reviews: ["My recent experience at this restaurant was extremely disappointing. The food was absolutely terrible. We ordered the chicken Alfredo, and to our shock, it came with a mere six tiny pieces of chicken buried in a sea of bland, flavorless pasta. For a dish that costs 20â‚¬, I expected something far more substantial and satisfying. Instead, it felt like we were paying a premium price for a plate of plain pasta with barely any effort put into it. The quality of the food did not even come close to justifying the exorbitant price. I won't be returning and would advise others to avoid this place unless they want to leave hungry and disappointed. Unfortunately no fewer than one star is possible!", 'Reasonable price and superb atmosphere!  It is the first time I went to a branch of Vapiano. Everything was nicely organised. The taste of the food was also pretty good. The presentation was mouthwatering. I enjoyed their entire system. It was a great experience. If you like pasta/pizza it is a worthy place.', 'As good as it can be. Food was good, portions have big size.\nThe staff was very friendly and helpful.']

['Great ambience and service is good. I felt the place is surely make sense when you go as a couple. Good place for a date night. Drinks are a bit on the pricey side but they are good. Food tastes yummy too.', 'Great Place!
Family Business!
Really good Pasta, and i usually have trouble eating Pasta in Restaurants, because i love to Cook them myself.
Nice staff and good atmosphere', 'We stumbled across this restaurant while walking around Berlin. We didnâ€™t have a reservation but they were able to get us in. We sat at a small high top table behind the host stand and it was perfect (the chairs were very comfy for high top chairs).

The food was great! My husband got a truffle butter pasta that was amazing and I got a red sauce pasta. We had a great time and loved the atmosphere.']

Name: CafÃ© Chagall

Reviews:
['Wonderful hidden restaurant that we stumbled upon by chance.

The indoors have a Gothic medieval theme, with old benches and tables and candle lights. Loved the ambience and the vice.

Music is nice, service is friendly and prompt. Great selection of beers.

We orders the chicken schnitzel which was nice and crispy, came with a side of fries.

The potato and salmon blini was simply great! Every bite was savoured.

Highly recommended!', 'Great place to celebrate your birthday! I booked the red room and they made everything perfect! They have good burgers.', 'It used to be one of my favorite bars in Berlin, until one day Iâ€™ve forgotten they donâ€™t accept cards.
I had to pay for ONE BEER but didnâ€™t have cash and the waiter denied allowing me to withdraw it from ATM, I had to wait for my friend to bring me the cash.
In general, the stuff was extremely rude and accusing me of scamming them ( again, the bill in question was 3.80 â‚¬ for a bottle of beer :D
Instead of coming here, consider an amazing place nextdoor - Piruette']

Name: Orania.Restaurant & Orania.Bar
Summary: High-end, international food & cocktails are served in this refined space with live music.
Opening Hours: Monday: 6:30â€¯AMâ€‰â€“â€‰10:30â€¯PM, Tuesday: 6:30â€¯AMâ€‰â€“â€‰10:30â€¯PM, Wednesday: 6:30â€¯AMâ€‰â€“â€‰10:30â€¯PM, Thursday: 6:30â€¯AMâ€‰â€“â€‰10:30â€¯PM, Friday: 6:30â€¯AMâ€‰â€“â€‰10:30â€¯PM, Saturday: 6:30â€¯AMâ€‰â€“â€‰10:30â€¯PM, Sunday: 6:30â€¯AMâ€‰â€“â€‰10:30â€¯PM
Reviews:
['Iâ€˜ve actually sympathized with going to the Orania Restaurant for at least a couple of years. I guess the trigger was one of the very first articles Iâ€˜ve read about the â€Peking/Kreuzberg Duck Menuâ€œ and the (intrinsic) stopper probably was the restaurant being a â€hotel restaurantâ€œ. Iâ€˜ve to admit, I gave the place a first check by visiting the Bar for some drinks after a stroll with a friend on Oranienstreet the other day. And guess what, our Bar experience was amazing!
So the Orania Restaurant became my very first choice for this yearâ€™s birthday dinner, to finally go for the â€mysteriousâ€œ Kreuzberg Duck (X-Bergs answer to the Peking Duck)! Not sure if thereâ€™s a word cut here and therefore giving the executive summary first: w/o questionâ€¦ one of the top 5 culinary experiences in Berlin for me over the past 21years Iâ€˜d the pleasure of living & enjoying many-many wonderful & inspirational culinary events here.
No way of mentioning even some of them here w/o dissing/missing others. As well Iâ€˜d the opportunity to run some wonderful & mystic places as part of an awesome team myself.
Ok. Letâ€™s cut the marketing blabla. Listen folks, as a trained chef, a foodie & service lover by DNA as well as someone who fully gets, reads & understands the challenges of the moment, this experience was simply â€Extraordinaryâ€œ!
The four course Kreuzberg Duck menu has been one of the top notch culinary & value4money experiences in Berlin EVER! On top of that the food was accompanied by an out of ordinary level of service. Iâ€˜d guess, that over the 4 courses weâ€˜d had a minimum of 10 different service & chef people at the table. Might sound stressful, but believe me, it was a pure pleasure to get to know every single one of them, especially because of their so much away from average commitment & positive energy which came with each & everyone!
Folks, hands on my heart, I paid the full bill and this feedback is 100% personal, not paid at all and simply based on my beliefs to â€give backâ€œ!
Before ending, my wifeâ€™s favorite part of a menu is the dessert (-> yeahhh, sheâ€™s a true sweetheart ğŸ˜) and even here, these crazy folks not only send their â€TV style PattissiÃ¨reâ€œ to our table, but she also dropped some freaking amazing, no chi-chi & simply really tasty desserts.
Ok. I get it. Itâ€™s seems far too much for an unpaid review, but hej, how much crap, average, overrated and simply â€not ever come back shitâ€œ have you been going through!?
So I thought, Iâ€˜d might want to allow myself to get really carried away for once ğŸ˜‰!
Again, very personal, very much of a Monday evening and very-very slightly infused by birthday emotions.
Simply fueled by a very special experience, which I believe needs to be shared! N-joy folks!', "Returning to Orania for my second visit was an absolute delight. Nestled within a charming hotel, this restaurant offers a unique dining experience where the open kitchen concept takes center stage. Being able to watch the culinary team at work adds an intimate touch to the meal, bridging the gap between chef and diner.

The food, without a doubt, was exceptional. Each dish was a sophisticated blend of flavors, clearly showcasing the kitchen's dedication to quality and creativity. What stood out just as much was the professionalism and attentiveness of the staff. Their attention to detail ensured a flawless dining experience from start to finish.

I left Orania feeling thoroughly impressed once again. For anyone looking for an exquisite dining experience in Berlin, I wholeheartedly recommend Orania. It's not just a meal; it's an experience that speaks to the senses and lingers in memory.", 'Everything is almost OK. In my opinion, the last course, which is fried rice, could be better, why? Because the first course and second course is full of flavors, the fried rice is missing some salt or sauce, maybe. And i would like to have a "real rice," not some crispy rice.ğŸ¤·‍â™€ï¸']

Name: Zur Gerichtslaube
Summary: Eatery in 13th-century building with beer garden, serving Berlin/Brandenburg fare in vaulted rooms.
Reviews:
['Very impressive historical site where in medieval times your fate was determined but now you can eat from fully packed plates (be sure to be hungry before you walk in). Iâ€™m not too familiar with German eat culture but theyâ€™re big eaters for sure if this is the standard.', 'If you are in Berlin this place gives the full German experienceğŸ‡©ğŸ‡ª
Itâ€™s located in the Altstadt in a lovely medieval town and the place has a story you can read on the menu.
Food is great and the portions are massive. Staff is friendly and the dining room is medieval style.', 'Amazing place. The staff was very kind and funny. The suggestions were very good. The best knuckle we have eaten ever. The starter and dessert were very good as well.

The beers made only for them are very good, especially the black ones. Moreover, they have
Schneider-Weisse as well as wheat beer, is a safe bet.

We recommend it 100%. We will come back to BerlÃ­n only to eat there. It is worth crossing the city to eat here.']

Name: Alte MÃ¼nze

Reviews: ['Gorgeous place! Huge and very clean to dance. The led wall is very impressive and the high ceiling makes this space very imponent. But... The bar is sooooo slow... Sorry, girls, but a bar is not a catwalk... But I wish to be back!', 'the venueâ€™s staff is the most unwelcoming, hostile and sour iâ€™ve ever had the displeasure of dealing with at any arts event. i got frisked 4 times, 2 of them while i was already inside of the venue by the same staff member for no particular reason, while also having an attitude of a frustrated wannabe police officer. the rest of the staff kept a similar attitude throughout the event and even the promoters seemed to be frustrated and having arguments with the venueâ€™s employees.\n\nhighly advise both promoters and attendees to avoid putting themselves through the ordeal of being treated in such a disrespectful and demeaning way for several hours of their day.', 'Went their for Monets Gardenâ€¦ The atmosphere was so magical that I didnâ€™t want to leave that place and spent their around 3 hours, however the whole exhibition is not that big. But interaction and new technologies are making you wanna stay their for a bit longer. + movie room is something, where you definitely should stay for a bit longer.']

Name: ErgÃ¼n's Fischbude
Summary: Simple, laid-back tavern for Turkish & Mediterranean dishes with a focus on fish & seafood.

['We were waiting over 1 hour and 15 minutes for our order. Two tables got their food and were already finished when we were still waiting. Waiters just told some rumours that apparently the grill is not working properly. But comes the others got their grilled fish?

If you pay, please ask to break down the costs. There are no receipts and cash only (you know why ;) )', "Nice and hearty Turkish restaurant in Berlin. One of the really few ones offering fresh fish. I also recommend to try their salad!
I had a few dinners there and I suggest to book in advance, especially on weekends as it can get quite crowded.
Overall it's a very nice fish place, with a real Turkish vibe!", 'Very authentic fish tavern!

The place is a long time family business. Itâ€™s more a tavern than a restaurant though.

The food (seafood) is very good. Taste fresh and homemade. We took a salad for 2, kalamaris, red fish and fries. That was enough for 2 persons. We paid 22â‚¬ each with drinks.

The place is full of pictures from visitors, famous people and old memories. Itâ€™s actually very nice. Donâ€™t expect something fancy, this place is nice and genuine but it is not a 4 stars restaurant.

Is worth it doe the food quality.']

Maybe it was an off night but from this experience I'd say you don't need to go out of your way to eat here."]

Experimental and international mood on all the dishes but not harming the each ingredientâ€™s own flavour.

Wine paring was okay.

My husband really liked the mood and music of the evening.

This is the most accessible and nice fine dining in Berlin. I liked it.', 'It was ok but not up to a Michelin star! The service wasnâ€™t great the food was tasty but like ok nothing mind blowing! The atmosphere was good but I donâ€™t think I will be going back']

The prices were reasonable and average for Berlin, making it an affordable option.', "We've had a dinner at that place. Name: Elefant

They also have a range of specialties from Berlin that I haven't tried yet, but they look amazing. I'm already looking forward to my next visit to explore more of the menu. Highly recommend!", 'ğŸŒŸğŸŒŸğŸŒŸğŸŒŸğŸŒŸ We had a delicious meal, starting with a goulash followed by an incredible Schnitzel Bolognese. The portions are huge and well-presented; you can even swap fries for a salad! â˜• The coffee was also very tasty. Special shout out to the waitstaff who served us with big smiles and great kindness. We visited on a lovely day, so grabbing a table on the terrace was definitely the best choice! Came with my partner and we had a wonderful time, it was quiet enough to have a good conversation. I highly recommend this place, itâ€™s one of the best spots for German cuisine Iâ€™ve tried in Berlin! ğŸ‡©ğŸ‡ªğŸ½ï¸', "This restaurant delivers an authentic German dining experience like no other! Reviews: ['Absolutely outstanding service! The team was incredibly warm, welcoming, and I felt right at home. the team went above and beyond to ensure everything was perfect. I felt truly valued as a customer and I absolutely loved the pizza ğŸ•I recommend it to anyone looking for a a wonderful evening', "This place has a great, old Berlin charm, but I stopped coming years ago because there was never a table. Post-lockdown, they've expanded the interior so no problem with seating. Even better, the food was exceptional - the Bauernpizza, or Farmer's Pizza, was the best pizza I've had in years with a crust that was light and crispy. I'll be coming back for more!", 'The pizza was really tasty and the staff friendly! I can recommend the homemade hibiscus lemonade, itâ€™s good and not too sweet.\nUnfortunately on my partnerâ€™s pizza the bacon was missing and when we asked about it they just said theyâ€™d talk to the kitchen and never got back to us. We were quite a big group (~25 people), so sometimes orders were mixed up and brought out more than was ordered.']

Opening Hours: Monday: Closed, Tuesday: 11:30â€¯AMâ€‰â€“â€‰11:00â€¯PM, Wednesday: 11:30â€¯AMâ€‰â€“â€‰11:00â€¯PM, Thursday: 11:30â€¯AMâ€‰â€“â€‰11:00â€¯PM, Friday: 11:30â€¯AMâ€‰â€“â€‰11:00â€¯PM, Saturday: 11:30â€¯AMâ€‰â€“â€‰11:00â€¯PM, Sunday: 12:00â€‰â€“â€‰11:00â€¯PM
Reviews:
["A really nice place to have a drink and some tapas. There is a lot to select from the menu, a very nice selection of side dishes.

The place looks very clean and they play modern music. The waiters are friendly as well. The amount of food in comparison to price could be a bit better, because they don't serve like other Vietnamese restaurants, but i understand this is kind of a tapas bar.

So good so far, i can see myself returning for a next time.", 'Delicious food and nice ambiance.', 'Worth every euro! Pho was just how it supposed to be. Home made lemonade also was good!']

Name: Pho Phan
Summary: Vietnamese pho noodle soups, spring rolls & Thai curries at a stylish place with a terrace.
Opening Hours: Monday: 11:30â€¯AMâ€‰â€“â€‰11:00â€¯PM, Tuesday: 11:30â€¯AMâ€‰â€“â€‰11:00â€¯PM, Wednesday: 11:30â€¯AMâ€‰â€“â€‰11:00â€¯PM, Thursday: 11:30â€¯AMâ€‰â€“â€‰11:00â€¯PM, Friday: 11:30â€¯AMâ€‰â€“â€‰11:00â€¯PM, Saturday: 11:30â€¯AMâ€‰â€“â€‰11:00â€¯PM, Sunday: 12:00â€‰â€“â€‰11:30â€¯PM
Reviews: ['Super nice restaurant. The food is delicious and at reasonable prices. The waiters are also really friendly. I go there often as it is in my street and Iâ€™ve never been disappointed with the quality. I would highly recommend :) (also they are super fast for lunch breaks)', 'Great place to grab a bite of Vietnamese food in NeukÃ¶lln. Close to the HermannstraÃŸe station, itâ€™s very convenient to find this amazing restaurant. First time coming here and Iâ€™m immediately hooked. The food is so good! I really loved my order of glass noodles with egg and veggies it was really well put together and all the other small dishes we got was also good!\n\nI really recommend trying this place out, hidden gem in NeukÃ¶lln. Absolutely will be back again especially the staff, so friendly and they such a lovely smile.', 'The service was not the most attentive and food good but rather average. The veggie variety is quite nice and the staff actually followed me down the street when I left without the food I was taking to go. That was very sweet. Interior also pretty but that was it really']

Name: Mira Restaurant
Summary: Casual fixture serving globally inspired breakfasts, including simits, bagels, pancakes & smoothies.
Opening Hours: Monday: 8:00â€¯AMâ€‰â€“â€‰1:00â€¯AM, Tuesday: 8:00â€¯AMâ€‰â€“â€‰1:00â€¯AM, Wednesday: 8:00â€¯AMâ€‰â€“â€‰1:00â€¯AM, Thursday: 8:00â€¯AMâ€‰â€“â€‰1:00â€¯AM, Friday: 8:00â€¯AMâ€‰â€“â€‰2:00â€¯AM, Saturday: 8:00â€¯AMâ€‰â€“â€‰2:00â€¯AM, Sunday: 8:00â€¯AMâ€‰â€“â€‰2:00â€¯AM
Reviews:
['We stopped in here for breakfast, and in all honesty we really couldnâ€™t have selected in more fitting establishment. We had the farmer â€“ breakfast, and the vegan breakfast, which was served to us with one bread and simit each. we also got the Biscoff pancakes, and everything was served with a healthy portion of fruit. Service at this place was excellent staff friendly, and if you come here youâ€™re even in for a chilly surpriseâ€¦ We spent about â‚¬20 per person on an admittedly lavish brunch. 10/10.', 'Cash only eatery that was absolutely amazing. Insanely great prices and so many options to choose from. Superb coffee, and the food that was delivered was so fresh and tasty. In our visit to Berlin it will be hard to not just come here for breakfast each day!', 'This is by far the best kebap place we have been in Germany.

Their kebaps are very tasty and service is also very good. Portion is very big, if you are nit very hungry, 1 dish is also enough.

We have tried many dishes (Yogurtlu Kebap, Beyti Kebab, Chicken Shish Kebap, Meze platters, Grilled vegetable salad) and everything was good all time.

They give salad and meze plate as a starter before your main dish comes. They also give tea and baklava in the end.

Whenever we want to eat kebap, we always come here.']

Name: Restaurant Bella Italia
Summary: Casual restaurant serving Italian pasta, pizza & grill dishes, with a special children's menu.
Opening Hours: Monday: 11:00â€¯AMâ€‰â€“â€‰11:00â€¯PM, Tuesday: 11:00â€¯AMâ€‰â€“â€‰11:00â€¯PM, Wednesday: 11:00â€¯AMâ€‰â€“â€‰11:00â€¯PM, Thursday: 11:00â€¯AMâ€‰â€“â€‰11:00â€¯PM, Friday: 11:00â€¯AMâ€‰â€“â€‰11:00â€¯PM, Saturday: 11:00â€¯AMâ€‰â€“â€‰11:00â€¯PM, Sunday: 11:00â€¯AMâ€‰â€“â€‰11:00â€¯PM
Reviews: ['Amazing food.\nRisotto was brilliant and so was the pizza. I really recommend the salmon with pasta it was so good!', 'Decent prices, tasty dishes. We took spaghetti and pizza. Very nice service, although tardy: there were not too many people and we had to wait 10min for a beer, for 6 people we were brought 2 cards from the menu. Strange rules. Overall we left satisfied.', 'The worst experience ever. We have ordered 4 dishes and none of them was good. Vitello Tonato was covered with mayonnaise instead of special sauce. Antipasti were fried in oil vegetables and mozzarella. No salt, no spice, no taste, only oil. Pizza was worst than from supermarket- because it seems it was heated, not backed (150 degrees in the oven instead of 250-300). And the chicken breast was tasteless, like it was boiled and then covered with tomato sauce.']

Name: Restaurant Merhaba

Address: Haus der Demokratie, Greifswalder StraÃŸe 4, Berlin
Opening Hours: Monday: 6:00â€¯PMâ€‰â€“â€‰12:00â€¯AM, Tuesday: Closed, Wednesday: 6:00â€¯PMâ€‰â€“â€‰12:00â€¯AM, Thursday: 6:00â€¯PMâ€‰â€“â€‰12:00â€¯AM, Friday: 6:00â€¯PMâ€‰â€“â€‰12:00â€¯AM, Saturday: 6:00â€¯PMâ€‰â€“â€‰12:00â€¯AM, Sunday: 6:00â€¯PMâ€‰â€“â€‰12:00â€¯AM
Reviews:
['Hidden gem in Berlin ğŸ’¯
A very cozy and warm place with very very nice and friendly people ğŸ¤
Also the food is out of this world ğŸ« ğŸ¤', '- Very delicious food.
- The stuffed eggplant, was exquisite!
- very cosy and enjoyable atmosphere.
- great service.
- clean.
- We were served by a very polite and friendly lady. She made sure we had everything at best.
- definitely going back there.', 'Very cozy and friendly. Tasty food!']

Name: Maselli
Summary: Refined pastas, meaty mains & Italian wines in an intimate space with string lights & framed photos.
Opening Hours: Monday: Closed, Tuesday: 5:00â€¯PMâ€‰â€“â€‰12:00â€¯AM, Wednesday: 5:00â€¯PMâ€‰â€“â€‰12:00â€¯AM, Thursday: 5:00â€¯PMâ€‰â€“â€‰12:00â€¯AM, Friday: 5:00â€¯PMâ€‰â€“â€‰12:00â€¯AM, Saturday: 5:00â€¯PMâ€‰â€“â€‰12:00â€¯AM, Sunday: 5:00â€‰â€“â€‰10:00â€¯PM
Reviews: ["Whenever I crave delicious food, this is my go-to spot. The menu changes often, keeping things fresh. They serve Sicilian wine paired perfectly with their dishes, each one meticulously crafted. The seasoning is just right, letting the ingredients shine. Whether with family or on a date, it's a great place to unwind and enjoy", "Very nice and cozy place for good Italian cuisine. The food was great, with some vegetarian options and a specials menu written on the wall. Had a nice selection of wines. The starters were the best part of the meal. The Burata salad was amazing and the seafood salad. The staff didn't know too much English but they were very nice and understanding. Highly recommend.", 'A very beautiful surprise. The service, the quality of the food, portions, price, all top. A cosy atmosphere, very well cooked, fresh and seasoned food, with amazing deserts, drinks and attentive staff. Congratulations!!! I highly recommend this place, and I will return ğŸŒ¿']

Name: Sushi & Asian Tveita
Summary: Intimate eatery providing Vietnamese dishes, beer, wine, cocktails & espresso drinks.
Reviews: ['Awesome Vietnamese restaurant with loads of fresh fish options, indoor and outdoor seating, and Vietnamese drip coffee!\n\nI enjoyed the salmon bowl which came with salad that packed a crunch and complimented the salmon nicely.', "Sorry haven't taken the photos of meals, but I have to say the shrimps in curry are frozen ones... It ruined the whole curry ğŸ«  sommerrollen are good", "Great food, big portions. At first the menu doesn't seem very veggie/vegan friendly, but you can substitute the chicken or duck in any plate for their vegan versions!"]

Name: Tapas y mÃ¡s
Summary: Varied menu of modern tapas & Spanish dishes served in a bright dining room & large courtyard.
Opening Hours: Monday: 11:00â€¯AMâ€‰â€“â€‰12:00â€¯AM, Tuesday: 11:00â€¯AMâ€‰â€“â€‰12:00â€¯AM, Wednesday: 11:00â€¯AMâ€‰â€“â€‰12:00â€¯AM, Thursday: 11:00â€¯AMâ€‰â€“â€‰12:00â€¯AM, Friday: 11:00â€¯AMâ€‰â€“â€‰12:00â€¯AM, Saturday: 5:00â€¯PMâ€‰â€“â€‰12:00â€¯AM, Sunday: 5:00â€¯PMâ€‰â€“â€‰12:00â€¯AM
Reviews: ['Very good main courses, big portions. Second evening order only tapas with drinks as well good', 'Maybe my expectations were too high, but the chicken was dry, the menu itself doesnâ€™t explain with details how will be the food, if you havenâ€™t tried Spanish food before will be a mess. It wasnâ€™t bad but was not good either. If you run out of options, is still decent to eat there, but I wouldnâ€™t come back.', "Ordered a mixed plate of tapas for 2 and it can easily serve 3 people. The price overall is fair, but it was a bit hard to get the waiter's attention. Nonetheless the whole staff was super nice, I definitely recommend it."]

Name: The Tree
Summary: Szechuan rice bowls, noodle soups & small plates in a high-ceilinged space with eclectic decor.
Reviews: ['The interior design is very creative, with a touch of beauty that makes the space stand out, even if itâ€™s not the most comfortable. The art and atmosphere make up for it. The food was decent, and the vegetarian dishes are clearly highlighted on the menu.', 'Very friendly staff, good food.\nWe ordered the noodle soup with 3 different types of tofu and the mapo tofu with noodles (calla).\nThe food was ready within minutes. They serve the noodles with fresh vegetables (radish, carrots, cucumber, arugula, tomatoes) and in some spicy chilly oil. The noodle soup was not spicy at all. You can see on the menu which dishes are spicy and which are not. The beauty tea with goji, dates and rose petals was also very special and delicious. You can sit inside and outside. Very nice atmosphere. I would definitely go out to eat there again!', 'Food was actually good but charging 2â‚¬ for extra chilli oil is a bit too much!']

Name: Aromi e Sapori - Restaurant & Weinbar
Summary: Elegant Italian option with sidewalk tables, offering wine & familiar favorites like pasta.
Opening Hours: Monday: 5:30â€‰â€“â€‰11:00â€¯PM, Tuesday: 5:30â€‰â€“â€‰11:00â€¯PM, Wednesday: 5:30â€‰â€“â€‰11:00â€¯PM, Thursday: 5:30â€‰â€“â€‰11:00â€¯PM, Friday: 5:30â€‰â€“â€‰11:00â€¯PM, Saturday: 5:30â€‰â€“â€‰11:00â€¯PM, Sunday: Closed
Reviews:
['Might have become my favorite italian place. Food was delicious, generous portions - great atmosphere.
Need to come back soon to try more things on their menu!
Carpaccio was fab, Carbonara and the ragu/burrata pasta as well. Tiramisu was greatğŸ‘ğŸ½', 'Super good pasta, very good servings.
Ravioli was amazing and the pasta carbonara as well.', 'Wonderful food, wine, and atmosphere. Typical italian restaurant with a small but very nice selection of dishes.
We took the fish platter for two and the cannoli. Wonderful sicilian wine selection.  Highly recommended when in Berlin.']

Name: MacLaren's Pub
Summary: Burgers, beers & cocktails lie in store at this themed hangout for 'How I Met Your Mother' fans.
Opening Hours: Monday: Closed, Tuesday: 6:00â€¯PMâ€‰â€“â€‰1:00â€¯AM, Wednesday: 6:00â€¯PMâ€‰â€“â€‰1:00â€¯AM, Thursday: 6:00â€¯PMâ€‰â€“â€‰1:00â€¯AM, Friday: 6:00â€¯PMâ€‰â€“â€‰2:00â€¯AM, Saturday: 6:00â€¯PMâ€‰â€“â€‰2:00â€¯AM, Sunday: 6:00â€¯PMâ€‰â€“â€‰1:00â€¯AM
Reviews: ["I'm thrilled to have discovered this pub! Every detail is meticulously crafted. The cocktails are fantastic, the service is excellent, and the atmosphere is amazing. Highly recommended!!!", 'Felt just awesome seeing all the decorations from the actual show and the whole bar is filled with references, great unique pub with a couple beers on draft although itâ€™s a bit away from other attractions of the city', 'Pub created by 2 young men inspired by the series "How I met your mother". Suited for a drink in the night rather than a place to serve food because the food diversity is not that big. But it is good indeed. Also a bit cold because the outdoor is kept open even if late October. But the general atmosphere is nice and the service is very good.']

Name: Cafe Hermann Eicke
Summary: Trendy breakfasts, bagels, sandwiches & espresso in a hip, minimalist space with an industrial feel.
Opening Hours: Monday: 8:00â€¯AMâ€‰â€“â€‰4:00â€¯PM, Tuesday: 8:00â€¯AMâ€‰â€“â€‰4:00â€¯PM, Wednesday: 8:00â€¯AMâ€‰â€“â€‰4:00â€¯PM, Thursday: 8:00â€¯AMâ€‰â€“â€‰4:00â€¯PM, Friday: 8:00â€¯AMâ€‰â€“â€‰4:00â€¯PM, Saturday: 9:00â€¯AMâ€‰â€“â€‰4:00â€¯PM, Sunday: 9:00â€¯AMâ€‰â€“â€‰4:00â€¯PM
Reviews:
["The cafÃ© is really cozy, and it's in a nice spot with super friendly staff. They're pros at what they do, and the prices are fair. I have to say, the cakes and coffee are absolutely delicious.

The service is warm and welcoming, and the whole vibe is great. But, you know, inside could be a bit tidier and calmer. That's the only thing I'd say could be better. Overall, though, it's a cool spot, especially with that awesome outdoor area in the summer.", 'Today it was my second time here, i ordered Americano(seems like middle size), i paid 4,40â‚¬â€¦ only for very ordinary black coffee.
because i took paper to-go cup.

Because of the environment. of course environment is important. but this is just an excuse.
they aim to eco-friendly, but not a customer friendly. disappointed.', 'A perfect and quaint experience at Herman Eicke!

I went for a solo brunch at Hermann Eicke on my last day in Berlin.

The interiors were clean and there were many spaces to sit.
I noticed a few guests were working from their laptops; so I could sense the vibe here was a nice place to chill but also work if you needed to.

Service was fast and professional! I opted for the Avocadotoast and added a poached egg. It was brilliant! Fresh, tasty and vibrant. It exceeded my expectations!

I also got an orange immune booster to just perk me up! It was tasty too!

Price is just right, you get quality food for what you pay for! Plenty of options on such a simple menu.

Thank you!']

Name: RESTAURANT ELLA
Summary: Sophisticated hotel restaurant serving refined, contemporary European cuisine & complimentary wines.
Reviews:
['Excellent service and kitchen. Very good value for money business lunch: 14,50 EUR for two courses incl a large bottle of water, bread and butter. For 3 euros more you get a dessert as well. Modern German/French kitchen. Great fÃ¼r business meetings or when you want to dine close to main station. Service was fast and helpful. Good choice of wines as well.', 'After paying 70â‚¬ for unsalted, overcooked pasta and a rather starter-sized portion of "catch of the day"-fish, I headed for the burger place at the train station.
As a consultant, I'm used to mediocre hotel restaurant. But price/quality ratio at Ella marks a low.

To be fair: ambient is nice, service friendly.', "Very nice atmosphere, but temporary service staff and long waiting times. The food was prepared rather mediocre and carelessly arranged. The duck for the main course of the 4-course menu, which cost 66 euros, was far too dry, and the potato canneloni filled with red cabbage didn't go well with it. The wine selection was very modest, both quantitatively and qualitatively. The cuisine is below average for a hotel of this category."]

Name: Brasserie Am Gendarmenmarkt
Summary: Elegant restaurant with wood paneling, murals & brass lamps, serving modern European dishes.
Opening Hours: Monday: 12:00â€‰â€“â€‰11:00â€¯PM, Tuesday: 12:00â€‰â€“â€‰11:00â€¯PM, Wednesday: 12:00â€‰â€“â€‰11:00â€¯PM, Thursday: 12:00â€‰â€“â€‰11:00â€¯PM, Friday: 12:00â€‰â€“â€‰11:00â€¯PM, Saturday: 5:00â€‰â€“â€‰11:00â€¯PM, Sunday: Closed
Reviews:
["We had a lovely time here. Everything was really perfect from start to finish. Especially the super attentive service and then obviously the food.
The Bouillabaisse is incredible. The depth of flavor while having a big selection of seafood in it was amazing. But also the tartar and the creme brulee were superb.

I'll definitely come back for a nice occasion as this restaurant definitely hits the mark :)", 'We really loved our dinner there tonight, as the food and atmosphere were really good. Our server was very nice but not really attentive after serving us our main course. She completely disappeared and never checked bag on us for over half an hour.

My wife had the seafood bouillabaise, which was delicious, and I went more traditional with the blood sausage, which I thought was spectacular! We loved our meal tonight, but the service was very cold and and fell flat as the meal went on.', "The Brasserie am Gendarmenmarkt in Berlin offers a delightful culinary experience, seamlessly blending traditional flavors with modern flair. The pumpkin soup, a standout starter, impresses with its creamy texture and a harmonious blend of spices, providing a comforting yet sophisticated taste. The beef  stew, the highlight of the meal, is a masterful display of culinary artistry. Tender, succulent pieces of veal are simmered to perfection, enveloped in a rich, flavorful sauce that complements the meat's natural flavors. Accompanied by a fresh, crisp side salad, the meal achieves a satisfying balance. The brasserie's ambiance, characterized by elegance and a warm, welcoming atmosphere, enhances the dining experience, making it a must-visit destination for both locals and tourists seeking authentic, high-quality German cuisine in Berlin."]

Name: Borchardt
Summary: Genteel, historic restaurant with a terrace preparing local staples & desserts, plus wine.
Opening Hours: Monday: 11:30â€¯AMâ€‰â€“â€‰12:00â€¯AM, Tuesday: 11:30â€¯AMâ€‰â€“â€‰12:00â€¯AM, Wednesday: 11:30â€¯AMâ€‰â€“â€‰12:00â€¯AM, Thursday: 11:30â€¯AMâ€‰â€“â€‰12:00â€¯AM, Friday: 11:30â€¯AMâ€‰â€“â€‰12:00â€¯AM, Saturday: 11:30â€¯AMâ€‰â€“â€‰12:00â€¯AM, Sunday: 11:30â€¯AMâ€‰â€“â€‰12:00â€¯AM
Reviews:
["A restaurant where you can enjoy German cuisine.
The atmosphere in the back garden was nice and open, but it felt a bit cramped due to the number of tables.
The waiter was very friendly, and I didn't experience any of the negative impressions mentioned in other reviews.
The food was tasty, but not exceptionally delicious considering the price.", 'A classic - the schnitzel was so great. Will definitely be back when in Berlin. We also tried the steak tartar and it was excellent!', 'The best place to try the Wiener Schnitzel. The portions were massive, you can share 1 for 2 people. I liked the veal, potato salad and the cranberry sauce. Passion martini was also good. The restaurant has a nice ambiance but tables are too close to each other and it can get loud sometimes.']

Name: Il Ritrovo - Cucina Casalinga Popolare
Summary: Italian-style pizzas whipped up in cool space with wall scribblings & vintage posters.
Reviews: ["Usually I really like this place. But sometimes the pizzas are completely burned underneath which definitely is a health issue. Unfortunately I didn't check my take away pizza before I left and only saw it today when I noticed a bad taste.\nPlease please please control your pizzas before you give them out like this...\nIt's 30â‚¬ for two pizzas which are burnt... :-/", "Honestly one of my favorite restaurants in the world. Ritrovo encapsulates the rebellious grittyness that Berlin radiates and combines it with top tier Italian food. I've come here pretty much all my life and they never disappoint with a pizza crust so thin and delicious any future pizzas you order will seem like American deep dish. Come here to get great food, experience a great atmosphere, service is serviceable. Also they left a little complimentary drink on the table with some bread to wash it down, very thick and tasted like olives, good tho.", 'The staff was really friendly, the pizzas arenâ€™t expensive and theyâ€™re super big. So for the price itâ€™s a really good deal. The pizzas are authentic Italian pizzas and the menu is in Italian and German. I really like atmosphere there, and thatâ€™s probably why itâ€™s so popular. I had a really good time there. Would recommend this place']

Name: Zollpackhof
Summary: Restaurant with central fire, 2 patios & beer garden serving German food with Mediterranean twists.
Reviews:
['Fantastic place to eat, drink, and relax. The terrace is lovely and has the full menu from the restaurant (German and English menus available). Service is perfect - efficient and friendly. We came back another day and tried the biergarten, under an ancient wide spread tree that sheltered us from the sun or sprinkles.

I really liked the white asparagus, only in season during early summer, and the cheese sauce for the pretzel.', 'Relatively high end German beer garden with tasty food, great beer and wine, also friendly attentive staff. Been here a couple of times and it never disappoints. Great buisness lunch deal 14 euros and water included. Will return again when in the neighborhood', "Just sat down for a beer to enjoy the view and it started raining!
Stayed to eat and enjoy a beer or 2 , lovely calming garden area , good food and drink , tried the snapps, it's not for everyone! Lol
We had to ask nicely, but the restaurant did allow us to take away a cake for birthday ğŸ‚"]

Name: Rice On! Berlin
Summary: Modern counter serve offering create-your-own bowls featuring Asian-inspired ingredients.
Address: Berlin Hauptbahnhof â€“ Foodcourt, Europaplatz 1, Berlin
Opening Hours: Monday: 10:00â€¯AMâ€‰â€“â€‰9:00â€¯PM, Tuesday: 10:00â€¯AMâ€‰â€“â€‰9:00â€¯PM, Wednesday: 10:00â€¯AMâ€‰â€“â€‰9:00â€¯PM, Thursday: 10:00â€¯AMâ€‰â€“â€‰9:00â€¯PM, Friday: 10:00â€¯AMâ€‰â€“â€‰9:00â€¯PM, Saturday: 10:00â€¯AMâ€‰â€“â€‰9:00â€¯PM, Sunday: 10:00â€¯AMâ€‰â€“â€‰9:00â€¯PM
Reviews: ['Located at the right spot at the very entrance of Food court in Berlin Central train station, this Asian food joint is more than awesome for its food quality, taste and price! Service is courteous and quick and the meal portions are great enough to fill hungry tummies either before the journey or after! The taste is one of the true definitions of fusion with all overlapping on one another like Indian, Chinese, Thai and Malaysian, suiting all types of taste buds. We bought their chicken ball bowl and tofu bowl and both were simply great! There is a great differentiator in the name of various sauces they carry like green sauce, red sauce, peanut sauce and tamarind sauce and all sauces are great! I would certainly go back again whenever I cross the station! Highly recommended.', 'Fresh, big size dishes, with love. Very tasty. Ate rice with chicken, broccoli, green beans, as much as you want coriander and tastey sauce!', 'I liked it at first glance it, everything looked fresh and clean. The staff was so nice and everything was delicious! I found it quite filling and was fully satisfied with the quality and price. Iâ€™m very happy to have a fast, healthy, delicious food :) definitely gonna revisit when Iâ€™m here again.']

Name: OMONI ì˜¤ ëª¨ ë‹ˆ
Summary: Simple, wood-lined environment with counter seating, offering sushi, sashimi & rice dishes.
Opening Hours: Monday: Closed, Tuesday: Closed, Wednesday: 5:00â€‰â€“â€‰11:00â€¯PM, Thursday: 5:00â€‰â€“â€‰11:00â€¯PM, Friday: 5:00â€‰â€“â€‰11:00â€¯PM, Saturday: 5:00â€‰â€“â€‰11:00â€¯PM, Sunday: 5:00â€‰â€“â€‰11:00â€¯PM
Reviews:
['Amazing sushi place.
Probably I would keep the crown of best sushis of Berlin between them and Sasaya.
Loved the super fresh fish, delicious combinations, perfectly cooked rice, beautiful ceramics and a lovely, calm and peaceful atmosphere.
Extra kudos for an AC (not so common in Berlin) and for being pet friendly.
Absolutely wonderful experience, can only recommend!
Thanks for the great service as well.', 'Wow, if you are looking for some amazing and authentic sushi in Berlin, I definitely recommend this restaurant. Make sure to book your table as it can get packed and itâ€™s so worth it! Itâ€™s a chill spot where you can enjoy some great sushi for a great price.', 'Absolutely bizarre experience very badly handled by inexperienced staff.

This is not a food review as we werent served. We were visiting our friend in Berlin who reserved the table for us a week in advance. Heâ€™s been to this restaurant many times and is (was) a loyal customer.

When we showed up they told us that our name is not on the list and that they dont have any table for us (most of the tables were still free as the people didnt show up for their reservations).

They even asked my friend to show a call log to prove that he called. Which he did! It was an obvious mistake on the part of this restaurantâ€™s staff, but instead of serving a customer who was already in the restaurant and arranging us a table while rescheduling someone who had a reservation later, they just behaved silly, repeating the same â€we see you called but the list..â€ like a broken record.

We finally left because it was clear they were incapable of correcting their mistake and found much better option for dinner at the end.']

Name: Cocoro
Summary: Ramen noodle soups & beef-topped rice bowls, plus matcha drinks & sake, at a snug neighborhood stop.
Reviews: ['Cute clean place. The lady that served us was extremely friendly, smiley and with an amazing vibe. The food was fresh and good, amazing non alcoholic cocktails.', 'The portion size was a bit too small for me. After the main course, I was still somewhat hungry. The main dish was mostly rice and a bit underwhelming. The matcha ice cream was great tho.', 'Since my partner tried out this restaurant during one of her lunch breaks in 2016, we have been coming here regularly - and itâ€™s been one of, if not THE, favorite place of mine. The owners are so kind, sweet and authentic; and the food is amazing, too!']

Name: Cevicheria
Summary: Ceviche & grilled seafood, plus pisco sours, in a pared-back dining room or at outdoor tables.
Opening Hours: Monday: 6:00â€¯PMâ€‰â€“â€‰12:00â€¯AM, Tuesday: 6:00â€¯PMâ€‰â€“â€‰12:00â€¯AM, Wednesday: 6:00â€¯PMâ€‰â€“â€‰12:00â€¯AM, Thursday: 6:00â€¯PMâ€‰â€“â€‰12:00â€¯AM, Friday: 6:00â€¯PMâ€‰â€“â€‰12:00â€¯AM, Saturday: 6:00â€¯PMâ€‰â€“â€‰12:00â€¯AM, Sunday: 6:00â€¯PMâ€‰â€“â€‰12:00â€¯AM
Reviews:
['Great ceviche! Very high quality ingredients and the taste. Lovely staff and atmosphere. Highly recommended!', 'Cevicheria in Berlin is a standout dining destination for anyone craving authentic Peruvian cuisine in a vibrant and welcoming atmosphere. This charming restaurant brings the rich flavors of Peru to the heart of Berlin, offering a delightful culinary experience that is both flavorful and memorable.

The menu at Cevicheria showcases a variety of traditional Peruvian dishes, with a particular focus on ceviche, which is prepared with the freshest ingredients and expertly balanced flavors. Each dish is a testament to the skill and passion that goes into creating Peruvian cuisine. The ceviche, in particular, is a highlight, featuring perfectly marinated fish with a zesty, tangy kick that captures the essence of Peruâ€™s culinary heritage.

In addition to the exceptional food, Cevicheria boasts a fantastic selection of drinks. From refreshing pisco cocktails to expertly crafted mocktails, the beverage menu complements the food perfectly and adds to the overall dining experience.

What truly elevates the visit to Cevicheria is the service. The staff are not only attentive and friendly but also genuinely passionate about the food they serve. A special mention goes to "Valery," a great waiter from Peru who adds a personal touch to the experience. Valeryâ€™s warmth, knowledge, and enthusiasm make every meal at Cevicheria feel special. His recommendations and genuine care enhance the dining experience, making guests feel right at home.

Overall, Cevicheria is a must-visit for anyone in Berlin looking to indulge in delicious Peruvian cuisine. With its great food, excellent drinks, and outstanding service, it promises a dining experience that is both enjoyable and authentic.', 'A friend of mine brought me here and introduced me to a lovely owner. We had a great evening here. Amazing food, amazing atmosphere. We are different plates. All prepared with love.
There is  good selection of wine and cocktails ğŸ¸']

Name: Masha's Bagels & Delicatessen
Summary: Down-to-earth counter-serve with sidewalk seats doling out NYC-style bagels & sandwiches.
Opening Hours: Monday: 9:00â€¯AMâ€‰â€“â€‰3:00â€¯PM, Tuesday: Closed, Wednesday: Closed, Thursday: 9:00â€¯AMâ€‰â€“â€‰3:00â€¯PM, Friday: 9:00â€¯AMâ€‰â€“â€‰3:00â€¯PM, Saturday: 9:00â€¯AMâ€‰â€“â€‰3:00â€¯PM, Sunday: 10:00â€¯AMâ€‰â€“â€‰3:00â€¯PM
Reviews:
["Lovely place with great bagels (tracing their history from the NYC, as I've found out) and service. The lads got a kitchen that's working up to 3 PM, but they went above and beyond to get a bagel to a hungry man (me) and got me a New York Classic (which was very nice). Apart from Classic, my top 1 choice would be reuben-style sandwich. Coffee is great too, water refills are available, overall - can recommend.", 'The bagels are quite stuffed and filling! I had the breakfast bagel with extra bacon and avocado â€” mine was delicious. My boyfriend had the chipotle Turkey bagel and although it was packed with Turkey (yay) it was incredibly (!) bland. Nothing chipotle about this chipotle bagel. We would name it plain Turkey bagel ğŸ˜‚', "Have been thinking for quite a while that there was a serious lack of bagel places in Berlin that were worth going to, and man does this place really fill that void.

The iced coffee was smooth and velvety and the Reuben Sandwich was bomb. Seriously I've been dreaming about the sandwich since I ate it. The bagels have great crunch/chew as well.

10/10 will be back"]

Name: Panke Culture
Summary: Casual garden setup by a brick factory covered in street art, for drinks, sandwiches & DJ music.
Opening Hours: Monday: Closed, Tuesday: Closed, Wednesday: 6:00â€¯PMâ€‰â€“â€‰12:00â€¯AM, Thursday: 12:00â€‰â€“â€‰1:00â€¯AM, 6:00â€¯PMâ€‰â€“â€‰12:00â€¯AM, Friday: 12:00â€‰â€“â€‰4:00â€¯AM, 6:00â€¯PMâ€‰â€“â€‰12:00â€¯AM, Saturday: 12:00â€‰â€“â€‰6:00â€¯AM, 6:00â€¯PMâ€‰â€“â€‰12:00â€¯AM, Sunday: 12:00â€‰â€“â€‰6:00â€¯AM
Reviews: ['Tiny yet very Berlin club. Design, music and friendly atmosphere.', "I loved the experience, I will definitely enjoy it again. The atmosphere is super queer, people don't bother you at all, it is a great space for dissent and freedom. The accessible entrance. Beer not so expensive. The only thing I could suggest is that the bathrooms were always clean. For the rest, get ready to spend an excellent night full of music to enjoy freely.", 'It is one of the most friendly places in Berlin. Amazing crew and good sound system']

Name: The Tree
Summary: Szechuan rice bowls, noodle soups & small plates in a high-ceilinged space with eclectic decor.
Reviews: ['The interior design is very creative, with a touch of beauty that makes the space stand out, even if itâ€™s not the most comfortable. The art and atmosphere make up for it. The food was decent, and the vegetarian dishes are clearly highlighted on the menu.', 'Very friendly staff, good food.\nWe ordered the noodle soup with 3 different types of tofu and the mapo tofu with noodles (calla).\nThe food was ready within minutes. They serve the noodles with fresh vegetables (radish, carrots, cucumber, arugula, tomatoes) and in some spicy chilly oil. The noodle soup was not spicy at all. You can see on the menu which dishes are spicy and which are not. The beauty tea with goji, dates and rose petals was also very special and delicious. You can sit inside and outside. Very nice atmosphere. I would definitely go out to eat there again!', 'Food was actually good but charging 2â‚¬ for extra chilli oil is a bit too much!']

Summary: Casual Italian restaurant with a patio & rustic surrounds, offering Neapolitan wood-fired pizzas.
Opening Hours: Monday: 5:00â€¯PMâ€‰â€“â€‰12:00â€¯AM, Tuesday: 5:00â€¯PMâ€‰â€“â€‰12:00â€¯AM, Wednesday: Closed, Thursday: 5:00â€¯PMâ€‰â€“â€‰12:00â€¯AM, Friday: 5:00â€¯PMâ€‰â€“â€‰12:00â€¯AM, Saturday: 5:00â€¯PMâ€‰â€“â€‰12:00â€¯AM, Sunday: 12:00â€¯PMâ€‰â€“â€‰12:00â€¯AM
Reviews:
['We took pizza take away, but we waited inside and there was sooo nice atmosphere ğŸ”¥and pizza was awesome!!!

Thank you very much!', 'Pizza....and Pizza...After the restaurant got bigger, it lost a bit of the atmosphere, but the food keeps the quality over many visits and gives some variation in the daily menu, so you can get surprised. Maybe the best pizza in Berlin (Maybe no more since 2019 but still good). Pasta with swordfish was delicious! Great with kids in Summer... Friendly and attentive Staff. P.S. Number 16 is really great!', "Down to earth place serving hearty southern Italian cuisine. Popular for its pizza. Large variety. We ordered both pasta and pizza and it didn't disappoint.
There were a lot of families dining when we were there during dinner. Perhaps a testament to its quality and value for money.
Servings are rather large and it's inexpensive.
Service is attentive too. Highly recommended."]

Name: Pizza Hut
Summary: Popular delivery, carry-out & dine-in chain known for pizza, wings & pasta, plus sides & desserts.

Reviews: ['My experience at Pizza Hut was quite average. The service was adequate, but nothing remarkable. The pizza itself was decent, but nothing outstanding in terms of flavor or quality. The crust was okay, but lacked that desirable crispiness. The toppings were standard, without any unique or memorable combinations. The atmosphere in the restaurant was typical for a fast-food chain, with a casual and bustling vibe. The cashier did try to sell me more than required. Overall, it was an average dining experience, suitable for a quick and convenient meal, but not something I would rave about or go out of my way to visit again.', 'Not a bad selection of pizzas but they are very high in grease', 'Just a place to eat.  Nice looking pizzas but far too greasy. We had pepperoni and salami. The staff were friendly. We got our order in good time. The food court was far too busy.']

Reviews: ['I have been here a couple of times already and always good. Last time I finally tried something else then pizza. I had some truffle gnocchi with legumes. Really delicious. As a starter we shared asparagus carpaccio which was lovely too. If you donâ€™t have a reservation this place is usually a hit of a struggle but totally worth it. Unfortunately not fully vegan but mostly!', 'Lovely place with creative vegan pizzas. I had the vegan capriossa and the vegan diavola. The Diavola was the better one, the smoky carrots and spicy chilli oil made it a good vegan rendition of the original which is usually with spicy salami, I think. Iâ€™m not too sure about the almond cream, itâ€™s kinda nice and creamy but not really the best cheese replacement I think. Minus one star because the crust was too burnt because the restaurant was way too packed. Probably come on a less busy day to get the most out of the kitchen. Service staff were lovely.', 'The first time I tried a vegetarian pizza with ingredients I never thought would taste good, I was blown away by how delicious it was. à¸­à¸£à¹ˆà¸­à¸¢à¹à¸ªà¸‡à¸­à¸­à¸à¸›à¸²à¸ \\\\(*o*)//']

Reviews: ['The food was delicious and the beer even better.  We like that the location was close to so many attractions.  Go there hungry.  Portions were large.  You might even want to share portions.', 'The food was okay to quite good depending on the dish. Portions were large. The service was horrendous. We were forgotten about and then they tried to charge us for a bottle of water that we were never brought. Also it genuinely seemed like our waiter was high. He made a jerking off motion while taking my order, questioned our age, made a comment about our nationality then mocked us.', 'I recommend this place. Excellent German restaurant. The duck was particularly good. Service overall good. Nice restaurant and atmosphere']

We took the fish platter for two and the cannoli. Wonderful sicilian wine selection.  Highly recommended when in Berlin.']

Reviews: ['Food was as ok. But the menu on the door said 5.99. We order 2 menus and paid 15.38 EUR. Feel like I was scammed.', 'My son really wanted a Subway sandwich, figured it is near the end of winter holidays so I took him into Berlin since there are none near our place and wanted a change of view. Decided to go here, as I wanted to avoid the Alexa crowds. Service was great, friendly staff, clean tables and over all it was clean. Unfortunately they no longer serve a Turkey sub, so my son went with a spicy chicken, I got the classic tuna sub. One thing, the street access door is locked, you need to enter at the side. Not sure why this is the case.', "I had luck finding this place open at 9 am in this very cold Sunday morning. Staff isn't the kindest this early in the morning but at least I could spend my next hour warm and cozy until anything else opens."]

Reviews:
['best middle eastern food tasted in Berlin, it was during middle of week, itâ€™s next to a beautiful canal, staff speaks English as well, food is amazing a true taste of Middle East. staff is friendly and price is reasonable.', 'Itâ€™s an oriental Lebanese restaurant with all decorations and vibes .
The kofta was well seasoned and smoked.
Chicken was tender and delicious.
The meat was tender and the sauce was flavorful.
The drink wasnâ€™t as expected but not bad as well.
The staff were really friendly with us
They accept card payments and cash too.', "This restaurant offers two dining options: a buffet, which I recommend, and Ã  la carte selections from the menu. We opted for lunch here, finding the food tasty, albeit slightly oily. The buffet is priced at 10 euros per person, making it a great choice for a quick and economical meal. I'd suggest this place for those looking for value and convenience."]

Reviews: ['Our first stop in Berlin! Wonderful restaurant serving up traditional German and Berlin dishes. We walked up at lunch time and got sat immediately on the sidewalk seating. Great service and atmosphere, and the portions are quite large!', 'Good wholesome well flavoured filling food. Sadly let down by poor service. Yes I am from the uk, but also when you sit outside you donâ€™t expect someone sat inside to come smoke stood near your table. Sort these bits out to go with the food and great place to eat with great location', "Sure, it's Unten den Linden but 28 for a Schnitzel seems a bit steep. Anyway, we went for a Wurstlparade and a Giant Currywurst. Told the waiter to bring also a Berliner meatball (on the menu as a possible addition to anything) and he brought the whole dish. Anyway, we were hungry. Overall, not great, not terrible."]

Name: Metzer Eck
Summary: Familiar dishes prepared in a stalwart restaurant with an old-world vibe & a sidewalk terrace.
Opening Hours: Monday: 4:00â€¯PMâ€‰â€“â€‰12:00â€¯AM, Tuesday: 4:00â€¯PMâ€‰â€“â€‰12:00â€¯AM, Wednesday: 4:00â€¯PMâ€‰â€“â€‰12:00â€¯AM, Thursday: 4:00â€¯PMâ€‰â€“â€‰12:00â€¯AM, Friday: 4:00â€¯PMâ€‰â€“â€‰12:00â€¯AM, Saturday: 6:00â€¯PMâ€‰â€“â€‰12:00â€¯AM, Sunday: Closed
Reviews:
['If you are looking for a traditional Berlin bar and food with lots of heritage you can do no better than going to Metzer Eck.

The business has been in the same family for about 100 years.

Excellent outdoor area for some good evening summer sun.. essential booking as it is always booked out.

Go inside the bar and see the heritage of it as it has not been updated with many original features like the coal fire (not working as now as part of the bar).

The Schnitzel has to be one of the best value and taste ratio I have tried in Berlin. , go for it with herb butter as super delish. I do feel other items on the menu are a little expensive for what you get but still very tasty.', "What a pleasure to eat in this authentic German restaurant.  The staff and clientele where so friendly.

Steeped in history if you can get in I'd say is a must. Next time I'm back I know where I'm getting my schnitzel", 'Awesome German food and beer at this location. Very traditional food and tasty beer to wash it back with. We had a very nice seat on the patio with great service! The inside was nice also, comfortable atmosphere and friendly staff.']

Name: Dolden MÃ¤del Ratsherrn Braugasthaus Berlin
Summary: Stylish pub pouring a wide choice of draft & bottled beers, with sandwiches & burgers plus a garden.

Reviews: ["The garden atmosphere here is excellent, and the menu offers a nice variety of food. We tried the goulash and beef stroganoff, which were okay. Service was a bit slow, but we'd return to try other dishes and enjoy the garden setting.", "Fish and chips .... needed seasonings. The only thing I could taste was oil.  Also pickled cucumbers and sour cream on the side, really doesn't pair together. Tartar sause and pickles, even anything else, than sour cream. My friends dish was a burger and he ate it like a stew because it was swimming in sauce. It was better than mine, tho. Lovely staff and place, but for the price of the food, they have some work to do.", 'I highly recommend a degustation set of beer, a â€œtrue loveâ€ set of meal and tiramisu IPA - everything was absolutely delicious!']

Name: McDonald's
Summary: Classic, long-running fast-food chain known for its burgers & fries.
