Reviews:
['This McDonaldâ€™s is easily accessible from the platforms at the station, making it a great place for a quick bite or to sit and relax before your next destination. I visited one afternoon when it was very busy, and I had to wait several minutes before one of the kiosks became available. However, when I visited in the morning, it was much quieter, and the food was prepared quickly.

Unfortunately, there are no toilet facilities, which is why Iâ€™m deducting two stars. Itâ€™s important to wash your hands before a meal, especially if you enjoy finger foods like fries or nuggets. The lack of any toilet facility is disappointing.', 'Itâ€™s just weird that there is literally NO GAS in their cola every time I visit, no matter cola regular or light or zeroğŸ¥´ if you order one, youâ€™re basically drinking sugar water that is warm, they also donâ€™t bother to put ice cubes in them anymore.
Also, if you take out, always check the bags at the counter to make sure nothing is missing, they seem to forget things sometimes.', "The food is always slow, I see many times when I have been here. The employees will be just talking and food will be lying there on the stand. I asked and showed them. They said they have to follow the order and something. They didn't even care for one cappuccino once I ordered it's been 7 mins to get one."]

Reviews: ["Went here to try something I haven't tried before, I wasn't expecting too much but TZOM FAR exceeded my expectations! Not only were the portion sizes large, everything we tried tasted incredible and the waitress was super attentive and friendly. The mixed platter for 1 was great to try out a few different flavours, the fatta was a huge portion and my personal favourite was the deep fried bread strips with minced meat and yogurt, definitely a must-try here!\n\nI've never had Eritrean food (or anything similar to it even) before, can safely say it's definitely worth checking out! We ended up paying about 51 euros in total, for the amount of food we got I'd say you can't ask for much better value.", 'Everything was beyond excellent. We loved the food from TZOM, super tasty and flavorful. The service was exceptional. Highly recommend to any foodies', 'We ordered platters to share to get a taste of everything. The food was delicious. The sauce with mushroom was on a spicier side. But the taste of everything else together balanced it. So talk to the server before ordering the food regarding the spice level, if you cannot handle the spice. In all, delicious food. Totally recommend it.']

Name: Vapiano
Summary: Laid-back restaurant featuring made-to-order fresh pasta dishes, along with pizza & salad.
Opening Hours: Monday: 11:00â€¯AMâ€‰â€“â€‰11:00â€¯PM, Tuesday: 11:00â€¯AMâ€‰â€“â€‰11:00â€¯PM, Wednesday: 11:00â€¯AMâ€‰â€“â€‰11:00â€¯PM, Thursday: 11:00â€¯AMâ€‰â€“â€‰11:00â€¯PM, Friday: 11:00â€¯AMâ€‰â€“â€‰12:30â€¯AM, Saturday: 11:00â€¯AMâ€‰â€“â€‰12:30â€¯AM, Sunday: 11:00â€¯AMâ€‰â€“â€‰11:00â€¯PM
Reviews: ["My recent experience at this restaurant was extremely disappointing. The food was absolutely terrible. We ordered the chicken Alfredo, and to our shock, it came with a mere six tiny pieces of chicken buried in a sea of bland, flavorless pasta. For a dish that costs 20â‚¬, I expected something far more substantial and satisfying. Instead, it felt like we were paying a premium price for a plate of plain pasta with barely any effort put into it. The quality of the food did not even come close to justifying the exorbitant price. I won't be returning and would advise others to avoid this place unless they want to leave hungry and disappointed. Unfortunately no fewer than one star is possible!", 'Reasonable price and superb atmosphere!  It is the first time I went to a branch of Vapiano. Everything was nicely organised. The taste of the food was also pretty good. The presentation was mouthwatering. I enjoyed their entire system. It was a great experience. If you like pasta/pizza it is a worthy place.', 'As good as it can be. Food was good, portions have big size.\nThe staff was very friendly and helpful.']

The kindness of the service and atmosphere of the restaurant were great, I really liked this old apothecary vibe. Although the food was good and extremely fresh (there was even a living worm ğŸ›in the green saladâ€¦), it took quite long between each dishes so dinner felt quite tiring due to the wait.\nOverall would recommend for the vibe.', "Great find, excellent way to try local cuisine. ['Really nice food and really nice servers! We also had the most delicious rioja with our meal. Highly recommend for lunch or dinner. Good for vegetarians too. Cozy, casual but makes for a special meal with friends or a date night.', 'Sabore by Chef Mario, near Kotti, you can experience the passion for Napolitan cuisine expressed in every dish, from their pizzas, to their pastas, antipasti and desserts

We were impressed us by the quality, presentation and taste of the pizzas, some of which have been honoured with national and international awards

We tried 3 of their pizzas, including the award-winning Pizza Liguori - The Legend (19â‚¬), Pizza Burrata & Mortadella (19â‚¬), and Pizza Diavolo â€œSaboreâ€ (17â‚¬) that came literally in flames!', 'Without a doubt, the best pizza in town! Amazing doe and the highest quality produce for toppings, including the most important ingredient: love (for pizza). Mario is a true Italian "patrone" and Maria provides amazing service. 5 stars!']

Reviews: ["I enjoyed my visit here. The staff were super friendly, which made the whole experience even better. One thing that really stood out was how fast they cooked everything. If you're in a rush, this place is perfect for grabbing a quick bite. No long waits here, just speedy service and hot food. I went for the dÃ¼rÃ¼m, and it was filling. The taste was goodâ€”nothing too crazy, but good. Plus, the portions were pretty generous, so youâ€™re definitely getting your moneyâ€™s worth. All in all, this dÃ¶ner spot has a lot going for it: friendly staff, quick service, and decent prices. It's a great pick if you need something fast and tasty.", 'It is very tasty and delicious food is delivered there. It is very strongly recommended to have your meal after a long trip and tiredness.  And the price is good and not expensive.', 'I was there at the main station after 9.30 pm, and not everything was open. So, easiest pick was kebap. I ordered a DÃ¶ner box. I have to say the kebap had a different and good taste. I picked KraÃ¼ter sauce and it was tasty. The service was a bit chaotic for me, as the person who took my order forgot to process my order. Still, I'd go back and give it another chance..", 'Few falafel joints even offer baba ganoush, let alone nail this most delicious of all Middle Eastern dishes. Their falafel, hummus, and tahini sauce are likewise on point. Overall, an unbeatable price-to-quality-to-quantity ratio, and all their vegan items are clearly labeled as such. Cash only.', 'They do the best Baba Ganoush in rollo in Berlin. The falafel is exquisite and super fresh also. And the have not increased the prices like most of the competence!!']

Family Business!
Really good Pasta, and i usually have trouble eating Pasta in Restaurants, because i love to Cook them myself.
Nice staff and good atmosphere', 'We stumbled across this restaurant while walking around Berlin. We didnâ€™t have a reservation but they were able to get us in. We sat at a small high top table behind the host stand and it was perfect (the chairs were very comfy for high top chairs).

The food was great! My husband got a truffle butter pasta that was amazing and I got a red sauce pasta. We had a great time and loved the atmosphere.']

Name: La Pecora Nera
Summary: Classic pasta dishes, grills & Italian wines in a compact venue with quirky decor.
Opening Hours: Monday: Closed, Tuesday: 5:30â€‰â€“â€‰11:30â€¯PM, Wednesday: 5:30â€‰â€“â€‰11:30â€¯PM, Thursday: 5:30â€‰â€“â€‰11:30â€¯PM, Friday: 5:30â€‰â€“â€‰11:30â€¯PM, Saturday: 5:30â€‰â€“â€‰11:30â€¯PM, Sunday: 5:30â€‰â€“â€‰11:30â€¯PM
Reviews:
['I came across this little gem today, and every bite was perfectionâ€”Bourno the Sicilian wino perfecto. I read some reviews where people mentioned that the portions are small for the price, but I disagree. I think the balance between portion size and quality is just right for a restaurant of this caliber.

I had two courses: the Romanian salad and the Gnocchi. Along with a bottle of sparkling water and a glass of wine, the total was 42 Euros. Very reasonable, in my opinion. The service was relaxed and informal, a refreshing change from the usual pretentiousness found in high-quality restaurants.

Ps nobody can pay rent or salary by serving tap water ;)', 'Overall, I liked the experience.
The food is tasty, full of flavors. But the portion sizes are too small and too pricey unfortunately (compared to same quality italian restaurants in the neighborhood). Tomato pasta cost about 15â‚¬. Wine is also quite expensive for what it is...
Staff is kind.', "Even if prices feels fancy, it's totally worth it. You can really tell how good of a quality the food is and how fresh the products are. The ( I guess ) homemade bread was a killer, we love how creative they are with their salads and the gnocchi tasted like a dream. Just wishing they had more veggie options coming soon on the menu ! Would highly recommend anyways"]

Reviews:
["The place looks nice but that is pretty much all good I can say about this place. Burger wasn't tasty at all and looked a bit sad alone one the plate and I guess the patty wasn't even freshly made. The Flammkuchen was just some piece from the freezer quickly heated in the oven. There were some thick carots in the curry dish and they were not proberly cooked and still raw in the middle. The salmon dish was alright. Would not come here again as it wasn't the cheapest place. I expected a lot more.", "On a Thursday lunchtime it was empty but was nice inside. We ordered 5 tacos (between 5 people). There was a long wait for the food, so long in fact that two of our group  that were booked into a timed museum slot had to get it to go and pay â‚¬5 each for reusable boxes (shame we are tourists and leaving today). The food was very tasty and we'll presented (when it did come). 3 tacos pp.

To improve it I would have liked the option to add a spicy sause or for a spicy sause on the table (and for it to come a bit quicker).

If there were more than a few people here at a couple of tables, I wonder just how long the wait would be!", 'Nice vibe, maybe music too loud, waiters are kind. A bit pricy compared to other places in Berlin, however we are in a very touristic place.

The bathroom is not inside the restaurant.

I took a Duck Burger, I didnâ€™t like the fact that there were also the duck skin in it. Overall it was really tasty.

I went on a Saturday, at 14:30, lot of tables were reserved. Probably itâ€™s better to book in advance.']

Name: Skykitchen
Summary: Innovative global dishes & sweeping city views from a sleek 12th-floor space with edgy decor.
Opening Hours: Monday: Closed, Tuesday: Closed, Wednesday: 6:00â€‰â€“â€‰11:00â€¯PM, Thursday: 6:00â€‰â€“â€‰11:00â€¯PM, Friday: 6:00â€‰â€“â€‰11:00â€¯PM, Saturday: 6:00â€‰â€“â€‰11:00â€¯PM, Sunday: Closed
Reviews:
['We had the perfect sky view of the golden hour while having the dessert. Their serving was perfectly just in time until sundown. Excellent service, knowledgeable and attentive team, and the courses were just amazing. I appreciate that they were willing to customise the courses to adjust to my crustacean-molluscan allergy. It truly was an experience to remember and the greatest place to celebrate my boyfriendâ€™s birthday. â¤ï¸

Thank you, Team Skykitchen ğŸŒ¸', 'Amazing degustation menu from beginning until the end with a perfect service and a wonderful view.', 'Decor and ambience reminds me of Alice in wonderland and or Peter Pan â€œfairy tale like.â€ The seating arrangement for 2 person if you like a view is against the lining of the window facing outwards (like in a cafe) as oppose to traditional two person  table top in the middle of the room. The kitchen was behind us with glass over so it was â€œopen kitchenâ€ concept and I love to observe the team as they were super focused.

The staff does extremely well speaking in German and English. They were very personable and provided their favorite wines and were knowledgeable of their menu. Definitely Michelin worthy service. Each dish was presented with an attentive explanation.

The menu i believe is fusion cuisine featuring molecular gastronomy. The â€œonsen egg.â€ was the star of the evening and also their chocolate at the end for dessert. I want to point out the wine menu is very unique and noteworthy due to the fact it features mainly wines from Germany and eastwards. We selected the Slovenian bottle that is only carried at this restaurant and it paired beautifully with the dishes. Highly recommend this bottle if you get a chance to try it.']

Name: Hindi
Summary: Spicy meat & veg curries, plus grills & rice dishes in a chic venue with exposed brick walls.

Reviews:
['Server was super nice. You get a free chip thing and sauces which I love. Food was good although Iâ€™ve had better. I wish there was a bit more chicken in the chicken korma. Street is quiet and they have plenty of outdoor seating. Would definitely go back!', "This restaurant is amazing! Great prices for amazing food! When I came to them, it turned out that they serve lunch of the day and it's 7.50-7.90 for a full meal with soup. I was scared about the high prices in Berlin, but it's not true. I got a great, delicious soup, main meat dish, delicious, tender chicken, basmati rice and naan. After 8 hours without food, I was immensely happy. By the way, if I'm not mistaken, all the neighborhood restaurants offer a more expensive lunch. Thank you so much for that lunch!", 'Really good food at an amazing price.

Good quality Indian curry served in nice surroundings. The menu has lots of options for those wanting meat, fish or vegetables.

They sell cocktails, milkshakes and have beer on draught.

We had four main courses with rice,  naan bread and dessert... And a few beers. And we spent less than 100â‚¬. We all left feeling full.

There is plenty of parking across the street.']

Family Business!
Really good Pasta, and i usually have trouble eating Pasta in Restaurants, because i love to Cook them myself.
Nice staff and good atmosphere', 'We stumbled across this restaurant while walking around Berlin. We didnâ€™t have a reservation but they were able to get us in. We sat at a small high top table behind the host stand and it was perfect (the chairs were very comfy for high top chairs).

The food was great! My husband got a truffle butter pasta that was amazing and I got a red sauce pasta. We had a great time and loved the atmosphere.']

I visited this space with a group of 5 people and we ended up ordering several dishes, ending up becoming a tasting which ended with a delicious dessert.

I also highlight the friendliness of those who served us, and the versatility of having two menus: One in German and the other in English.

The Final Price: 110â‚¬.', 'Nice local restaurant with friendly greek atmosphere. The food was good but they messed the order, thatâ€™s why itâ€™s 4 of 5']

Reviews: ['Such a marvelous restaurant. It is a bit off the track but if you like (or want to try) real authentic Taiwanese cuisine go there!\nGreat Service awesome Tea selection (and presentation). Awesome Brunch on weekends.', 'The special breakfast menu on the weekends is a treat. The taste is rich but balanced. The sides a varied and tasty as well. The whole package together with the atmosphere make for a cozy and fulfilling dining experience and guarantee a good start into your weekend.', 'It is a very nice small but comfortable restaurant specializing with Taiwan food. They have different menus for weekend brunch and normal dinner. I have not tried their normal dinner menu yet, but I really enjoyed the brunch there. The porridge with meat and the pickled fruit were so nice. I would not recommend a spontaneous visiting, it is better to have a reservation beforehead.']

Reviews: ['We went for family dinner on the Christmas Eve ğŸŒ² We ordered a couple beers and a Long Island Ice Tea for drinks. For dinner we just went for the main course item. We got a beef steak ğŸ¥©, pork steak, halloumi salad ğŸ¥— and a Euphoria burger ğŸ” with fries ğŸŸ. The food was amazing, so was the service. Being a burger fanatic, I personally loved their burger with a soft bun and perfectly cooked patty topped with veggies and a fried runny egg. The fries were fresh and tasted delicious. I will surely be visiting soon just for the great burger. Thank you for a great evening.', 'I love the cozy atmosphere here. So warm and clean, but does not look so expensive from the outside. I was with an old friend of mine who does often visit this place. For me, it was my first experience. I tried "euphoria"-signature drink, just the same with the restaurant\'s name. It wasn\'t expensive at all. During happy hour, all cocktails cost 6,90â‚¬.', 'Aceptable prices, aperol spritz definitely well balanced and a good service even in the busier days. I can not complain. The football day, they used 5 projectors to see the match.']

Reviews: ['Tiny yet very Berlin club. Design, music and friendly atmosphere.', "I loved the experience, I will definitely enjoy it again. The atmosphere is super queer, people don't bother you at all, it is a great space for dissent and freedom. The accessible entrance. Beer not so expensive. The only thing I could suggest is that the bathrooms were always clean. For the rest, get ready to spend an excellent night full of music to enjoy freely.", 'It is one of the most friendly places in Berlin. Amazing crew and good sound system']

Name: Zur Haxe
Summary: Waiting staff in dirndls & lederhosen serve meaty dishes like pork knuckle at this Bavarian stop.
Opening Hours: Monday: 4:00â€¯PMâ€‰â€“â€‰12:00â€¯AM, Tuesday: 4:00â€¯PMâ€‰â€“â€‰12:00â€¯AM, Wednesday: Closed, Thursday: 4:00â€¯PMâ€‰â€“â€‰12:00â€¯AM, Friday: 4:00â€¯PMâ€‰â€“â€‰12:00â€¯AM, Saturday: 12:00â€¯PMâ€‰â€“â€‰12:00â€¯AM, Sunday: 12:00â€¯PMâ€‰â€“â€‰12:00â€¯AM
Reviews:
["Bavarian themed restaurant, serving up a host of traditional German/Bavarian meals, from schnitzel, sauerkraut, dumplings, and their speciality slow cooked (roasted and boiled) pork knuckle and lamb shank dishes.
The restaurant is beautifully decorated in traditional Bavarian decor, and the staff is kitted out in traditional outfits, which adds to the experience - one waiter, who is a funny friendly guy, even went so far as to grow an impressive beard (see pics)
Even more impressive is the food, which is rustik and homely. I had the goulash soup as a starter, which was hearty with a full depth of flavour, with a generous portion of thick cut veg and chunks of beef, and a generous portion. I then had the slow roast pork knuckle, with potato dumplings and sauerkraut, with a kind of gravy sauce. The pork fell off the bone, and was tender and moist, coated with a beautifully crisp and fatty crackling, which was all made to work with the sauce and sauerkraut to cut through the richness of the fat.
The portion sizes were HUGE, and definitely something you could share with 2 people, if you don't feel like you could face a whole portion on your own, which I had to force myself to do.
I had a look at the schnitzel another table had next to me, and vowed to go back just to try that when next in Berlin, it looked so good!
As well as the amazing food, the staff were super warm, friendly, and accommodating. I turned up without a booking, and they happily squeezed me in between bookings without making me feel a nuisance.
I had a lovely pint of Warsteiner with the meal, and all in all it came to only â‚¬30.50 (Â£25) which, in the UK could easily be double that amount. Considering the portions are enough for 2, then I'd say that's great value for money.
I can't recommend this place more!", 'Homely Bavarian restaurant with lovely warm atmosphere. The food is great, the service is always very good.', 'A nice and traditional German restaurant with spacious and cozy environment. The foods are very clean and delicious. I specially like schnitzel a lot. The desserts here are very delicious and not too sweet. Vanilla ice cream is perfect taste. I recommend to visit this place. The staff are nice and friendly.']

The service people bring it to the table and later you pay it upstairs.", 'A nice and cozy place in a beautiful location. The food was delicious.', 'Staring at the bottom of my radler (beer-lemonade) I must say the atmosphere is very local, very much Pankow district, and it is enjoyable. I have eaten here in the past and it is tasty, without pomp or pretense, much how I personally like things to be.']

The food was quite good, featuring typical German dishes, and they served beer from their own brewery.\n\nIn our case, the service was friendly and excellent. The prices were reasonable and average for Berlin, making it an affordable option.', "We've had a dinner at that place. Food quality was very good and the beer was excellent which they produce and have their own brand. Cosy atmosphere and very friendly young lady who served us. We were very about everything."]

Name: SuppengrÃ¼n
Summary: Cozy restaurant serving seasonally changing soups, salads & quiches, plus housemade loaves of bread.

Reviews:
['Such welcoming and helpful staff when a group of us visited for breakfast! They have such a range of delicious breakfast items, from scrambled eggs and baguettes, to Bircher muesli pots, fruit pots, and an assortment of croissants including vegan croissants.

Delicious hot chocolate and a marzipan croissant, and the Bircher muesli was also fresh and beautifully presented.', 'What more could you want from a place than really well constructed foods across the board..salads, soups, rolls and cakes, as earnest as a tee totaller at a wake. Service is patient and on point...the variety surprisingly wide for the size of the place. Every block on the planet should have a place like this.
BUT, they need to train in coffee making...it too is very berlin', 'One of the best restaurants in Berlin. I had the soup, salad, and a dessert. Everything made here tastes so fresh, flavorful, and good. Service is amazing! And they take credit cards.']

The staff is always so kind and friendly and the portions are huge and very tasty!

5/5 ğŸ™‚', 'This is perfect restaurant to treat your taste buds for Vietnamese food. I being a frequent visitor to this place have tried multiple Vietnamese dishes and have to say they are worth it for the price they are offering.

The staff working here is really helpful and if you are first time visitor to this place they will help you to choose a perfect dish according to your interest.

This place offers both veg and non-veg food so you have big menu to try from.

Always served piping hot and freshly prepared noodles, chicken and veg options. You can visit here for breakfast, Lunch and Dinner.

The payment can be made by card or cash depending on the option you have available with you.

And most importantly, they have both English as well as German Menu Card so they can serve a large number of customers( yes, staff speaks fluent English ğŸ˜€ and obviously German).

Enjoy your dish and hit like if you find this review helpful.

['First time the Boston cream disappoints... First I noticed the lighter yellow color which is maybe normal but the taste was not yummy as it used to, I did not feel at all the vanilla...', "Be aware not to get scammed there by the cashier!!

I bought one bottle of water and one Cola, the cashier charged me 7.5â‚¬ cash, didn't even type it in the system or give a receipt.. I told her that it's sounds strange and too expensive while she said thats the price..

I passed there another time when someone else was on shift, out of curiosity - purchased something again, the other cashier typed that into the system, the price became much lower!!

Be aware with some ppl that work there and take advantage on you.", 'Tremendously rude woman at the front desk. Literally texting and not bothering to look up from her phone. Reviews:
["Simple place, serving great and very cheap freshly cooked food. We just had a spinach and cheese gozleme and a drink, sitting outside in the evening, all of which was really pleasant. It was quiet when we arrived but by the time that we left,  all 4 outdoor tables were full. It's a popular place! There is indoor seating too.
No alcohol is served here and because of street construction works that are going on in the daytime, it was very quiet and peaceful at 9pm on a Saturday evening.
The main chef speaks English too which helped us
Like so many other  places in Berlin, it's a cash only place.", 'First time trying manti and surprisingly taste so good. The yoghurt sauce was not overpowering, overall everything combined very well. Definitely will come back. They also sell the manti for you to cook at home', 'Excellent manti (had the classic) gozleme (had with chilli and cheese) and borek and great prices. Yes,  I actually ate all of this, alone. Thatâ€™s how delish it all was. You can see the women in the back room rolling out the dough and making the manti from scratch.']

Name: Hindi

Reviews:
['Server was super nice. You get a free chip thing and sauces which I love. Food was good although Iâ€™ve had better. I wish there was a bit more chicken in the chicken korma. Street is quiet and they have plenty of outdoor seating. Would definitely go back!', "This restaurant is amazing! Great prices for amazing food! When I came to them, it turned out that they serve lunch of the day and it's 7.50-7.90 for a full meal with soup. I was scared about the high prices in Berlin, but it's not true. I got a great, delicious soup, main meat dish, delicious, tender chicken, basmati rice and naan. After 8 hours without food, I was immensely happy. By the way, if I'm not mistaken, all the neighborhood restaurants offer a more expensive lunch. Thank you so much for that lunch!", 'Really good food at an amazing price.

Good quality Indian curry served in nice surroundings. The menu has lots of options for those wanting meat, fish or vegetables.

They sell cocktails, milkshakes and have beer on draught.

We had four main courses with rice,  naan bread and dessert... And a few beers. And we spent less than 100â‚¬. We all left feeling full.

There is plenty of parking across the street.']

4) ğŸ‘nice decorations and atmosphere
5) ğŸ‘many parking spots in front of the building

6) ğŸ‘serving time is little bit long. We were able to start eating 45 minutes after we sit our table.', 'Nice venue and outside area. Great staff. Name: Villa Rodizio
Summary: High-ceilinged, art nouveau venue combining churrascaria, Mexican cantina & Argentine steakhouse.

Reviews: ["Enjoyable Rodizio style restaurant on the outskirts of town. They are very happy to please you. I had a tough piece of beef, which was inedible and they couldn't do enough to put it right! Basic but satisfactory salad bar, excellent service. I would happily visit again.", 'What a great experience! A ten course meat feast sounds impossible,  but the way it is done is really good. They bring the skewers of the different meats straight from the spit and carve off washer you want at the table. There is good variety,  and buffet vegetables and salad to go with it. Make sure you are hungry when you go! The service we got from Angelo was excellent. Friendly and helpful. Highly recommend', 'Great food, huge variety at the buffet. Meat has never stopped for a minute. Food was delicious, service was friendly and proficient. We had a great time!']

Name: Tangs Kantine
Summary: Dim sum & classic Szechuan & Shanghai cuisine served in a modest eatery with a sidewalk terrace.
Reviews:
['Tasty authentic food. I ate dimsams, a small portion of wonton soup and cucumber salad (be careful, it is really spicy. I ll be glad to return here. Any smell of cooking in the restaurant, by the way.', 'It gets really busy during lunch time, cash payment only. Food was tasty, love their fluffy white rice!', 'Had imagined itâ€™s a good authentic Chinese place. Maybe it is, if we go back and try some more selections. But overall, it was pretty underwhelming.

Seating outdoors is possible and we got the wok tips (fried dumplings) and the Shanghai Ente and Ente im GlÃ¼ck. Neither of them are that great, the dumplings were fine, nothing spectacular.

Starters came out pretty quick, but food took a pretty long time to come out. So as mentioned earlier, give it a shot but it wouldnâ€™t be on my list of recommendations. An average place for me.']

Name: Brasserie Am Gendarmenmarkt
Summary: Elegant restaurant with wood paneling, murals & brass lamps, serving modern European dishes.
Opening Hours: Monday: 12:00â€‰â€“â€‰11:00â€¯PM, Tuesday: 12:00â€‰â€“â€‰11:00â€¯PM, Wednesday: 12:00â€‰â€“â€‰11:00â€¯PM, Thursday: 12:00â€‰â€“â€‰11:00â€¯PM, Friday: 12:00â€‰â€“â€‰11:00â€¯PM, Saturday: 5:00â€‰â€“â€‰11:00â€¯PM, Sunday: Closed
Reviews:
["We had a lovely time here. Everything was really perfect from start to finish. Especially the super attentive service and then obviously the food.
The Bouillabaisse is incredible. The depth of flavor while having a big selection of seafood in it was amazing. But also the tartar and the creme brulee were superb.

I'll definitely come back for a nice occasion as this restaurant definitely hits the mark :)", 'We really loved our dinner there tonight, as the food and atmosphere were really good. Our server was very nice but not really attentive after serving us our main course. She completely disappeared and never checked bag on us for over half an hour.

My wife had the seafood bouillabaise, which was delicious, and I went more traditional with the blood sausage, which I thought was spectacular! We loved our meal tonight, but the service was very cold and and fell flat as the meal went on.', "The Brasserie am Gendarmenmarkt in Berlin offers a delightful culinary experience, seamlessly blending traditional flavors with modern flair. The pumpkin soup, a standout starter, impresses with its creamy texture and a harmonious blend of spices, providing a comforting yet sophisticated taste. The beef  stew, the highlight of the meal, is a masterful display of culinary artistry. Tender, succulent pieces of veal are simmered to perfection, enveloped in a rich, flavorful sauce that complements the meat's natural flavors. Accompanied by a fresh, crisp side salad, the meal achieves a satisfying balance. The brasserie's ambiance, characterized by elegance and a warm, welcoming atmosphere, enhances the dining experience, making it a must-visit destination for both locals and tourists seeking authentic, high-quality German cuisine in Berlin."]

Name: Shezan
Summary: Spicy curries & biryanis at a canalside restaurant with an annex on a richly decorated, moored boat.
Opening Hours: Monday: 11:30â€¯AMâ€‰â€“â€‰10:30â€¯PM, Tuesday: 11:30â€¯AMâ€‰â€“â€‰10:30â€¯PM, Wednesday: 11:30â€¯AMâ€‰â€“â€‰10:30â€¯PM, Thursday: 11:30â€¯AMâ€‰â€“â€‰10:30â€¯PM, Friday: 11:30â€¯AMâ€‰â€“â€‰10:30â€¯PM, Saturday: 11:30â€¯AMâ€‰â€“â€‰10:30â€¯PM, Sunday: 11:30â€¯AMâ€‰â€“â€‰10:30â€¯PM
Reviews:
['This is my first review in Berlin German and what a success it was..staff so friendly and helpful they made a chicken dansak curry for me that is not on the menu.the food was outstanding and good size portions,I highly recommend this Indian restaurant if your out and about in Berlinâ€¦.', 'Really cool restaurant with amazing decorations, styles and atmosphere. The location is unique with possibility to sit directly beside the river. The food portions are big enough and reflect the prices. They provide special meals during business lunch hours (11:00 - 16:00) from Monday to Friday with only 8,90â‚¬. The food is very delicious and tasty. The restaurant is very chick and elegant. Staff are very nice and friendly and also English speaking. Highly recommended.', 'We visited this place today on a rainy evening for dinner and truth be told, we were pretty satisfied with the food. Though it was a bit confusing from the menu as the dish descriptions are not appetizing, the taste was okay.

We started with mango Lassi which was a little bland. Then our main course dishes were Chicken Mughlai and Mutton bhuna with Basmati Rice. Both tasted good. Nothing overwhelming but good. Obviously the preparations were not authentic.

We finished off with Elaichi milk tea which was okay but also lacked depth of flavor. The liquor was also pretty light.

To sum it up, room for improvement is everywhere.']

Name: Cookies Cream
Summary: Innovative plant-based dishes like seaweed caviar at a renowned venue accessed via an alleyway.
Opening Hours: Monday: Closed, Tuesday: 6:30â€‰â€“â€‰11:00â€¯PM, Wednesday: 6:30â€‰â€“â€‰11:00â€¯PM, Thursday: 6:30â€‰â€“â€‰11:00â€¯PM, Friday: 5:00â€‰â€“â€‰11:00â€¯PM, Saturday: 5:00â€‰â€“â€‰11:00â€¯PM, Sunday: Closed
Reviews:
['Ordered the 7 courses. Overall an incredible vegetarian culinary experience. Each dish was creative/novel, a unique menu filled with combinations that surprised me.

A interesting juxtaposition between the casual atmosphere and the Michelin starred fine dining experience. Eccentric decor. Service was impeccable.

7 courses was 140 euros. Was able to get 15% off by booking online a couple days ahead of time.', "Visiting this restaurant is an adventure in itself. The location is truly unique and getting there is an experience in its own right. The restaurant is situated in a remote area, and the journey to reach it takes you through a scenic route that sets the perfect mood for a culinary journey. Upon arrival, we were warmly greeted by Martha, who provided us with exceptionally friendly and professional service throughout the evening. Her attention to detail and warm smile immediately made us feel at home. Every dish served was a true culinary masterpiece. It's evident that great care and thought goes into both the presentation and flavor of the dishes. The creations on our plates were not only visually appealing but also a delight for the taste buds. While the restaurant offers carefully selected paired drinks with each course, I found this personal touch not essential. The dishes themselves were so exquisite that the non-alcoholic beverages, while tasty on their own, didn't add significant value to the experience. The flavors of the dishes stood well on their own without this additional pairing. Overall, it was an evening to remember, and I look forward to experiencing this culinary adventure again soon. This restaurant is definitely worth revisiting! Sofie - Belgium", 'I had a wonderful time. The staff was really friendly and helpful, each dish was more beautiful than the other - as well as delicious - and the wine selection is on point. Plan to take your time and enjoy the experience!']

Reviews:
["A restaurant where you can enjoy German cuisine.
The atmosphere in the back garden was nice and open, but it felt a bit cramped due to the number of tables.
The waiter was very friendly, and I didn't experience any of the negative impressions mentioned in other reviews.
The food was tasty, but not exceptionally delicious considering the price.", 'A classic - the schnitzel was so great. Will definitely be back when in Berlin. We also tried the steak tartar and it was excellent!', 'The best place to try the Wiener Schnitzel. The portions were massive, you can share 1 for 2 people. I liked the veal, potato salad and the cranberry sauce. Passion martini was also good. The restaurant has a nice ambiance but tables are too close to each other and it can get loud sometimes.']

['Very good coffee shop for a quick breakfast. Food prices are also highly reasonable. Tastes incredible, and they have a wide selection to choose from. Cold salads, sandwiches, focaccia, cakes, cookies, you name it.

Overall: recommended.']

Reviews:
['Really nice food and really nice servers! We also had the most delicious rioja with our meal. Highly recommend for lunch or dinner. Good for vegetarians too. Cozy, casual but makes for a special meal with friends or a date night.', 'Sabore by Chef Mario, near Kotti, you can experience the passion for Napolitan cuisine expressed in every dish, from their pizzas, to their pastas, antipasti and desserts

We were impressed us by the quality, presentation and taste of the pizzas, some of which have been honoured with national and international awards

We tried 3 of their pizzas, including the award-winning Pizza Liguori - The Legend (19â‚¬), Pizza Burrata & Mortadella (19â‚¬), and Pizza Diavolo â€œSaboreâ€ (17â‚¬) that came literally in flames!', 'Without a doubt, the best pizza in town! Amazing doe and the highest quality produce for toppings, including the most important ingredient: love (for pizza). Mario is a true Italian "patrone" and Maria provides amazing service. 5 stars!']

Name: Izumi Restaurant-Sushi Bar & Lieferservice
Summary: Compact dining room with Japanese hanging lamps, banquette seating & freshly prepared sushi dishes.
Reviews:
["Very friendly and helpful stuff. Delicious and fresh sushi. Waiter Alex is a very nice and kind person. He helped me to select the sushi and generally just made my day. I am so happy that people, who are working here truly love their job and people. Alex is very professional. I can feel that he really loves his job. I am always feeling better, when I visit such kind of places, where people cook and work with love. Izumi Restaurant is a really good place to visit. It's a restaurant, where I would like to come back again and again.
I think that the true success of the restaurant depends not just on food, but also on the emotions and atmosphere, that people create. I am really glad that this restaurant really cares about the people's experience and does not let the people stay alone with hard choices. They are always ready to help, give good advice and help to make a good choice. Waiters here can find a good approach to every client. Thank you for a great experience ğŸ‘
Food itself was very good ğŸ‘ High level sushi quality, a little bit warm rice ğŸš. Everything how it should be.
ğŸ£ Authentic and delicious sushi ğŸ£ğŸ£
Definitely recommend to everyone
Green tea ğŸµ ğŸ¨ ice-cream with lichy 10/10
Definitely RECOMMEND to everyone !", 'Mediocre sushi place. Food is literally just OK. Not worth taking a detour for
Place was empty despite euro finals weekend and served by a single waitress.', 'This was an exiting experience. Very very fresh sushi. Very tasty. Thanks for the chief cook. Good service. We will definitely come back to try again!!!']

Reviews:
['Vox Restaurant Berlin offers a unique dining experience in Berlin with delicious, high-quality dishes. Enjoy fresh ingredients, great flavors, and excellent service in a welcoming atmosphereâœ¨
I enjoyed a fantastic 5-course menu featuring dishes like salmon, lobster soup, cod fish, beef sirloin with potato spaghetti, and desserts ğŸ¨', 'We had dinner at the Vox the first night we stayed at the Grand Hyatt. We decided to go for sushi as we had not had sushi for quite a while.
We can only say that it was tremendously well prepared and tasted like a dream. The fish quality outstanding.

After having such a great experience we went back the next evening and went for the a la carte. Again we were not disappointed at all. Our food was delicious with very interesting flavors and very well balanced.

We also have to mention the exceptional service given by Felix and Nikolai. They are hosts by heart and made every evening memorable.', 'Excellent Vox Tasting Menu with an amazing friendly service. Itâ€™s a 4-course menu, including wine pairing for 89â‚¬. The price is more than fair with interesting wines and great meat quality.
10â‚¬ a bottle of water is however outrageous.']

I also highlight the friendliness of those who served us, and the versatility of having two menus: One in German and the other in English.

The Final Price: 110â‚¬.', 'Nice local restaurant with friendly greek atmosphere. The food was good but they messed the order, thatâ€™s why itâ€™s 4 of 5']

Name: CafÃ© & Bistro freysinn

Reviews: ['Delicious food, you can go every day and you will find a wide range of options. Vegan and not vegan but healthy.', "The food was nice, great value for price but the service was terrible. We didn't feel welcome at all as we are clearly tourists. The woman who took our order didn't even try to speak slowly in order we could understand the german menu, even though we do understand german, and was very impatient for us to make our choice. When we asked for something to drink, she just pointed at the fridge without any explanation. It was good because we were looking for something in this area, but wouldn't come back for it.", 'Nice cozy local place with a great selection of business lunches for ~ 8 Euro.']

Name: The Tree
Summary: Szechuan rice bowls, noodle soups & small plates in a high-ceilinged space with eclectic decor.
Reviews: ['The interior design is very creative, with a touch of beauty that makes the space stand out, even if itâ€™s not the most comfortable. The art and atmosphere make up for it. The food was decent, and the vegetarian dishes are clearly highlighted on the menu.', 'Very friendly staff, good food.\nWe ordered the noodle soup with 3 different types of tofu and the mapo tofu with noodles (calla).\nThe food was ready within minutes. They serve the noodles with fresh vegetables (radish, carrots, cucumber, arugula, tomatoes) and in some spicy chilly oil. The noodle soup was not spicy at all. You can see on the menu which dishes are spicy and which are not. The beauty tea with goji, dates and rose petals was also very special and delicious. You can sit inside and outside. Very nice atmosphere. I would definitely go out to eat there again!', 'Food was actually good but charging 2â‚¬ for extra chilli oil is a bit too much!']

Reviews: ["Nice selection of dishes. We initially came there because we saw pictures of Sushi in Google, however this place no longer offers sushi. But the other dishes we tried were good. The prices were IMHO higher as usual in this area, but the main dishes are really large and satisfying.\nIt's quite well located, near a tram station.\nIt's recommended to reserve a table before coming.", 'Solid Asian restaurant in Pankow, and for me, one of the best in the area. The menu has great choices, and the portions are generous. Prices have gone up a bit, but this is not surprising, especially considering the current inflation. Still a go-to spot for satisfying Asian cuisine!', "Nice atmosphere and very delicious food. We had salmon teriyaki dish and another dish with meat and noodle. They were both very delicious and big portion. Usually I don't get full from eating fish but the salmon piece they gave was very big. The oyster mushrooms in my dish were also super delicious. Moreover the waiters were also very polite. I can't recommend this restaurant enough!"]

Reviews: ["My recent experience at this restaurant was extremely disappointing. The food was absolutely terrible. We ordered the chicken Alfredo, and to our shock, it came with a mere six tiny pieces of chicken buried in a sea of bland, flavorless pasta. For a dish that costs 20â‚¬, I expected something far more substantial and satisfying. Instead, it felt like we were paying a premium price for a plate of plain pasta with barely any effort put into it. The quality of the food did not even come close to justifying the exorbitant price. I won't be returning and would advise others to avoid this place unless they want to leave hungry and disappointed. Unfortunately no fewer than one star is possible!", 'Reasonable price and superb atmosphere!  It is the first time I went to a branch of Vapiano. Everything was nicely organised. The taste of the food was also pretty good. The presentation was mouthwatering. I enjoyed their entire system. It was a great experience. If you like pasta/pizza it is a worthy place.', 'As good as it can be. Food was good, portions have big size.\nThe staff was very friendly and helpful.']
